We are still working on getting him to steer around thing but he will get the hang of it soon. Product looks great, had all of the pieces, took about 2 hours to fully assemble, arrived quickly. Definitely worth the money we spent.

title: Five Stars

title: Four Stars

title: Great Fun!
text: We ordered one similar to this 3 years ago when our son was 2.5years old.  It was easy for him to steer and he quickly caught on.  3 years later at 5.5 years he still loves riding it.  We have had no trouble with the battery charging or run time.  We did however spend more $ on 2 12 inch bicycle tires, cut the sidewalls off and slipped them over the back wheels no glue needed.  He has so much better traction and 3 years later they rubber tires are still in place!

title: Would recommend it
text:
We bought this for our 3 yo son for Xmas. We thought he could use it in the basement over the cold winter.

He's never had a power wheel before so when he tried it inside, even setting 1 startled him how fast it responded and how fast it went. So we had to wait for spring to take it outside.

Works in the grass decently and up and down small slopes. His favorite is to use it in our garage/double driveway area though.

All in all, I'm happy with the purchase and would recommend it to you. Holds a charge well (I don't charge it as often as they say) and recharges fast when you you notice it slowing down and plug it in for a couple hours or overnight.

Only cons: the tires are hard plastic of course so in certain circumstances it doesn't grip too: going up grassy hills but it still usually manages. The hood in the "engine" sort of fits inside the bottom part of the frame but 1 side pops out and overhangs. Doesn't affect function just not as esthetically pleasing. Also, the plastic pin for the wagon hookup doesn't turn and lock as it's supposed to; ours just has to sit in the hole and it doesn't bounce out

title: Very happy with my purchase.
text: This was a gift for my grandchild a year and a half ago. He still rides it all over my 1.5 acre grass yard. It is stored on the carport at night but it's been rained on and the Florida sun has beat down on it for two summers. The color has not faded. The battery life is the same as when purchased (we only charge it when it's completely dead). The only thing that has gotten broken on it is one of the wheel fenders that my grandson bent backwards. The pull behind cart is still in excellent condition and carries his toys all over the place. We attached a bicycle cup holder and a horn to the tractor. The grandson loved it! The radio doesn't pick up very many stations. And it resets every time you turn the radio off. So we have to find a station rather often at times. But that's really my only complaint. This is a fantastic toy that has gotten a lot of use and enjoyment.

title: Awesomeness

I bought this for my 3 yr old 2 months ago. He drives it around our land all day every day. Its prob the best gift hes got. Hopefully he won't bust any tires but so far we love it.
This wasn't too challenging to put together. My husband and I got it done prob roughly 1 1/2 hrs

We have a few hills in my yard and the tractor can't get up the hills, in fact it once flipped over backwards while he was attempting to drive up a hill.  But, again, my loves loves this tractor and doesn't mind at all that he has to push the tractor up the hill.

title: Next year, I will wait a little longer before ...
text: Next year, I will wait a little longer before purchasing items this large.  This ended up going on sale as a Top Deal after it was already purchased!

title: Pay Attention to the Details
text:
The workmanship in the fabrication of these parts is so-so. Also, a word of caution for you if you are not somewhat savvy with reading and following directions - there are steps that are skipped in their entirety in the assembly process. If you’re not savvy with putting things together these directions can be confusing. You can do it but TAKE YOUR TIME.

There are points of assembly that I was disappointed in. There are no working headlights. I knew they would not be but think for the amount spent it could have been something featured as well. The front most plastic piece you screw onto the front end is not a weight-bearing attachment. Please do not pick up by that piece - make sure you pick it up by the actual undercarriage. Otherwise you will probably break it by lifting from that piece after a few times. Additionally, the radio is installed before you put the steering wheel on. I’m not so sure you can just take that off without taking the steering wheel off. I will follow up a review after six months to see how it continues to hold up. I also will have to do some rework on the cart wheels. They started coming loose when my son was riding it around. The trailer hitch goes on easy but I tried to take it off later and I could not get it to budge. But it won’t arbitrarily fall off, which is a positive thing.

I don’t want to focus on the negative - there are plenty of good to this item and our son really enjoys it so far. The radio really works. I had to release the selector button (it was installed incorrectly from the factory), but I had preselected a good station for my son before we surprised him with it. The seat and arm rests were a good fit for him. The battery has lasted for a fair amount of time so far - if you follow the recommendations on the instructions regarding charging it I’m certain it will last for quite a bit but READ THOSE INSTRUCTIONS! Most of the issues I have found were minor compared to reviews where people talked about the battery not working after a few months - I don’t know how the parent/grandparents maintained it, but the manufacturer is very specific on what to do.

It drives well in the grass but high grass with an incline might require a little “parent power” to assist.

It’s a good toy that I think will last for some time if my son takes care of it and I help by doing the required battery maintenance, but to rough handle it, I would think it wouldn’t hold up for very long. But that’s where adult supervision comes into play. I am not disappointed in my purchase but it’s not a carefree item. You will get out of it what you invest in it with proper maintenance and upkeep.

title: Five Stars
text: Grandson will love it.

title: the front.
text: This was ok, but it is cheaply made. It fell apart pretty easily, especially the front. We have had ours a little over a year, and for something that was barely used for two summers it is already a mess because the front is falling off. the grill popped out from the beginning, and when backing up the back trailer gets stuck and doesnt move or flips, so we had to take that off. title: Great buy!
text: Works great, definitely requires some assembly, but nothing to difficult. We've been using it pretty regularly in the low gear and the battery lasts for a long time. The plastic is a bit flimsy, and of course it could be made a bit better for the amount of money they charge you, but overall it has held together well and we are happy with it. I would definitely recommend this if your interested, and I would buy it again after owning it and seeing how much our kids enjoy it. Hopefully it will hold up to the test of time. It's been in use for a little over a month now. Will update this if anything major happens. We have tested out the use of the higher gear and it's pretty quick, which will be great as our oldest gets more comfortable with it, but he's pretty content with the first speed level for now.

title: Great quality!

title: Do not buy

title: One star off for assembly
text:
I bought this tractor for my 2 1/2 year old grandson. I have a large property and I thought he would like it to help me garden. I was pleased when it came to see that most of it was already assembled. The instructions are annoying...pictures on one page and then you have to flip to another page to see the written corresponding instructions. That being said, it was not hard to assemble, I did it myself in a little over an hour. A couple of issues I hope to have you avoid...when assembling the trailer, the side pieces have a tab that will slide into the front piece, if you're not paying attention like me, and you have the tabs facing the back of the trailer, they are a pain in the butt to get out again...be warned... Next, putting the rod in the tires, first you have to put this clawed like washer on and they instruct you to use a mallet to get it to hold...well, I only had a hammer and the damn thing did not hold easily...by the time I got it to hold, I had flattened and spread out the base of the rod from all my banging which made the rod end too wide for the tire holes to be passed through. With enough banging I was able to bore my way through with the rod but I spent an additional half hour doing it. Once that was done it was assembled very quickly and stickers were easy to place.
The battery: I don't know if they changed the design since I read the older reviews, but you DO NOT need to take out the battery to charge it... I just unplugged the unit and plugged in my charger cord, couldn't have been easier.
The ride: Well my grandson was attracted more to the radio than the tractor, he absolutely loved it! Once on the tractor, he got a bit nervous. Even in first gear that bad boy really takes off and on my grave drive I noticed it lost traction more than once. I will be purchasing a 12.5 inch bike tire to modify and gain more traction. So on day one he did not do much riding. On day two, I had the tractor on my deck facing the downward ramp, I followed him and helped him steer so he didn't hit anything and he rode it all the way out to the barn...still a bit nervous as even in low gear it is REALLY fast. I guess the momentum helped the traction issues as there were none, but I'm still getting the tire to modify it.
All in all I'm pleased with the product, I felt the price was fair. After only two rides my grandson was more comfortable...and keep in mind he's small for his age but was able to deal with the foot pedal although it is the top of the pedal that needs to be pushed down so if you little one is pushing from the bottom half of the pedal you will go nowhere.
I give the unit 4 stars because of the tire rod issue and the speed...low gear is just too fast...can't imagine what high gear does (shuddering). That being said I live on 3 acres and there isn't much trouble that speed will get him into but if you are going to use this anywhere by a road, I hope you can run fast...

title: Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!
text: We had an issue with the first one we ordered. It was supposed to come from a 3rd party seller that ended up being a scam. Amazon's customer service was amazing and refunded the money. I was a bit hesitant to try again, but I did and this time it came through Prime. It was delivered perfect and on time. My 3 year old LOVES it. He is always wanting to go out to play on his tractor. It has a pretty decent battery life. We have it locked into first gear so he can't go too fast. He has driven all over the yard, drive way and even down the road some so it goes really well on multiple types of surfaces. I think it is a toy that he will used for quite a while. I can't wait to see him working in the yard with us this spring!

title: Two months in - awesome
text: We are two months in with this tractor - it’s been awesome. I cannot validate other peoples’ experiences with the battery life or wheels and other parts falling apart. But, I can tell you, that this tractor has exceeded my expectations in every area thus far.  It’s plenty fast enough and the battery life is somewhere around 30 minutes to 45 minutes with extensive use.  Our backyard has some hills and it has no trouble at all climbing them. I haven’t had any problems with the trailer staying on as long as you put the latch in between the two stoppers on the back of the hitch.  I would highly recommend this tracker to anyone with a two to four year old.

title: Great buy!
text: My son loves his tractor!! Great buy!

title: Bad quality for American made
text: My son opened up the tractor for Xmas, I put it together and the radio channel up don't work and the button is square and the channel down button is a triangle, the sticker cut out is a triangle so I am assuming it was suppose to be a triangle not a square. I had to cut the sticker for the button to fit in the cutout, see picture. I build pumps that are American made and we are proud to do so, our competitors are China made. I would think for American made, the quality would be better or at least quality control would of caught a square button instead of a triangle. On top of that the up channel button doesn't work. I would of gave it 5 stars if this wasn't a quality problem.

text: I got this for my son's 3rd birthday, and he has been riding it for almost a year now. My only gripe is that the hood is a little hard to get open sometimes to charge the battery. It lasts several days of riding on a charge.

title: My tractor obsessed 21 month old loves this!
text: My tractor obsessed 21 month old loves this! He is able to drive and steer this pretty well. I would recommend locking in the speed to level 1 until they are more comfortable with steering, since level 2 flies! There are some little annoyances though, like it is really difficult to detach the trailer. Good if you don't want your toddler to constantly take it on and off, but hard when an adult tries to take it off. So far it holds a great charge and runs well.

title: Two Stars
text: very cheaply made, very poor construction

title: Fun for children!
text: Gift for grandson. Enjoys riding it tremendously. Arrived partially assembled but still took several hours to complete. Instructions are not the easiest to follow. Battery life is ok. You get about 2 hrs per charge. FM radio is kind of silly for small children. Also, each time you change the AA radio batteries the steering wheel needs to be taken off. Several good U tube videos if you get stuck with assembly.

title: Fun tractor for my son
text: The tractor is great and just like what you would buy in a store. Shipping was fast with no issues. When putting the tractor together the instructions aren’t the best but it wasn’t too difficult to put together. The company needs to take more precautions when packaging the tractor though. There were several plastic pieces that had stress on them and had turned white where it was bent. Not a deal breaker because no parts were broke but they easily could have. Overall, satisfied with the purchase.

title: Most expensive piece of junk I own.
text: Putting this thing together wasn't a hassle and after letting it charge the allotted time my kid had plenty of fun the two or three times he got to ride on it.  Of course the front grill falls off constantly just like the other reviewers stated I expected that when buying it though and figured it was something I would fix no problem.  What I did not expect is it to stop working correctly and only go at a crawl even after being freshly charged after less than a month.  My kid is heartbroken he pushed the pedal and is lucky if the thing will make it an inch.  Now it is basically trash I would figure maybe the battery, but at $60 for a replacement battery I am wondering if it would be worth a try.  Either way I shouldn't have to spend an additional $60 to get a toy that is less than a month old to work.  So in my book this is an expensive cheaply made piece of junk.  I am a fan of John Deere, even own one of there zero turns but they really made a mistake allowing there name to be branded to this trash.

title: Great for boys that love tractors
text: 4 yr old loves this. It goes really fast!

title: Parts missing
text: A gift for my grandsons birthday only to find out when it almost completely put together an important piece was missing. The part the seat attaches too. Not a very happy consumer!!!

title: BEST TOY EVER!
text:
Seeing the look on our 2 year old grandson's face made every penny of the cost worth it! He loves my REAL tractor and asks for rides on it. When he saw this under the Christmas tree, he asked, "Grammy's tractor?" I said, "No honey, it's YOUR tractor." He was more excited than I've ever seen him!
His dad put it together. He said it would have been nice if there would have been WRITTEN instructions along with the picture instructions but overall said it was pretty easy. He worked on it for just under an hour and had it together. I put the decals on.
Other's complain about this tractor being flimsy.....IT IS A TOY! I have a real tractor, that I paid a couple thousand bucks for that is flimsy. This is a very well made TOY. The trailer in the back was strong enough for my daughter to get in and get a ride. Granted she is PETITE, but others have complained about the trailer being flimsy....it's a toy, not a REAL TRACTOR. The cat enjoyed a ride in there, too.
We found this tractor on Amazon before Thanksgiving and also at Walmart. It was a little cheaper on Amazon however I checked the price on it right before Christmas and it had gone up 75 bucks....so keep an eye on the price and grab it when it's 229.
We have the throttle set so it won't go 5mph yet. The seat is adjustable and the radio is an extra bonus. Now I have to get him his own Carhartt overalls!

title: Great ride on toy!
text: This was purchased as a Christmas present for a 3 year old. This tractor is well made and sturdy. I'm writing this in February, my Nephew drives this very roughly every day and it has held up so well. The radio feature is a fun addition and the trailer is a great seat for anything that needs a ride. I would recommend this tractor to anyone!

Since there are a couple gears/speeds I can see this lasting my son for quite awhile.  He loves hauling stuff around in the little attachment too.

text:
I purchased the tractor for grandson's 3rd birthday. He loves it! It was relatively easy to put together and we've had no traction issues unlike some other respondents. He rides on the grass and driveway with ease, and we've only used the slower speed (left the parental lock, locked). I believe he'll be able to play on this toy for many more years to come.
Got to love Amazon Prime! The shipping was free, the item came very quickly, and was in great shape. I also knew if it hadn't met my expectations I could easily return without a hassle!

We are considering buying another battery because my son rides it so much.

title: Damaged
text: I purchased this tractor about a month ago for my son’s birthday next week, and I just got around to opening the box and putting it together (we wanted to keep it hidden until it was time to give it). My product came damaged, though it was really confusing because the box looked fine. There are multiple parts on the tractor where the plastic has white lines from already being bent, when all I had done was slide it out of its box and remove the protective plastic. My biggest complaint is that the “Tune” button on the radio is jammed in at an angle and will not wiggle loose. I didn’t notice it until after I got the stickers on it. This product is far too expensive for this to happen and for it to appear like it’s been taken out of the box and bent around.

My only concern was the wheels wearing out from sliding on concrete but I found out that they sell replacements so it’s no longer a concern.  Quality is great and it was worth the cost.

title: Get it. Worth it.
text:
Ditto every positive thing the other reviews have read. Awesome toy. Recommended. Great value. Still going strong after two years (except the trailer) and look forward to handing this down to the sibling. Our child entered a power toy race with his JD tractor at a local monster truck show. Came in second place on that dirt track, the announcer was talking about that kid on the tractor half the race. The child that beat him was a big kid on a 24v machine, so we were outclassed, otherwise we’d have had the checker flag.

The trailer wheels keep falling apart, that was our favorite part, too. Trailer is also difficult to put on and off for LO. Not easy to assemble, not too difficult. The radio is garbage in that it doesn’t pick up much and the sound is awful because you have to crank it up to hear it. So, while not perfect, a leader in its price range

title: I bought this for my son. It had to ...
text:
I bought this for my son.
It had to be shipped out of the country to him. Since it received! - All the reports I am getting from home is that he can never have enough of it. No one can get him off the tractor! He is the alarm. If his older sibling tries to get him off and ride. All hell breaks loose.
The five stars are based on my son's reaction to the tractor.
Assembling it in his presence was a problem, I was told. He had to be distracted with other things.

Go for it!!!

title: Great toy and quality, awesome detachable trailer, my 3 year old LOVES!!!  Buy the horn too- good little addition.
text: This is the perfect toy for my 3 year old!! He LOVES it and spent about 6 hours on Christmas driving around our kitchen island and living room couches (there's too much snow to drive it outside).  You'll need some time to assemble, but it wasn't bad.  I bought the John Deere toy horn that pops into the steering wheel and he loves that too.  I debated between this and the Gator and am SO glad I went with this one that has the detachable trailer.  He loves it so much and loads and unloads it, attaches and detaches it it all by himself.

title: Wish I had one as a child
text:
Gift for my three year old's birthday.

Pros
Kid absolutely loved it - can ride around the yard until the battery dies and wants more.
Trailer - great to get him included in yard work
Power - this tractor may have too much power on the high setting (granted we did affix mountain bike tire threads to the wheels to stop the loss of traction)

Cons
Lack of traction with normal plastic tires. At first the tractor couldnt make it up our hill, would get stuck trying to come onto the patio, etc. Clear looks of frustration from a three year old about a present he should have only loved. This was remedied with the mount bike tires, but still an additional step. Stock tires should have actual grips, or offer an alternative tire for an upcharge.
Not sure if it is our location, but the radio is a bit iffy. Maybe needs an internal antenna, but the kid is happy listening to loud static because he has his own radio. (My actual tractor doesnt have a radio!)

title: Great battery life, kiddo loves it
text: We bought this as a gift for our toddler.  Although it took quite a long time to install, it has worked great since then.  He loves to ride it with or without the trailer.  It hasn't sustained any damage for a year, and the battery charge seems to last for quite a few sessions of 20+ minutes.  I actually don't think it's ran out of charge yet, as I've charged it preemptively a few times.

title: Grandson is Loving this
text: I have a grandson who just turned 4 a week before Christmas and this was a combined Birthday and Christmas gift.  My very patient son stayed up on Christmas eve and put it together, but we started charging the battery that morning.  It is really a nice ride-on, and I was surprised at all the details it has.  A real working radio!!!  I like that the pedal is on the bottom and it looks just like an accelerator.  The battery operated car he had before this had a button he had to hold down next to the steering wheel, so he loves this feature, just had to get used to it.  This has reverse and 2 speeds that are also controlled on the floor by hand just like a real vehicle console.  The trailer comes off which is good for driving around on the sidewalk.  With this extra shift it goes through the grass easily.  I think its well worth the price, and when I saw his face when we unveiled it, it  was priceless.  Highly recommend!!

title: Best Grammie Gift Ever
text: I have a farm and bought this for my grandson to have. He is 4 years old and had no issue learning how to use it. There are two speeds making it ideal for beginners who need the slower level to acclimate. However, it took no time for him to be roaring up and down the hills in the yard and the dirt drive. The radio really isn't needed as he didn't care about it. It's a novelty at best ($$). The wagon really cannot handle a child's weight as the manufacturer said. Sadly my son didn't believe it! Fortunately, although the hitch was broken it only needed the nail or  facsimile to fix it. The battery life goes along time so the kids had hours of fun and I just charged it up each night. title: So not only a good tractor, but also very good customer service
text: This is a really cute tractor and trailer, and our 2 and 3 ½ year old grandchildren are both able to drive it!  Ours came with a defective radio, but one quick contact and they mailed us out a new one.  So not only a good tractor, but also very good customer service. I'm happy we found this one!!!

title: Best christmas present EVER
text:
My 4-year-old got this for christmas from us, and he is on this thing every waking hour. We have a farm..so he tries to use it for real farm work. Its not really suited for actual work. It can only pull VERY light loads and the hard plastic tires work great on grass but not hard packed ground or over ruts. We are looking into swapping out the tires somehow. it does get bogged down in the field pretty easily, but it's probably designed for 'city kids' that like to think they have a farm.... my kid wants to use it as a real tractor like his daddies.
Update: it's now July and my son uses this thing DAILY and when I say uses it... I mean he uses it for REAL farm work, hauling heavy loads, heck... this things never had a lick of issues! I can't say the same for my husband's actual tractor.

8 month update: this thing holding together really well for the EXTREMELY heavy use its getting. My ONLY complaint is that I wish it had real wheels and not hard plastic, they have a tough time on gravel or hard-packed ground. The ONLY pieces that have come off are one headlight that bounced off out in the field somewhere and one fender that came off when my son tried to force it through the gate which wasn't open enough (his fault, NOT the tractors). He uses this thing for real farm work, including hauling bags of feed (shocked!) and when he got in trouble one day my mom rode it in from the field... my moms 5 foot 1, but a grown woman and this thing STILL carried her just fine (Not that I would recommend it !) This thing works fantastic every single day: Unlike our real farm equipment. *sigh* ONly complaint (other thatn the tires) is that I wish the battery lasted longer... but he does use it for real farm work so that isn't a shock.

title: Grandson is in love
text: My 3 yr old Grandson loves tractors and dump trucks.  I wasn't able to celebrate his birthday and I wanted to give him this tractor. I am amazed.  I had it sent right to his house. He facetimed called me when he had opened the box and Daddy was putting it together. It has a battery and unknown to me it even has a radio!!!! I have to say (mind you he is a happy child) I have NEVER seen such a great joy and happiness in a child's face.  My daughter this past Saturday(the first weekend after he got it) facetime called me to show him riding it. She said he is so tired but refuses to come in. He can go forward, backward and turn without a problem. I actually saw when the battery went down. Now, it is a good long life battery but he rode it for hours all day that the battery wore out.  She could barely get him in for meals. I am so pleased. I highly recommend this. My older 2 grandsons 8 & 5 can ride it too because it can hold up to 80 pounds. I can't really tell you how over the moon with this tractor. I am tickled pink...

text: I wrote a review on this tractor 3 years ago when I bought it for my 3 year old grandson's birthday.  Next week he will turn 6 and he still loves to ride it.  He will ride it all around the yard as I mow it, pull his cart along picking up branches, leaves, sticks and hauling them to the back for me.  In three years he has rode it so much that the back plastic wheels wore out and develop holes.  I had to order new back wheels.  They were easy to put on and he is still going strong.  After 3 years we have finally noticed that the battery does not last as long and I will be looking into buying another one, but no complaints after getting 3 years out of the original one.  I wouldn't hesitate to buy this product again.

title: Easy to put together and just so cute

You just have to put together the trailer and put on the stickers. My husband said it was much easier to put together then my daughters Mustang Power Wheels that just came in pieces.

title: I thought she'd love it, and she does
text: I bought this for my daughter who is 3 and a half. She is obsessed with tractors, trucks, and just machinery in general. I thought she'd love it, and she does, but she is scared to put her foot on the accelerator, so I'm hoping when she ages a little she will eventually ride it without fear. For now though, she pushes it around like a giant toy car and likes to sit in it and play with her barbies. I'd also like to note while trying to teach my daughter that it is okay to ride and it isn't scary, I tried to ride it myself for an example to get her interested in trying. I am a 5'8" man weighing 288lbs and this thing carried my weight for a few minutes and still accelerated with no problem on the low gear setting. Now THAT is quality! The instructions for putting it together were atrocious and lacked any detail. I had to watch a video on YouTube of two little boys putting it together in order to figure out what goes where. The instructions have no writing, just pictures that are vaguely drawn. But once you realize what it is you are doing for most of the parts it comes with, it clicks in your head just how simple it truly is to put together. Beginning the process without a guide is absolutely an awful and long experience. But let's disregard the difficulty of the instructions since putting it together shouldn't be a factor. I believe the quality of the product should be a factor and this thing is absolutely incredible for a kid in terms of durability and power. I'm still in disbelief that it can hold me, a 29-year-old, 5'8", 288lb man! You don't need to buy something super expensive for your child to have a great time that will last very long.

title: Peg Perego John Deere Ground Force Tractor with Trailer
text:
Some Assembly required.
It went well enough.
It is quite an odd-ball collection of parts.
Some good.
Some sturdy.
Some - down right - flimsy.

The instructions (as with all instructions) could have been better.
The explanation for which screws went where could use some work.
They really tried to do it all with hieroglyphs and pictograms.

The final product was not all that bad.

The packaging for shipping was almost adequate.
There was a left front corner that took a beating. (permanently deformed some plastic)
Nothing was shattered or broken.
The charger worked.
The battery charged.
The electric motor worked.

So.. overall, it was a victory.

Now, something to consider... the accelerator/foot-peddle is actually a switch.
It either goes or stops.
There is no variable speed.
No slow - medium - fast... - just on full blast, which results in a jerky ride.
There are two levels of fast (fast and more fast)...
You can still out run it - but, for a 3 year old it can be disconcerning.
The radio is - kind of - designed for a 3 year old too.
It does not tune like a conventional radio.
It still works - you just have to dial down your presuppositions.

title: He rides for hours and loves the radio

title: This is GREAT and very well made and is best for use ...
text: This is GREAT and very well made and is best for use in a big back yard with grass.  No sidewalks where my grandson lives so he loves it.  HOWEVER!  It is so hard to put together that I had to call TAKL and hire a man to come over and put it together, and it was a good thing he brought his tool box.  It took him almost two hours to put it together.  I could NEVER have figured it out.  I will never buy ANYTHING that I have to assemble again, i kid you not. So I hope he gets years of enjoyment out of it, because if it isn't complete it isn't happening.  Overall, I am glad he loves it, but Gramma getting to old for this kind of pre-holiday stress!

title: DONT BUY THINKING YOU CAN BUY ASSURANCE FOR HELP
text:
Do not get insurance with this. Just figure when it dies it’s gone. Purchased policy and tried to use it when plastic parts wore out. Light Electric Vehicle Technologies Will be the customer service. They are apparently there to frustrate the heck out of you making unreasonable requests of you. CHECK THEIR REVIEWS. ASSURION SHOULD TELL US WHO WILL BE HANDLING OUR CLAIMS. I will never use ASSURION again without knowing and investigating the company working for that purchase. LVET first wanted me to mail in the battery. Then they requested I FIND THE THREE YEAR OLD MANUAL AND PUT THE TRACTOR BACK TOGETHER so that they could see what it looked like. IM A 72 yr old RN still working full time and raising my grandson who’s 5. Hands in air like you just don’t care!!
Also they do not belong to BBB.

title: Great product
text: Everything was great for this product. One of the front fenders/tire covers was broke on arrival. I tried epoxy and it didn't last long. My 3 yr old loved it anyways. He rode on it for hrs. I will give 5 stars once the fender issue is resolved.

title: Great Ride On Tractor
text: Very fun my 4 year old loves it!

title: Stop, read all instructions, before you begin
text: When I first had my kids, a friend told me if you are buying a battery operated kids vehicle, only buy Peg Perego.  I didnt really listen, I have had two Barbie jeeps, the batteries on both took a crap within 18 months, we had a small pick up same story, but we bought a Peg Perego 4 wheeler, that was 11 years ago, it still runs, same battery, the only thing wrong with it is the reverse no longer works.  So I'm trusting in them again with this purchase.  I will admit the assembly took about 2 hours, but only because I didn't realize there were two separate instructions sheets, one for the base instructions and one for which screws to use and where. To me the trailer axel was the most difficult part to assemble.

title: Perfecto
text: El tractor es perfecto materiales de gran calidad hecho 100% en Estados Unidos, regalo Perfecto estoy muy contento compraria mil veces esta marca

title: Five Stars
text: Our grandsons drive it all of the time and haul all type of things in the trailer.

title: Big smiles and lots of fun😀 My grandson received his ...
text:
Big smiles and lots of fun😀
My grandson received his JD tractor with trailer a few months before his 2nd birthday. He loves helping his dad in the yard. Using his trailer to haul the limbs out of the yard, while enjoying a snappy tune on his radio.
the only issue we ran into was him being able to push the excelarator. Legs were not quite long enough

title: The working radio also is a nice

title: Wow

WELL WELL WELL WORTH THE MONEY

title: Grandson very happy
text: Tractor works well, trailer is good. Radio does not work very well.  Overall grandson is very happy.  More assembly than expected, but not too complicated. Placement of decals  was the most technical.

title: Son loves it
text: Santa got this for our son for Christmas. He loves it. It was easy to put together and looks great. It has an am/fm radio as well which he loves.

title: Big HIt
text: My three year old was super exited when we gave this too him. He had a little trouble at first learning to steer where he wanted to go, but picked it up quickly. He has had some friends come over and its the toy everyone wants to play with, we have to make them line up and take turns!!

title: My 3 yr old grandson loves this.
text: This tractor is wonderful. My grandson absolutely loves it.

title: Update on review
text: I have already rated this in terms of assembly.  Other than needing a cotter pin in the steering column pretty simple.  But the radio did not work.  The tuning button was depressed and I could not pop it free.  I called them on Monday.  They asked where and when I bought it and they asked for the serial number.  They told me I'd have a new one in five days and they did not want the old one back.  Five days later it was here and it works great.  This is a company that wants to sell product and covets 5 star reviews, so its getting both.  He's 3 years old and he has an I Pad, a battery powered tractor, and a am/fm radio.  When I was three I think I had a rubber ball.

title: My 3 year old's favorite toy! 6 months of heavy use and it is still in great condition!
text:
My mother in law bought this for my son on his 3rd birthday. He plays with it every time he goes outside and goes outside very often. We bought an extra battery but you do not need to have an extra battery because the battery life last through hours of use. We live in the country and were happy to find a tractor that could ride well in sometimes muddy conditions. We live in south Louisiana, so it is pretty flat out here, but the few little hills we do have pose no problem for this tractor. We have not switched it to full speed yet but I think it is plenty fast enough for a toddler.

My son has become an expert driver on this thing and surprises me how well he takes wide turns with the trailer attached. He usually spends his time driving around, picking up woody debris in the yard, and hauling it to the wood pile.

The radio is a nice addition. I haven't had any problems with it. Overall, I think this tractor is well worth the money and would recommend it to anyone with kids ages 2.5 to 5 years of age.

UPDATE: We took the governor off so he can ride the toy at top speed. It goes really fast! I have to admit that I was pretty nervous at first since my son is only 3 but he handles it quite well. The only problem is that with the faster speed you get half the battery life.

title: Great gift for our 2-year old.
text: Good product, fast S&H and gets lots of use with all the kids.

title: Fun Toy
text:
Easy to follow assembly instructions. Took about 2 hours to assemble and apply decals.
Plastic components are fairly flimsy but adequate for intended purpose
Battery life is longer than anticipated, will run well over 1 hour nonstop in soft grass and longer on paved surfaces
It was a real fun toy for my 27 month old grandson. Locked out 2nd gear because it "flies" in high speed. 1st gear and reverse run about 2 MPH, easy to walk along beside moving tractor. Recommended for 3 to 7 years old because a 2 year old doesn't typically have the steering concept ingrained at that age but can accelerate pedal with no problem. Walked alongside "driver" to avert collisions with lawn objects and fences to aide in the prevention of damage to plastic hood

title: Assembly is tricky if you don't read the whole thing
text: i didn't see the parts list until after i had assembled the thing.  i read through the instructions and the parts list was at the end...go figure.  needless to say it was a chore because the pictures are terrible.  also, i could not get the battery door off of the radio - the screw stripped and so we are not using the radio.

title: Kids love it.
text: Cool. Lots of power. Has 2 speeds with high speed lockout. On high speed I make my 3 year old wear a helmet because it goes pretty fast. Goes on grass really well. My 6 year old rides it too no problem.

title: Battery last awhile
text: This tractor is a little pricy but my toddler loves it. Didn’t take him long to learn to drive it. He zooms all over in 2nd . It’s hot great speed as well. Overall we recommend it.

title: Super strong!!!
text: My whole family loves this toy! We got it for my sons 4th birthday and we are hard pressed to get him off it.  He zips through the yard in second gear like its nothing, sometimes with his 5yo sister along for the ride.  The battery usually lasts about 2 days, but we charge it almost every night so it's ready to go for him.  The wagon has broken twice, but hes pretty destructive and hasn't permanently damaged it.  The wheels do spin a bit on cement  (like the driveway) but have great traction in the dirt and mud.  My little boy has found that he is able to pick up his toys quickly by using the wagon and having the ability to quickly tow everything back to his toy box.  We were worried that it would be made of flimsy plastic, but this thing has survived running over his siblings, crashing into the dog house, being dragged through the mud after it died, rained on, and has carried almost 120 lbs (kids and toys combined) a good 30 ft.  We've had it six weeks and its been tested in everything but the snow and still going strong! Its amazing!

title: One good looking toy
text: best toy I have ever purchased for my son, he is using it every week. Really no need for spare battery to buy as many others are saying. The installed battery lasts easily 3 hours on a single charge.

title: He's not very good at the driving part yet but loves to sit ...
text: 2-yr old grandson loves it.  He's not very good at the driving part yet but loves to sit on it and take the trailer around for a walk and fill with his toys.

title: Five Stars
text: Great product.....great wow factor....the novelty does wear off.

title: Grandson loves it!
text: [[VIDEOID:67be6e92d7ac7fe3ff1a1043fbfab601]] Instructions could have been clearer.  Bought this for my 3 year old grandson and he loves it.  Tires don't grip well on damp grass or leaves. Took care of that issue by putting screws in the tires.

title: Five Stars
text: most loved toy by grandkids. They want to ride all the time.

title: Flimsy plastic, smaller in person, hard to put together but does look nice
text: We purchased this as a birthday gift.  It is a lot smaller in person than it appears on the page.  It was given to a boy turning 5 but looks more like it's for a 3 year old. The truck took my husband over 2 hours to put together and he said it was very difficult and directions unclear.  The worst part of the product is the FLIMSY plastic!  I do not think the plastic will last very long, as kids can be rough on their toys. We have some old Power Wheels ride on toys from yard sales and those have taken every type of challenge (like the kids ramping the toys into each other) but this tractor will most likely crack it's hood if you do that.  The trailer is also very lightweight so other children should NOT sit in it. IT cannot hold heavy weight at all. Maybe just sticks and small rocks can go in the back.

title: Love this for my kiddo!
text: My two year old adores this gift! The wagon is a neat add on but we rarely use it. It makes backing up and moving around a tad more complicated for little ones. I read the reviews before buying and was a bit weary but we love it. I wish the battery held up longer but it's still a good amount. We store the charger under the hood so we don't lose it- makes keeping it in one place handier. Super fun toy and durable.

title: My grandson loves his new tractor...he can't stop playing with it.
text: The tractor  was everything I thought it would be and my grandson loves it!! Compared to other tractors out there, the John Deer is No.1..

title: Best Purchase Ever!
text: [[VIDEOID:975fe60fdd6cceb667d694cfac1c063]] We got this for our grandsons 3rd Birthday. He absolutely loves his tractor. We have a little bit of land. A nice garden that he drives out to daily. A hill that he loves to play on and his tractor goes up it very nicely. I was worried he might have a problem driving. Nope! Picked it up immediately. I love his tractor. He loves his tractor. Nice to see his paw out on his tractor, the neighbors out on theirs and now he had his own. And loves the radio! All works great. No issues at all!

title: THE perfect gift!
text: Oh my!  What can I say about THE perfect gift for my grandson!!  He LOVES it!!  He is 2 and has learned to steer and maneuver it very well.  He has a good couple of years of growth to continue riding it.

title: Loved it!!
text: My grandson loves it! A gift for his 2nd birthday.  I bought the tool belt he spends hours with his tools and tractor.  Definitely recommend he loves it. Appears sturdy and replacement wheels and parts are available in the future if needed.

title: Son and daughters fav toy.
text: They Ride up and down hills, in the grass, and any other surface they can find. They are 3

title: John Deere
text: Still going strong after three grandkids constant use

title: Both my boys love this little tractor
text: Both my boys love this little tractor.  We bought it on Black Friday which saved a little bit of $$$.  All of my boys friends love to ride it.  Tires are hard plastic so they slip a little but the separate motors in the rear wheels are a nice feature.

title: Little boy's dream come true
text: My son lives this tractor. The front headlights will not stay on. We pop them in, then they fall off within 2 minutes. Also the plastic tires do not give great traction. My son sides sideways and has trouble taking off on concrete. Overall pleased with the product so far.

title: High price low quality
text: I have a love hate relationship with this tractor. Over the past two years just about everything on it has fallen off or broken. The seat broke within months of purchase as did the exhaust, the plastic grill and side covers have fallen off. Some pieces go back but most have to be glued or duct taped. It's just so cheaply made that I don't think I'd reccomend or repurchase from this brand. On the flip side my sons LOVE this tractor. It gets ridden for hours just about every day. It moves faster then a power wheels and because of its smaller size it's easier to store. If it were made with higher quality materials it'd be worth the price. But come on Peg Pergo at this price give us something that holds up. I've had power wheels last years and years and this will be the second and last summer we get out of these tractors because the entire thing is pretty much duct tape and glue at this point.  I have a 3 and 5 year old so it's not like they're overly rough on it.

text: got it for my son who is 2.5 he found it easy but at his.age heard to steer he will be 3 in june. as he says he wants to ride shrek all the time.i cant keep him.off it. allthough the radio button was.stuck and we where unable to get it out still waiting to hear back from them.

title: Great, and my Son loves "his tractor".
text: I purchased this last Christmas for my then 26 month old son.  At first it was too much for him, but adapted to pretty well over a few months, and now he loves it ( he'll be 3 next month)!  The battery usually lasts the weekend for him, and I would imagine that equates to about 6-7 hours of use.  The battery then charges overnight.  It seems to be holding up really well, with my son constantly trying to pull, push, and sometimes crash things off of it.  I would recommend that 3 years old be the minimum age for having this, in spite of the Fathers out there wanting to get their motoring sooner!

title: Heads up warning
text:
Before you start to build this hire a divorce attorney, addiction counselor and a therapist. The instructions to build this are utter garbage and to say it’s built in America well who wrote the instructions. E.T?
The trailer axle assembly has an entire online following of thousands as it gone viral it’s so confusing.
The rest of the instructions must have been written by E.T’s twin brother as NASA engineers and the entire staff at Tesla were left scratching their heads!
You will only figure this out on your own and the instructions are a mind mess!
Be warned or be divorced or become an addict!

title: Great power and battery
text: My 2 (Almost 3) year old is inlove with this! It’s easily operated and very maneuverable. But I will say be prepared for the power! I ordered it because of that so it didn’t disappoint, but it surprised him at first. Now he won’t even ride it in setting one 😅.. it’s powerful enough to ride in grass and still move at a fast pace. He loves the little wagon to put toys in and the battery life is really good. The plastic is a little more cheap feel than I expected so that was disappointing, but that’s my only complaint..overall I would say if your considering it go ahead, a good purchase.

title: The tractor is smaller than one would think. It ...
text: The tractor is smaller than one would think.It was advertised a 7 year old could ride so was hoping my grandson could ride for years to come.  Also if you have to change the battery for the radio you have to take steering wheel off to change.

title: Green machine

title: 4 year old LOVES it.
text: We got this tractor for our son's 4th birthday.  He LOVES it.  Sometimes he wants to drive it with the trailer and sometimes with-out.  We have 2 acres and parts of the yard is very rough.  This tractor does very well.  Rarely gets stuck.  Has all the power it need for any hills we have.  Battery lasts long time between charges.  Radio is annoying but he likes it.  He rides it around when I'm on my mower mowing the lawn.  He thinks its cool HIS has a radio and MINE doesn't.  He has helped me with my garden by haulin' in the crop.  LOL  Trailer is rated for 30 pounds and he has pulled a 28 pound watermelon up the hill to the house for me.  Did perfect.  He drives it great.  Couple cousins can't drive and crash into everything.  Its held up to several crashs I thought was going to take a wheel off.  Guess its built better than I thought for plastic.

title: Granson loves it

title: Very happy with this item
text: This is used every day by my grandson who is 3.  We live on 3 acres and he can go anywhere with this tractor.  He loves it and I highly recommend this item.

title: Has worked great for several years now.  Highly recommended.
text:
We bought this tractor for my grandson a few years ago at Christmas when he was probably 4,
Initially he visited most every week and drove this tractor every time he visited.
He is almost 7 now and visits less often, but still loves this tractor and trailer, driving around our yard, picking up sticks/leaves and hauling his other toys around.
It still runs great, using the original batteries.
He usually drives it (on and off) for an hour or two and the battery almost always holds up for the duration.
We charge it overnight.

The front grill came off and just will not stay on.
And we put a bungee cord across the back of the trailer to hold the sides together when loaded.
But other than those, no problems at all.

Yes, it is kind of expensive, but three family members went together and spread out the purchase cost.

title: DECLAN LOVES HIS “BIG TRACTOR!”
text: GRANDSON DECLAN LOVES HIS “BIG TRACTOR” SANTA BROUGHT HIM FOR CHRISTMAS!!!!

title: We loved this
text: Our son loved this for Christmas!

title: Great product, great seller
text: 6 yr old loves this thing. Every kid in the neighborhood has a similar one. Lasts long, good speed. Mine didnt come with a trailer axle and the seller overnighted one since my (autistic) boy loves trailers and it was his bday. Thank you!

title: So far, it's okay
text: About to put together and will update feedback as I finish. But I see one thing that already will give it only 4 out of 5 stars...having to put the stickers on. Always frustrating trying to get these things straight on toys.

title: Everything you expect you will receive.
text: Battery life last long. Made very well. Runs awesome & fast! Mi Nietesito; he's about to turn 4 in February... loves it & he is always eager to help his Abuelito pick up the branches, dirt, leaves, rocks, weeds, his own toys... you name it he helps load up his wagon! Always full of energy & this motivates him even more! We are happy we got it for him... I give it thumbs up, 10 stars & highly recommend it!

title: The assembly instructions are inadequate
text: I would’ve given this a 5 star but the instructions were piss poor none of the parts or hardware are labeled and it was missing hardware so make sure you have extra screws on hand.

title: Five Stars

title: Arrived damaged
text: My son was very excited for this unfortunately it’s arrived damaged.

title: Perfect gift
text: My son loves this thing so much. He got it for his two-year birthday and he rides it almost every single day. He loves the trailer he put a bunch of stuff in there and drives around are acre of land

title: Good clear instructions
text: Good clear instructions. Runs GREAT. Kid loves it! Highly recommend getting it!! Battery still going strong since December. Takes about 30-45 mins to put together.

title: rugged, fun and fast
text:
I've never given 5 stars but in this case I genuinely have no issue with the tractor. I have two younger boys 3 and 5 y/o. and about a 3,000 s.f. back yard which is all grass. My initial concern was smaller wheel power wheel toys wouldn't manage the grass, this does and very well. I've listed the pros below

- built strong and very durable
- two speeds + reverse , second gear is about as fast as you would want a 5 y/o to go
- Battery life is more than enough to keep two boys busy for a couple hours
- It comes with a little fm radio, kids love it, but for some reason I have npr going in the back yard constantly
- we have orange trees in our back yard, we use the tractor/trailer to hall oranges to the neighbors
- left it out overnight with the sprinklers on and in the rain, no issues :)

title: awesome
text: my son cant get enough kf this he loves it so much so glad we got it for him

title: This tractor is Great! My son loves it
text: This tractor is Great! My son loves it.  The battery only lasts about 2 hours so I recommend buying an extra so you can swap them out as needed.  It rolls over grass easily, through ditches and puddles with no problem!

title: Five Stars
text: My Grandson was so happy. It was priceless to see his face. Nice tractor.

title: this was so great at first.. but then...
text:
this was so great at first. but here we are, two months later, and the charging cord has literally BURNT UP and now i can no longer use this tractor for my son. he is devastated, i'm annoyed because we spent almost $300 on his birthday gift, and I just simply cannot buy another tractor. I have looked everywhere on this site to contact seller but that doesn't seem to be an option. that is really frustrating too!

***edited to add-- I finally got Customer service and at first it was great. But they only replaced the battery and not the charger that it burned up as well. I was told they would not replace that. So almost a year later and we are still staring at a useless toy in the yard.
I was really thrown off when we were asked where we plugged it in... we have dedicated outlets on the outside retaining wall of a patio on their own breaker. We plug it in there because, well, it's an outside toy. I was told this was actually not permitted by the company and they only warranty when you charge the vehicle INSIDE THE HOUSE. I mean, cause everyone has room for a tractor to be sitting inside every time it needs a charge. I feel like this is their way of getting out of backing their product and we just won't be buying any more peg perego which is a shame because IF their products functioned, they would be great.

title: Nice tractor
text: Instructions for assembly are poor. Took 2 hours and a lot of guessing.  Grandson loves it!

title: just adorable, perfect for my little "tractor boy"
text: Oh my Goodness, just adorable , perfect for my little "tractor boy"!

title: Son loves this tractor!!
text: My son loves this tractor he is 2 years old and we bought this for his 2nd birthday. Its easy enough for him to drive and the battery lasts a long time. Its also very good quality and even has a working FM radio which suprized me! The only think that was a bit confusing was the instructions they have a page of just pictures on what you are supose to do and the writen instructions which use complex names for the small parts and there is no page that tells you what all the small parts are called. It took us about an hour to get it fully assembled because we had to figure everything out by looking at the pictures. Even though the assembly was a bit rough the look on my sons face when he seen it all together made up for it i do recomend this tractor:)

title: Powerful, quick, and durable!
text: My on received this as a gift for his 2nd birthday.  He is not almost 6 and STILL loves and uses it!  It has held up through numerous sized children (including a 9yr old!) And all kinds of terrain.  It won't go up the hill in our yard unless it is at high speed, the child weighs enough (because it is real wheel drive), and it is at just the right angle, but it does make it so we can't complain!  If there were more traction on the wheels I feel it would do a much better job on the hill because the motor seems powerful enough.  Some people figured out how to rig the wheels for more traction but we never bothered.  This is quite fast on second speed, perfect on first speed for beginners, and pretty powerful.  The trailer works well if you don't misuse it - the kids decided to try to give each other rides in it one year (the tractor was still going strong with two children on it!) and that was the end of the trailer!  All in all we have been extremely happy with this tractor and would highly recommend it!

title: Overall, a good deal
text: Bought this for our 3 year old grandson. And so does his 1 year old brother!

title: Great product!
text: Bought this for my 2 year old's bday! He is learning to steer still, but he loves it! Has a blast pressing the gas and shouting steer, steer, steer! He has had it for about a month now and he has is pretty much driving it by himself!

title: Great product, but could use some safety improvements.
text: My son loves this tractor.  It could really use a safety feature in starting the tractor.  There is NO start button, switch, or key.  The product is started when the child depresses the pedal.  This is a problem because the pedal is where the kid climbs on to and off from the product.  It's easy to accidentally step on it climbing on and off.  My kid has (on attempting to get on or off) accidentally depressed the pedal and gotten thrown forward several times.  We now disconnect the battery completely under the hood until he's safely on.  Then we connect it, close the hood, and he can ride.  When he wants to get off, we make him wait on the tractor until we disconnect the battery again.  It's a huge hassle.

title: our grandson loves this tractor
text: well assembly was tricky, thankfully my hubby is very good at putting things together when instructions are well lets say not very good. but once all is done the tractor is awesome, our 2 year old grandson now has his own tractor just like grandpa.

title: I'd buy another in a heartbeat!
text:
Oh my gosh, this is a terrific little vehicle! Purchased it for my little grandson to ride around in our backyard since he outgrew the little scooter. We're on an acre so he feels like he can really travel. It has two speeds and he loves to "fly" around on the top speed. He puts his tunes on the radio and away he goes. Picks up "firewood" (ie: fallen branches from the trees) and hauls them to the burn pile. He rides it every chance he gets and his little sister has a blast being hauled around in the trailer too.

It comes in several parts so there is some assembly required. I did it by myself - no help at all from my engineer husband - he was impressed. I just followed the directions and it was a piece of cake. Very solid, durable little vehicle. Very well made. I can see years of fun for my grandkids. Money well spent!

title: Awesome
text: Kids love this thing. Easy to use and easy to handle by my 2 year old grandson. He goes around the garden with me and puts the vegetables in the little wagon.

title: My 3 year old Loves it.
text: Fantastic.  Great Value.  Fun Fun Fun for my 3 year old

title: We LOVE THIS!!!
text:
We LOVE this!!!It has been driven around now for over a month. I debated whether or not to spend the money on this, but in the end we decided to give it a go.
My son is 4 and got this for his birthday. He loves it!! It is very well made. The battery lasts about an hour. He now drives this around following his Dad every time the lawn gets mowed.

I really don't have any complaints, other than I won't be putting any more batteries in the FM radio when the current ones die. It's super annoying that the kids can flip through multiple bad radio stations paying inappropriate songs. That feature would be better left out, unless your kid will leave it on one particular station.

title: Nice Project
text:
Wasnt to hard to assemble but some of the smaller parts are a little easier to put on than others.
It was a nice project for a determined Grandma. My grandson loves it! He puts his JD hat on puts his puppy in the trailer and off they go.

title: For outside fun, it can't be beat

title: ASSEMBLY ANS CHARGE BEFORE GIVING IT!

title: Such a great tractor and so realistic!
text: Our Grandson feel in love with this tractor immediately!  It was pretty cold to be out on it, but he didn't care!  At 2 1/2 years old, he was able to handle it well.  Love that is has two speeds so as he gets older he will still be able to use it!  It is just like his Papa's!  So much fun!

title: Love it
text: I couldn't decide if I wanted to get a tractor or a 4 wheeler for my grandson. I'm glad I chose the tractor. His eyes just lite up when he saw a John Deere. He loves the wagon and putting dirt, sticks or whatever in it. He also likes to "hook" things up to the tractor hitch. His daddy and PaPa was putting together a swing set for him and he took one of the chains to a swing and wrapped it around the hitch of the tractor. The FM radio picks up stations really well.

title: Rides Well Even in Hilly Muddy Soggy Terrain/ My son is Happy
text: This was a gift for my 4 yr old son from his Pop Pop.  He really loves this tractor and rides it a few times a week.  We chose this ride on vehicle because my son is tall for his age and most of the ride on cars aren't designed for taller kids.  Since it's a tractor, there is no dash so his knees are free and he fits well in it.  He's driven after it rained so this vehicle has been tested in slushy, muddy, swampy land and it does well on hills in second gear.  First gear isn't strong enough for the hills on Pop Pop's property.  This tractor is also strong enough to carry my 7 yr old niece who is also tall for her age (she has the height of a 9 yr old).  My son mainly rides this at the grandparents house since they have lots of land, but it's actually small enough to fit in the back of my small SUV so we are able to bring it to parks and to friends homes, for play dates.  FYI, second gear is very responsive so since my 4 yr old is new to driving, he has a lead foot so I do want to disclose that the unit rears up a bit in the front when he just plops his foot on the petal.  Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase because my son feels really special riding it and he notices that the other children are jealous.

title: its heavy! But well with the money

title: Tire Treads appear to have been updated, this is a great tractor!
text: [[VIDEOID:4d42ee6606bd868ab5a31c13ec1ce427]] This is my son riding the John Deere Ground Force Tractor. Contrary to the only other Amazon review at this time, I believe that the tires are accurately reflected on the packaging, perhaps they figured out how to mold a thick treaded farm type tire. I will upload some photos of the tires close up later.  This tractor is great, it is themed as a farm tractor, with a stake-style trailer, as opposed to the John Deere Turf Tractor, which seems to be themed as a Lawn Mower Style tractor.  The Ground Force has a radio, which you can hear in the background of this video, and it is pure coincidence that the country song is playing.  Assembly takes between 1 and 2 hours. The directions were all diagrams with no text, but after completing assembly, I found that in the manual, there are text directions a few pages after all of the diagram instructions.  Peg P. should notate this in the owners manual up front to make assembly a bit easier. It rides very well over our bumpy lawn.  I am sad to say I ordered this from WalMart for $245, I hope Amazon can compete with that price as time goes on.  They have already lowered it from $299.99 to ~ $273. In short, if you child wants a farm tractor, this seems to be a great choice, both my son (2.5 yo) and daughter (4.5 yo) have been enjoying it immensely this weekend.

title: Good
text:

My kids will love it so it is worth it!

title: Steering column is designed poorly for assembly.
text:
The steering wheel did not slide into rod correctly. I had to cut off the bottom piece of the steering wheel for it to fit. This was after 2 hours of struggles and stripping out two screws (which required a visit to the hardware store).
To add...
Purchased insurance through seller/shipping site. Only to be told the manufacturer supplies insurance for product. I purchased the optional ($40) insurance just to be redirected to PP customer service which was very little help. I had to drive 2 hours to the nearest facility to work on tractor only to be told I had a bill because the problem was not covered under warranty. My problem: when son drove tractor for more than 5 minutes "a relay would over heat" causing the tractor to not move without it cooling off. I placed that in quotes because repair company knew the problem when I called and stated it was semi-common.
Repair quote: $90
Somewhat dissatisfied as my son saved his garden money to purchase this toy/work vehicle. He was 6 years old and raising his own garden to save 50%, spend 30%, tithe 10% and reinvest 10%.

text: My three year old loves his tractor. He rides all around the neighborhood streets as well as the yard. He can tow all his “stuff” and loves the radio.

title: Hours of Fun
text: We purchased this for our grandson's second birthday and had it shipped to his home. He was super excited to receive it and he and his dad spent a Sunday afternoon putting it together. Assembly did take a little bit of time and then the battery had to be charged before its first use. However, all that work is quickly forgotten and he loves driving it around the yard now. The battery life is exceptional. It seems to be pretty durable. I wish the tires had a rubber surface on them so that they would not spin so much, but he can navigate the lawn in most places without a push. I'd expect that he will be able to use this for several more years.

title: Grandson LOVES driving this tractor
text:
We reviewed many different options for a ride-on toy for our grandson. This John Deere tractor with trailer got top ratings and the price was reasonable. Plus, Dad had to put it together. He seemed to have no problem getting it together. All the parts were there. The joys of being a grandparent. You send it and the parents get to put it together.

Our grandson was roughly 2.5 years old when he got this for Christmas. He figured out how to drive it fairly quickly. The slow speed is a nice starting speed. The faster speed is really nice and fast. I didn't clock it but it certainly seemed to be fast enough. It was faster than the car we bought for our granddaughter but her car was heavier and was a two-seater.

It worked as described. The battery lasted quite long. Again, didn't time it.

I would definitely recommend this tractor to anyone interested in a ride-on toy. He loves it. They have had it for two months now and he rides it every weekend. No problems so far.

title: Great - Worth Every Penny

He was so excited with UPS delivered it and once the battery was charged he rode it all day.  He put sticks and tools in the trailer.  He likes the radio.  He is small for his age but fits perfectly on the tractor.  I am so happy we made this purchase.  I would highly recommend buying an extra battery.  It comes with a 8 hour battery and I bought the extra battery from Walmart as it is a 12 hour battery.  I also bought a speed charger at Walmart.  The battery and charger I bought at Walmart are Peg Perego brand. I didn't buy the tractor there though because it was a slightly different model and not quite as nice.

title: This is a beautifully styled tractor and better with add-I s.
text: Our grandson absolutely loves this tractor. He is almost three and it took a couple of times riding around to get the knack of steering. I wish the upgraded more powerful battery would come with the tractor. I plan on purchasing one as a backup. I added real headlights which operate with a rocker switch and got the after market battery operated horn. I got a three pack of bicycle flasher lights which have an elastic strap with Velcro and attached them to the exhaust stack both for looks and to show up for vehicles on our roadway which has scant traffic. I got the idea on YouTube to attach bicycle tire tread on the wheels both to protect the plastic wheels and to provide traction. The plastic tires are slippery and they were showing wear after only three times riding around on asphalt. Plus the bicycle tread should provide a quieter ride. I cut off an inch on each side of the bicycle tires so they would lie flat against the tractor tires and fastened them with 3/4” stainless steel coarse thread screws. Others used coarse drywall screws which wouldn’t show as much but I wanted something to hold up to getting wet.

Update 11/29/2016: My son is now 5 1/2 and still regularly rides this tractor. The wagon is nearly impossible for me to attach to the tractor; somehow my husband gets it on there but it has to be my brute force! I just can't get it. The radio has recently stopped working but I'm wondering if the tractor was left out in the rain prior to that and that could've caused it. (My son rarely listened to the radio anyway so he doesn't miss it.) Still 5 stars where my son is concerned! He drives it over concrete and grass w/o any problems!

title: This tractor is awesome! My daughter loves it (She is two)
text: This tractor is awesome! My daughter loves it (She is two). I will say that the steering wheel is a little hard to turn, but the radio is a fun feature. My daughter loves that there is a trailer attached. She drives around the yard picking up sticks and leaves. The one thing I don't like it I wish that the tires were rubber. They are a hard, sturdy plastic, so its sometimes hard for the tractor to get out of the bumpy spots in our yard.

title: A lot of assembly, too many decals, but solid and fun
text: I was genuinely surprised at the amount of assembly this thing required. Dont get me wrong; I'm not afraid of tearing anything apart and putting it back together again or building something from scratch. I own several custom cars I've built myself, built an airplane with a friend, and fix most things people just throw away. But it was the end of the day, the night before my son's birthday, and I really expected most of the little stuff to be done right out of the box, like lenses on the non-functioning lights and decals on the body of the tractor and trailer. But no, the only thing you *DON'T* have to install is the motors and wiring and controls. The instructions referenced non-existent chrome decals to go behind the fake light lenses and I wasted 15 minutes looking for them. Peg Perego is nice enough to include a spare axle nut to make up for the fact that the step where you install washers on the axle between the wheels and the body were omitted from the instructions. Everything goes together relatively easily, save for the #@%&ing steering shaft... I was tired and lacking patience and getting more irritated as the night wore on, and the decals really ticked me off. There are no reference points or guides on the tractor body, making it very easy to put them on crooked or mis-aligned. And there are a lot of decals. I put about half on before calling it quits. Anyway, my son loves it, and it's faster than all of his friends' ride-ons, which is surprising since it's a tractor. The battery has a nice long runtime, and usually outlasts the boy's attention span. Tires could be designed better, but overall a nice product. Just be prepared to put it all together.

title: Loads of FUN! I upgraded the battery for more fun.
text:
[[VIDEOID:da392046a2e5060ce35450c9c60e5d5d]] My son loves this tractor.

This design is adorable! All my friends and family compliment on how "real" it looks. Over time my son removed the plastic "headlights" and "tail-lights" and also removed the exhaust on the side as well as the stickers, I don't mind as long as my son continues to use it. It has good steering and it is able to ride through dirt a lot better than St Augustine grass. My son, 3 year old, goes in circles in the backyard and naturally 2nd gear is his favorite.

CONS: It is expensive compared to some power wheels. You pretty much pay for the cool look. The 2nd gear drains the battery twice as fast as 1st gear. Stock Battery is small and has less capacity compared to what you get from a power wheels vehicle. Updated 9/1/18 - the motors overheat easily compared to power wheels vehicles. On hot days upgraded battery keeps going until the motors overheat and shut off. After a couple of minutes it runs again.

THOUGHTS: I considered upgrading the wheels with rubber liners, but I am sure the extra grip will put more wear on the gears. I also considered increasing the voltage for more power but this will also wear out the gears faster too. So I went with the battery upgrade. I bought a 12V 20AH battery from Amazon and also upgraded the charger to charge it faster. The only downside is that the battery is bigger and its challenging to tie it down. I used pipe strap but I am sure zip ties can also work. Updated 9/1/18 - The motors on power wheels seem stronger than these. It is a great starter 12V power vehicle, but now that my son is 5 he prefers his power wheels vehicle over this one.

title: On the whole, I'm pretty satasfied.
text:
Overall, this tractor is pretty good, the kids loved it. The only things that I'm not too happy about is that even though the description mentioned 4WD, this toy is in-fact NOT 4WD. After re reading it, I see that it says something about 4WD tires, not that the toy is 4WD, but there is no such thing as a 4WD tire, its the machine that is or isn't, trust me I'm a farmer. The hood is somewhat difficult to close, and you have to open it every time you charge the toy. And the most disappointing thing is that the radio isn't powered by the main battery, it takes batteries of its own, that are somewhat difficult to change.

Still glad I bought it, it just wasn't as epic as I thought it was going to be.

title: Amazing quality and great for the price!
text:
This tractor is amazing!!! We decided to purchase this one after my daughter rode a friends and we found out it was 7 years old. The tractor still had so much power from the original battery. It was easy to ride and maneuver for my 3 years old. With a fully charged battery and my 3 year old weighing 32 pounds she can ride for 3 hours no problem on grass with slight inclines. We also allow her to drive it in our neighborhood while we go on our evening walks and she has a blast pretending to drive all around like a big girl. The tractor has enough power to make it up small hills but nothing big which is understandable. It actually does better on hills then I thought it would do and has surprised me with the power it has. It has pretty good traction control for a product of this type and doesn't spin wheels where most ride on vehicles do. My daughter loves the radio and loves listening to country music while she follows daddy on his tractor doing yard work.

The cons about this tractor are very small. While putting the tractor together the instructions about which specific screws went where wasn't clear and were hard to understand. We ended up using a wrong screw somewhere because when we screwed the radio to the tractor the screw went right through the radio opening and wouldn't hold it in place. We had to get an extra screw to make it work. Otherwise the rest of the directions were easy to understand with both illustrations and words. The other complaint I have is the trailer. The neighborhood kids are always sitting in it as kids will do and the trailer can not hold their weight - it can't really hold much weight at all. Due to this the plastic part that holds the "axle" has begun to break so we have now learned to disconnect the trailer whenever kids are around to prevent them from hopping on to ride. It would've been better if they had two sets of wheels on the trailer and a back to the trailer would've been nice as well.

When the battery arrived in the package and we put it on charge it lit up green within 5 minutes of charging so I was confused since it said to let charge for 18 hours or until the light turned green. After calling Customer Service (which was fabulous to deal with) I was told to allow it to charge for 18 hrs the first time no matter what and ignore the light so I did and haven't had any problems!!!

title: Assembly isn't fun, but worth the effort!
text:
We purchased the John Deere tractor for our 3-year-old son. My husband, who is extremely skilled at assembly and building, had some choice words for whoever wrote the assembly instruction. He eventually tossed those, found a few youtube videos, and did the rest of it on his own. So if you buy this, watch youtube before assembly and don't even bother with the assembly instructions.

Once assembly was tackled, we let our son take over and to say it's his favorite toy is an understatement. We were a bit nervous at the beginning as he very quickly went to the faster speed setting, but even at 3 years old, drives it like a nascar driver with zero fear. We're obviously supervising at all times but aside from one time when attempted to drive it up a hil on our property and the weight distribution was so off-center it nearly flipped backward, hasn't had any issues. He drives in on asphault and grass and has no trouble.

Our only issue is that one of the tires, less than 2 months after getting it, separated along the middle seam. The tires were pre-installed so I'm confident it's not an error on our side. I'm still attempting to get a response from customer service, so we'll see how the service aspect of Peg Perego goes.

Overall, I'm glad we bought it. My 7 year old daughter rides it occasionally and enjoys it as well, but it is enjoyed more by kiddos along the 3-6 range moreso than the older ones.
