title: Great idea, muliple issues
text: I like it, but...  they should forget about the starter charger, and send the fast charger in the first place, add it to the cost.  Tires need some rubber coating, if your child is riding this on concrete, tires are going to break quickly, this is because the acceleration design is poor, first the pedal is too hard for a child, so when the child is finally able to push down, s/he gets startled and stops quickly, this is what gets the tires worn out and hinders the child from having a good learning experience, the hitch connect needs work, assembly was okay with a few pointers from other reviews, radio should definitely be connected to battery system.  One thing I wish it had, a handle in the middle somewhere so I can put it quickly back into storage, just about every other part you could grab it from seems like it could break at any moment.  Overall, okay quality, can certainly improve and adding more features that parents wouldn't mind paying extra few dollars for.

text:
Love this tractor! My kids have loved it. It's lasted 5 yrs now and it'd still going like crazy. The only complaints i've gad with it are: Traction: before my mod this tractor would peel out on minimal bumps and hills. I fixed this by screwing a line of hex screws about a half inch apart each around each of the rear wheels. After this fix, no joke, it will go up just about any hill and plow through weed's and brush so tall the tractor and my son disappear only to re-emerge at the other end of the field.
The only other complaint is that after five years it seems to overheat and auto shutoff for a few seconds then goes again. Charges have lasted FOREVER. Totally exceeded expectations.

Kid's favorite uses:

helping me(dad)in garden w tools and dirt, weeds in the trailor.

Pulling little sisters by attaching wagon or sled with a bungee.

title: Traction problem fixed!
text:
First, let me say that this tractor is terrific. It is powerful and my daughter loves to drive it around the yard. She is learning the concepts of: turning left and right, start and stop, on and off, fast and slow, etc.

Although the manufacturer clearly states not to use it on "hills", the fact is, we have hills. The plastic tires are terrible on wet and/or very dry grass (i.e. summer drought grass), the tires also spin on asphalt/blacktop if you are on a grade. This is because the tractor has so much initial torque that it doesn't gradually accelerate - it just takes off.

If you look closely, the plastic tires have a small grove in the center. Other Peg-Perego models actually have a red rubber band that fits in to those groves for traction - they are called "traction bands". I did some research to fix the constant tire spinning problem and here is the easiest, least expensive, best option (in my opinion).

The rear tires measure about 12.75 inches. I went to the local department store and purchased one 12.5 inch kids bike tire. I removed each sidewall of the bike tire using the edge of the tread as a guide (I cut it will heavy duty all-purpose scissors/cutters). I then cut the tire in half directly down the center (first by making a slit with a utility knife, then using the all-purpose heavy duty scissors/cutters to make the cut) - the center of the tire has a mold mark, so it is easy to follow the center. Then, I stretched each half of the bike tire over each rear plastic tire on the tractor - sliding the tire to the center so that the smallest part of the bike tire fit in to the grove on the plastic tractor tire. Viola! The tractor has excellent tractor for both starting and stopping. A 30 minute fix for about $10.

Overall, we are very happy with this toy! It should last my daughter for many years to come.

title: Our kid loves it and loves being able to haul produce from the garden, but there are iritating shortcomings
text:
First, just about any kid is going to love this tractor. Ours loves hauling around his gardening tools in the trailer and hauling produce from the garden to the house. I also love the fact that replacement parts can be ordered from the Peg Perego website for anything that gets broken. In this world of disposable stuff, it is refreshing to actually be able to buy parts to repair a kids toy. The fact that this tractor is made in the USA is another refreshing change.

The tractor and trailer were not too hard to put together, but I found all of the supplemental instructions to be annoying. My guess is that errors and omissions were found in the original instructions and so supplement sheets had to be included. What really needs to be done is to rewrite the master instructions so that the supplemental sheets aren't needed. This would greatly simplify assembly. All instructions need to be in one booklet and in a logical sequential order, not spread across several sheets.

There are shortcomings with this tractor. The first and biggest annoyance is the radio. The radio requires its own AA batteries when it should really run off the master battery. To add to the battery frustration, in order to replace the radio's batteries, one must remove the radio from the tractor, which requires removing the steering wheel. All told, replacing the radio's batteries requires removing a bolt for the steering wheel, a screw to free the radio from the tractor and a screw on the battery cover. In reality, the radio is pretty much junk, it has terrible reception for the lack of a decent antenna, it can't stay locked on a single station and every time it gets turned on, it starts at the lowest frequency and one has to find "their" station again. It really shouldn't cost all that much more to have a halfway decent radio that can get half decent reception and stay locked on a given station even after having been turned off. Even if a better radio increased the price of this toy by a few bucks it wouldn't affect sales. If separate batteries are going to be required for the radio then they need to be easier to replace.

The next annoyance with the tractor is that it comes with a slow battery charger even though Peg Perego sells a rapid charger that can charge a battery in around two hours. Instead of making us buy a second rapid charger that essentially results in the charger that is shipped with the tractor redundant junk, the rapid charger should be included with the tractor. The rapid charging could be a selling point for the toy. After all, a toy that is waiting for its battery to be charged isn't much fun.

Another wish I had for this tractor, which seems to be a problem for any kids' electric vehicle I've seen is that the battery should be easier to swap out. To remove and replace the battery requires removing two screws. If a secondary battery is going to be used to keep the tractor running while a battery is being charged, the battery cage really needs to be held in place with clips, not screws to facilitate quick removal. It is nice that the battery cage will support a larger battery and I will make sure to buy a larger battery as the second battery when the time comes. The original battery does seem to have 2-3 hours of run time if properly charged for 18hrs from the start. In time, like any battery, its total run time will decrease and of course if there are friends over, everyone is going to want their turn driving the tractor. A larger battery will provide a longer run time throughout its useful life.

I would have given this toy three stars, because of the annoyances listed above, but added a forth star because of the fact I can easily order replacement parts when they are needed and because it is made in the USA. Being able to order replacement parts is going to give this toy a much longer service life than it would have had otherwise.

title: Perfect for 2.5 year old future farmer!
text: My 2.5 year old grandson LOVES this tractor!  He rode it all over the backyard.  It has good traction on the grass and the small hills.  He ever figured out how to back up with the trailer attached.  My only issue is that the upright pretend exhaust pipe has what appears to be a handle on one side, but it is only attached at the bottom.  It seems like it should have two points of attachment.  It was easy to assemble, substantial construction, and looks great.  I do wish there was a cover available - we are using a barbecue cover!  (BTW, we opted not to put batteries in the built-in FM radio.  He didn't miss it, and we didn't have to listen to it!)  It charges fast, and holds for a long time.  Great tractor!

title: Assembly was easy. Battery life is good
text:
This is definitely a well built toy. The product is sturdier than another similar toy we bought at Toys R Us. Assembly was easy. Battery life is good.
The pin to hitch the trailer to the tractor didn't install very well. And the pin also broke after first month. Some of that is attributed to our kids taking the tractor off-roading :).

title: Son LOVES it - could be built better
text:
Our 4-year-old has had a blast on this thing since we got it for Xmas 6 months ago. You need to be a little handy to put it together and directions could be a little more clear. They're almost as useless as IKEA directions. Anyway, biggest issue we've had with this tractor have been with the part that holds the hood lock and the radio. When the tractor goes over bumps, it's enough to pop it out of place. I tried crazy gluing it in, but that doesn't work. So I'll have to come up with another fix. The radio also died after 6 months (being replaced under warranty, but why do I have to pay $10 for shipping?). As far as I know, it didn't get wet. Oh, and they make it very difficult to replace the batteries on the radio. You have to take off the steering wheel and then unscrew the radio panel.

I recommend buying a second battery. Why? Because your kid will drive this thing so much that you'll likely be swapping them a lot. But the batteries do last quite a while. Also, if you have a younger kid, I recommend keeping the gear shift locked at position #1 (there is a latch that you screw on to keep it out of 2nd gear) for at least a few months until he/she can demonstrate they can handle driving the tractor.

If you're handy with electronics, you can go to Radio Shack and buy some wires, LED bulbs, an on/off switch and battery packs and make your own headlight/taillight system.

Overall, this was a huge hit and I don't regret buying it for a second.

title: Great Battery, But Pieces Fell Off
text:
This was the first Power Wheels type toy we got for our son. When he turned 3, he was very into tractors, so we decided to surprise him with this little one to allow him to help "mow" grandma's lawn. We gave it to him on a Saturday, which led to several drives into hedges and garages) and by Sunday he was driving it perfectly, executing K turns to bypass certain difficult to turn areas.

It was beautiful but within the first few months, parts of it began to fall off, including reflectors on the front and the side pipe thingie. By the end of the first year (of good use), the whole of the front had fallen off and wouldn't stay on no matter how often we reattached it. Having said that, through very heavy use over the years, the battery is JUST (four years later) starting to fail. It's been a beast at letting my son and now, my daughter, get around Grandma's lawn.

Definitely a great purchase.

It drives fantastically on grass and bumpy areas, and even when the slope is stip. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!! My son absolutely got histerically happy over this gift and so are our 7 & 10yo boys. I would say it fits a child anywhere from a 2.5yo and an 8yo. My 10yo is tall, and is a bit too tall for this, but even still enjoys it. The radio is real and functional, which adds an awesome feature to this already super awesome ride on.

I'm sure #2 will be easier to manage if I didn't run into the problem stated in #1, but that's where I'm left with this product.

title: I've never seen someone so happy to have a John Deere like his Granddaddy
text: My grandson was 20 months old when we got this for him for Christmas.  I was leery after reading some of the reviews, thinking I should wait until next year.  But he was completely obsessed with my husband's John Deere lawnmower, so we took the chance.  He's average in weight and height and I figured he could play with putting things in the trailer if too small to ride.  However, The little stinker knew exactly how to drive this tractor.  He has to be told to keep it in the lower gear, as this thing will fly.  He still needs someone nearby to make sure he steers correctly, but this was a major "hit" for us as Grandparents.  I've never seen someone so happy to have a John Deere like his Granddaddy.  Just know that safety comes before anything and you should be with the child until you know he/she knows what they're doing.  The tractor will fly!

The battery is holding charge pretty well just make sure they don't expect top ride our right away because our doors need to charge for 18 hrs before use. title: Amazing little tractor!
text: It has really good power for a 12V battery. We've put all sorts of things in the trailer including firewood and it moves along wonderfully. The second gear is quite fast, but it has a "lock out" key for the 1st gear, so you can leave it there if the 2nd gear feels too fast. It could easily fit a 3-7 year old, so the description is accurate. The radio is also a very cute feature. My son LOVES it.

title: Great for ages 3plus
text:
Item arrived used. Paid nearly 300$ to be given a used, scratched item and what sucks is we did not notice until halfway through assembly. Customer service was HORRIBLE I did not have the patience to deal with their indifference so I eventually spoke to a supervisor who refunded the difference between the "new item" price and the "used item" price. This was a gift for my sons birthday so simply returning it the day prior was not an option.

Overall he likes it but really prefers to ride in the trailer while my daughter drives him around. He just turned two though so I'm sure he will grow to love it.

title: Just like Papa's
text:
We parked this John Deer mower in the same place that ours is usually parked. As soon as we opened the garage our grandson almost thought it was Papa's. His dad finally said looked at this. Then he caught on and said "Oh, a baby lawn mower, like Papa's". He has just turned 3 and he jumped on like he had always ridden it.The radio was a plus!

He rode this around for one hour and stopped and picked up little tree branches from the yard and put them in his loader. I've never seen any child laugh so much and enjoy anything as much as this. He did not want to stop but it was getting dark and ready for bed time.

We live on 9 acres and he had plenty of space to ride his John Deer in the back yard. He had plenty of not so level ground to cover and this mower kept going.

It was not difficult to get the lawnmower ready to ride at all. The wheels were plenty large and traction was great.
Great, great purachase.

text: Awesome tractor. Fairly easy to put together. My only issue is that there isn't a on / off switch for the tractor. Also, the pedal is right where they climb on, so I can envision the tractor jolting forward before the child is seated. Could be a huge safety issue

title: Read carefully, 4WD tires but not 4WD traction!
text:
Be careful that the text mentions 4WD tires, this means the front tires show threads instead of "lines", but the tractor is still only RWD.
One very nice thing is that the kid's weight is on the rear, so it has tons of traction compared to other similar toys. Going uphill, the tires do grip much more because of the weight directly above.
Other nice features are the 2nd-gear lock that is mechanical and sturdy and the reverse mechanism that makes going into reverse more difficult (a good thing when there's a trailer behind)!
Overall very satisfied!

We live in the middle of nowhere and it goes great on our dirt driveway and grass! I love the working fm radio (even though where we live it doesn't pick up any radio stations) I think for the overall price, the lights should be working and it should come with a working horn. Other than that my son loves it and loves to haul things in his trailer!

title: Pretty great but a couple minor let downs.
text:
The Trailer only holds 22 lbs is my only reason for giving 4 stars. I would have thought that my son at 2 years old would at least be able to ride in it however it does not feel sturdy enough or have a good enough connector to the tractor to feel comfortable with him in there.
The tractor is 12V with 2 speeds and in 1st speed it is faster than most 6V power wheels.
There is a lock out for 2nd speed which I like so younger ones cant shift to it easily and possibly hurt themselves on it!
The tires I thought could have been better. I have some other power wheels that have a rubber strip around the center that is great for traction and limits slip of tires and adds padding / cushion if they ride it indoors in our basement.
Other than that assembly isn't too bad.
My only complaint about the instructions is they could have been written better. The pictures are on one page then ask you to read the pictured instructions 2 pages over. Which will lead to about a half hour of flipping from page to page during assembly.
Other than that it feels sturdy and seems great!
Our son loves it now he has a John Deere mow mow just like Daddy.

title: Safety concers
text:
This item does not come with a remote. There is also no on/off button which means that if the child gets on or off the tractor on the side that has the gas petal, the tractor is going to start moving, leading to potential injuries. There isn't much room on the floor board, where the gas pedal is, so when the child stands to get off the tractor, the vehicle moves. The exhaust stack has a handle on it, but it easily bends and cannot really be used as an aid to get on the tractor, even though it appears to be there for that reason. The stack is also on the side with the gas pedal which increases the chance of children stepping on that side and the vehicle moving before the child is seated.
This is the third in a variety of riding vehicles, that we have bought for our grandchildren. This tractor is very cute and we really liked that it is made in the US, but are disappointed with these safety concerns and that there was no remote control included.

title: Tractor Fun
text: This is a great product.  It is very durable and my two year old really loves it.  The only complaint I would have about this toy is that the wheels are not rubber and are instead plastic, thus they do not grip on certain terrains and spin out fairly easily.  If the back wheels at least were rubber, this toy would have recieved 5 stars from me.  I would still recommend the toy as-is...

title: 1star for durabilty,5plus stars for Amazon!
text: We purchased this for our grandson 2weeks ago&it had a few minor issues immediately and a critical one today.1st,the hood had to be held closed with a bungy cord the 1st day.then to put the wagon on and take off you need a screwdriver to lever the tab up over the ridge it needs to be inbetween to be secured.also the battery only lasts about 45minutes,so we had to purchase a better longer life one.and yesterday it started running intermittently and today finally just quit altogether.when you take your foot of the pedal it quits/shuts off completely and wont go again,at all.as if there is some kind of short or something.HOWEVER,my grandson loves it so I called Amazon right away and by the time I got off the phone and checked my email,its replacement was already shipped!I have to say that despite the inconvenience and issues with the product iam once again VERY impressed with Amazon's customer service and their willingness to satisfactorily resolve issues for and with their customers.In todays economy that is very important to me,thanks Amazon!p.s. you are almost forgiven for that highly annoying 25 dollar minimum on order add ons before they will ship!  :)

text:

It's not hard to put together but, there are a lot of directions. You have to put all the little pieces together and attach all the stickers. It also has a 2nd gear that is locked with a screw so you can take it off whenever your child is ready. We have not taken it off and it still fast enough in 1st gear. It was definitely worth some frustration when my son was able to enjoy it. It's a well made tractor and is very durable. The radio does require batteries.
Overall, I recommend this tractor because it resembles a John Deere tractor and the radio and trailer make it worth it. Please comment or ask any questions.

It came with a trailer which my grandson loves.  I was afraid it may be too big for him since he just turned 2 but it’s the perfect size.

title: Great tractor though it comes with a slow charger, instruction assembly issues, and part fit issues.
text:
Numerous other reviewers have expounded extensively on the pros of this tractor and so I don't want to go into reiterating those in detail other than to state that overall, the tractor looks and functions like a great tractor and my son loves it!

However, I want to highlight three points of concern that causes in my humble opinion, unnecessary frustration, and hence my reduction of 2 stars to this product (ideally, I would give it 3.5 stars, but that option doesn't exist). All these concerns are interconnected to a degree and can easily be resolved.

- 1. Even though the assembly should have taken no more than a couple of hours (because there were relatively few parts to assemble), it ended up taking around 7-8 hours because two items had issues with fit.
--- A. Firstly, the steering wheel alignment with the screw was potentially not well designed (atleast in my order) and it took me 2 hours to get it aligned (the radio mentioned in bullet 2 below compounded the issue).
--- B. Secondly, the front hood couldn't be put in initially because one part was not cut out to appropriate fit and I finally realized it only after watching a YouTube video (as the instructions provided in the manual were unclear - more on this later). If it wasn’t for the YouTube video, I would have made a mistake and drilled a hole in the wrong place. I finally solved it by having to cut a hole on a panel using my drill.

- 2. The battery really shouldn't take close to a day to charge; this in my humble opinion, is unacceptable because of several factors including the potential risks mentioned by Peg Perego (i.e, pg. 2, Warning point 5: "During recharging operations make sure the battery charger is in a well-ventilated area” and potential risks posed by overcharging anything in general). I understand that there is a fast charger that can be purchased for an additional $40 which can charge the battery in 2 hours (I purchased and tested it out and it works). However, I wish the fast charger was included with this vehicle and the FM radio which seems like an unnecessary "luxury" in addition to being an impediment to installing the steering wheel removed. The only way to get the FM radio out (the FM radio has two separate AA batteries which might require replacement) after installing it is to remove the steering wheel which I do not plan to do for reasons already mentioned. The other option is to slightly increase the cost of the tractor by removing the "super-slow charger" and placing the fast charger in lieu of it as I am certain people would be willing to spend a few more dollars especially considering that tractor is a premium product.

-3. Some of the instructions in the assembly manual were unclear and ambiguous. Three of the most egregious instances (out of multiple) that cost me an inordinate amount of time include:
--- A. On pg. 5, direction 12, they should have mentioned that the trailer was done (first 11 directions were about the trailer). Direction 12 was a new direction not related to the trailer; however, it was not mentioned that the direction applies to the front of the vehicle.
--- B. On pg.7, Direction 14, only one image describes a complicated process of putting in the hood. This process is far more complex than this image describes especially because of what I faced (described in bullet 1 of this review).
--- C. On pg. 8, direction 30, it was not mentioned that if you are not careful, you can actually screw in the steering wheel "upside down" (an aesthetic problem more than it is a functional problem), this is problematic especially because in my case it took close to 2 hours to screw it in only to realize it was upside down and then spending another 1.5 hours to put it back in place (aligning all the parts for the steering wheel is complicated because of the FM radio, pushing a rod in through the bottom of the tractor and holding it in place without it falling back, inserting the steering wheel and holding it in place, all while simultaneously ensuring that the tires are turned so the item can be screwed in).

title: Must be luck of the draw, worked ok for 6 hours of use
text: Pretty well constructed, took a little while to assemble. Unfortunately for us after 6 hours of use, reverse stopped working. Then low gear. Then sadly it stopped moving at all. A new battery did not fix it. Meanwhile we have a 5yr old older version of this that works perfectly, but is falling apart after heavy use, a few batteries and a few very happy kids. So it looks like I will be looking into aftermarket motors and who knows what else for this new one. Also, like others mention, traction is somehow poor on all surfaces except gravel, so I will be solving that as well. I sure as heck do not need another project going on right now, but depending on how it turns out, hopefully I can brighten this review up a bit in a month or two.

title: My grandson loves his tractor!
text: By far the best toy we have ever given our grandson. We babysit 3 days a week and it’s the first thing he wants to do at our house. He is 3 and mastered his driving skills on day one. We all love this toy!!!

title: I consider their service department to be excellent. As per the tractor I considered it to ...
text:
Product was delivered new and was well packaged. Although upon assembly I noticed a part which should have been attached to the chassis was pulled off and loose in the box. This part is where the hood assembly attaches to.The part had a dog ear that was broken off. I called Per Peŕego and they immediately responded by sending out a replacement part and it was received in two business days. I consider their service department to be excellent.
As per the tractor I considered it to be well made and should hold up for a long time for my Grandson.

title: Fun
text: 4 year old boy loves it

title: Best bike to buy!
text:
Awesome power wheel

This was the best gift I’ve ever given to my kid!! Seeing his little amazed face was the best feeling ever. This jeep is super awesome and I wish I could jump in and have fun with it too! The radio is good and the speaker is pretty loud and nice. Can drive on grass, dirt, gravel or pavement.

It’s a lot of fun guaranteed!

title: Our Son Loves His Tractor
text:
Our son got this for Christmas when he was around 2. He didn't get to use it much that winter but he really took to it in the spring. He has litterally worn the wheels off of it now. He loves John Deere and loves to pretend he is like his Pap Pap when we take it over to their house. Very cute ride on for boys who dig tractors!
We also had a bent fender peice when it arrived but a quick call to Peg Perego and they sent us a new unbent one for free which to me is great customer service.

title: Great item!
text: Bought this for our 3 year olds birthday. It was a huge hit!! Super sturdy and durable! Would highly recommend!

title: Five Stars
text: Perfect!!!!

title: Sam loves it
text: Bring your A game on assembly. It wasn't necessarily difficult as it was time consuming. Especially all the decals. The battery lasts a long time and the tractor goes most places. It can hang up a little in holes as it does not have a suspension. Love this for my son, purchases for his 3rd Bday. At just 3 yrs old Samuel maneuvered it easily. The trailer will fit a kitchen trash bag with trash and let your little one feel important and helpful. Sam drove it at least 3 hours on a battery charge. I recommend this purchase. I want to give the best review possible. I also recommend not mounting the exhaust pipe as it has no function, but it will automatically be used as a handle and stress the plastic on the tractor.

title: Great Product
text: We love this! Doesn’t take long to put together and has a great battery life and loud radio and is pretty fast. Very pleased.

title: Five Stars
text: Our 4 year old grandson love this as well as his 20 month old sister!

title: Well worth the money
text: This tractor is well built. Battery stays charged for hours. The only bad thing is that it is hard to back up with the trailer attached.

title: Rugged and Durability
text: Was a Gift. Easy to assemble. Rugged. Easy to learn for child. Still going strong.

title: Repackaged Return?
text: Ordered for my son's birthday, which is in a week. I assembled it as soon as it arrived, seems like a repackaged return. Plastic is white from being bent in spots. Some of the snap clips on pieces are broken, and fall right off. The assembly guide tells you to install decals that are no longer included. Hopefully they can make this right before his birthday. Honestly, I'm midly disappointed.

title: Grandson loves it
text: Instructions could be a little clearer but overall was easy to assemble.  Decal application is a little tricky but with patience can be applied well.  Very sharp looking when completed and high quality for the money.  Would recommend for child over 3 yrs old.

title: Overall, it’s a good kids toy for the price, but it’s not flawless.
text:
This tractor has been great for my 2 year old son, but recently we did have some problems. Lately the battery has not been holding charge very long at all. And more recently, even after a full charge it dies within minutes. We’ve had it for about 9 months now, so not sure if that’s normal or not.

Upon arrival, assembly was more tricky than I thought it’d be as there were no words with the instructions, just pictures. Once assembled, it worked very well; however, the radio did come damaged. To this day, it’s never worked. One of the buttons came jammed which prevented the radio from ever properly working.

Overall, it’s a good kids toy for the price, but it’s not flawless.

title: Five star best toy we ever bought
text: A must have for any boy

title: Excellent product; has its limits
text: Really decent traction for a steep hill.  A huge hit with both my 7 year old and 4 year old.  I'm waiting for better weather to use it more often.  Assembly was only mildly irritating. Biggest complaint, and I'm still giving this four starts as a quality product, is that there is a load cutoff.  What happens is my son will be booking up a steep hill and the tractor decides a load threshold has been exceeded and cuts power.  4 year old has his foot down so the tractor then quickly goes in reverse and picks up speed going downhill backwards.  Son looks at me in panic with his foot still planted.  Even if he lifted his foot, I'm not sure it has a brake for when the tractor is rolling in reverse.

title: I highly recommend
text: My grandson loves his tractor !! I highly recommend

title: Well built and sturdy
text: Very durable and realistic in details.

title: It moves great on grass and even locked onto lower speed
text: My son was thrilled to get this for his birthday, he is three. This will last him awhile, my 6 year old loves it too!  It moves great on grass and even locked onto lower speed, is still fun. It does go fast if not locked out just be aware! Goes great on the grass which is huge bonus for us.

title: Nice and cool but not safe enough
text: Nice and cool but not safe enough , no seat belt and no effective parent control. Not for 2 years old, the child has to understand how to operate it by himself. There's a lot to like in that tractor and it makes it even more disappointing that the company ignored the most important thing, which is safety!

title: Good quality
text: Solid made. My boy run it to the rock. No damage at all. hands down.

title: Son Loves it
text: Only two parts of assembly were confusing/difficult (rear chassis in the front??) Thing is really fast even on 1. We didn't bother to even put batteries into the radio because it's stupid to keep removing steering wheel to change them. Battery life is great, son hasn't ran out of juice yet between charges (1-4 hours/day)

title: Cute little tractor!
text: Adorable. The radio is fun but doesn't work when tractor is moving. The steering wheel is tight and my 2.5 yr old can't maneuver it well but my older kiddos can. It does go fast which my kiddos think is awesome. It was easy to put together!

title: Loved by my boys
text: I got these for my 3 1/2 year old twin boys for Xmas. They loved them. They learned quickly how to drive them and would play outsideon them for hours if it weren't so cold outside.

title: Five Stars

title: Well built
text: bought this for great-grandchildren to use when visiting. pleased with how sturdy it is, how easy for 3-yr old to drive.  kids like being able to haul small items.  we were pleasantly surprised to see how it goes up a fairly steep trail.

title: Five Stars
text: Hours of fun for our grandchildren!

title: Bad instructions, flimsy battery compartment, cute tractor!
text:
Okay, the assembly isn’t too bad but the instructions are not good. The separate paper that tells what screws to use fell upon opening, so for half of the installation we kept wondering what screws to use. It doesn’t specify in the main instruction manual.
The hood is a bit flimsy and not a great design when opening and closing.
Other than that, it’s adorable! My daughter loves riding with daddy on his John Deere. Since she was a couple months old, she has been soothed by a ride around the yard on the tractor. So I’m so excited to get her her own now that she’s old enough. It’s an Easter gift, so she hasn’t used it yet. But it seems like it will work well and hopefully last until she outgrows it. For the price, there’s a couple things we were disappointed about (when it comes to quality). But overall, happy with purchase!

title: Gift for Grandson
text: He loves it!! This was an upgrade from the smaller version. Only wish it had the music of the smaller one instead of the radio. The radio is not clear at times.

title: Pure fun
text:
My grandson started riding this at 2 years old. 🚜. It’s still running great.🫠.
But I just purchased another one for him because it’s had two and a half years of use.
He has been constantly working so hard through all the season’s . ( Having Fun!)♥️
He said that he still wants to keep the old one when the new one arrives . Awe 😇
It’s like and old friend and filled with great memories . ♥️🚜♥️
KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK MAKING THIS
FUN, DURABLE, HIGH QUALITY MACHINERY FOR ALL KIDS. 🌺. I admit that I’ve driven it quite a few times . I’ve even sat in the back while he drives me around . 🚜🚜🚜
. Fun, fun and more fun.
Love it.♥️🚜♥️

He loves working the radio but needs a little help hooking and unhooking the trailer. He loves helping me haul veggies back from the garden and follows his dad around “mowing” the lawn.

Ended up soldering the wire to the motor post as I didn't have enough wire to put on a clip. I expected better quality for the price. Over all I hope your handy with tools and electrical if you buy this. My three year old loves riding it around.

This is the second one UI have bought - I got one earlier for another grandson and he has had it for a couple of years - the tractor has stood the test of time.

title: Five Stars
text: Awesome and fast

title: Great tractor!
text: So glad I got this for my 4-year-old for his birthday!!  He loves cruising aroud the yard, listening to the radio, and helping us with chores.  Solidly built, battery holds charge for a long time.  Of you're looking for a ride-on toy for a child 4ys+ (as it has quite a bit of pick-up), I highly recommend it!

title: Runs like a Deere!
text: There is more assembly required than we thought, but "Santa" got it done alone.  Our 4 yr. old grandson loves this tractor!  It actually shifts and the tires grab the ground really well.  He was able to drive on a snow packed driveway when the big tractor that Dad has would not.  There are some safety features that are nice, too.  A perfect purchase.

title: Great products
text: My son loves this thing

title: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE
text: Only tiny issue I had was part of it was broken off. It was inside of the battery section so my son doesn't even know.

title: Great Tractor for Ranch Living
text: This is a great tractor! We live on acreage with no paved roads in sight--all gravel drives, grassy hills, rocky slopes, and muddy roads, and rarely does this toy get stuck. It drives on gravel and grass great. My only complaint is I wish the back tires had a rubber tire tread to reinforce its' manueveribilty--these wheels are all plastic. BUT--our son got a ride-on motorcycle for his birthday and that toy doesn't do nearly as well as this tractor on the gravel & grass (had to take the motorcycle to my mom's who has paved roads). My son still rides this everyday and he got it for a birthday present 6 months ago. The added wagon on the back makes him feel he is helping his daddy on the ranch :) and really, he helps his mommy a lot too because you can load that wagon up with things for him to pull that I don't have the hands to carry (like a couple grocery bags or picking up downed tree limbs). The instructions to put it together are...typical crappy instructions, so have patience and beer handy. It's kinda loud when running, but on acreage that's nice because if I can't see him, I can at least hear him if he's close. The radio addition is cool but my son would rather have had functioning lights on the front of the tractor like his dad's tractor. So far the battery life has been great. He rides it for about 2-3 hours altogether each day & we plug it in each night. It's only died out once in 6 months. Overall I'd buy this again any day of the week. This little rancher loves his tractor!

title: Defective
text: Only one wheel motor works and only high gear works. Radio came out of the packaging broken. Item can not be returned and there’s no seller contact information to resolve issues. Very disappointed!

title: Impressive battery life. Relatively rugged and adequate speed. ...
text:
Impressive battery life. Relatively rugged and adequate speed.

Only negative it the trailer is a joke. 22lb max load on the trailer.

title: My son is now a John Deere man.
text: My child loves this.  But it is a bit flimsy.  The grill came broken but the company quickly sent a replacement at no cost.  The hood is hard to put down and get perfectly into place so you can close the latch.  But the battery lasts a long time and like I said, my boy LOVES it.  He is 3 and weighs about 35 lbs.  It's the perfect size for him and he will probably use it a few more years before he outgrows it.  He got this for his birthday and his Aunt has already ordered him a little gas pump for Christmas so he can "filler-up!".  It was worth the price to see the joy on his face.  I also ordered the extra working horn which added that special touch.  Only wish the radio had presents.  Every time you turn it on, it starts at the beginning of the dial.  But it absolutely works.

title: not what was expected
text: cute and the boys like it, but it is flimsy, not to mention it makes a "rubbing noise" when you hit the gas pedal, the wagon top keeps falling off the base, the front cover covering the battery is very flimsy & there is NO RETURN POLICY. when you buy it it says you can sign up for an extended warranty, they fail to mention that you can only take it to or ship to a perego service center to be fixed. (not including shipping both ways) which once its put together are you supposed to take the whole thing apart and try to find a box big enough for it to be shipped in?? not what we expected. overall the kids play with it, battery last about 1-1/2 hours but I would not buy this product again. I would buy something more sturdy and from a place you can actually return an item like this.

title: Three Stars

title: Perfect present
text: [[VIDEOID:45d4e81210c02beb04d055a1c8d45e79]] Our son loves it!! (& the pup as well 😊)

title: Great tractor but a few shortcomings...
text:
Got this for my son's 3rd birthday. He was so excited and started driving it like a pro. I would give this 5 stars if not for the following items:

1. slow charge times
2. radio is junk and replacing the batteries is a tedious chore
3. instructions on assembly were written by an engineer

Ways for them to fix these items:

1. include the rapid charger or give that as an option to get in lieu of the slow chargers
2. make batteries easier to replace or run the radio from the main battery (some engineers aren't too bright)
3. make a video for assembly that is easy to follow and put on youtube or website. I ended up finding a video of some Aussies assembling this (thank GOD!) and that made it less unbearable.

All in all, great product and I've never seen my son so excited before.

title: Great
text: My two year old grandson loves this!

title: Great Buy !!
text: My Grandson Loved His Tractor Highly Recommend!!

title: Exactly what I expected
text: It arrived few days before Christmas like it was suppose to and the instructions were not to difficult but you will need a hammer and a screw driver. Let it charge on Christmas eve and the following morning let my toddler see it. He absolutely loves it spent an hour riding it around.

title: Great battery life.  Great product
text: I am very happy with this. I researched so many different ride on tractors for my three years old and worried about battery life and durability. This has a great battery life. My yard is not level and it pulls the hills and inclines with little effort. Does great on gravel and grass. Worth every penny. He is so happy with this and loves to take it everywhere.

title: This has been an awesome gift for my son
text: This has been an awesome gift for my son! We have had it for about 15 months now (Christmas 2014) and it has held up and is working great!

title: Three Stars

title: It needs AA batteries
text: I spent $300 on this thing to find out the steering part needs AA batteries...that it also doesn't come with a remote. I spent half the price in a police car during Christmas time and it had a remote and all the steering was part of the rear of the cars battery source. Ridiculously priced when I could have just gotten the one with the remote for $179 smh all because it says John Deere. 😔

title: It goes!
text: My tall four year old son loves this tractor! We have gone through SEVERAL power wheels with three boys and this one is awesome. Finally they make both rear wheels turn! My husband always had to modify the other styles so my kids could ride on the grass and gravel. This little tractor goes right through deep mud. It has a good bit of torque and stays charged pretty long.

title: Exactly as expected!
text: We have not driven this product on the road, so I can't speak to how well it works on asphalt, but it is an excellent addition to our backyard toys! It has zero traction issues on the grass. My son is in love and would ride it for hours if he could. (Plus, it matches Daddy's ride-on lawn mower, so that's a huge plus!) We did buy the additional battery for a longer run time. The battery life is about as long as I expected (45 minutes). Overall, we're really satisfied and happy with the price we paid.

title: Stops working after two months
text: We received this item in September and it stopped working 2 months later. It will not charge. We paid to much money for the tractor for it to work less than 2 months. I would not recommend this item to other people.

title: I was not sure how well he would do with this since he has never enjoyed bikes, hot wheels ect
text:
I never take the time to write a review but this time I am. We gave this tractor to our son for Xmas. He is 5 y/o, 45lbs and about 44" tall.
He is also on the autism spectrum. I was not sure how well he would do with this since he has never enjoyed bikes, hot wheels ect. However, he loves to ride on his dad's tractor and we hoped he would like this as well. Once he realized he could handle this easily- he loved it! He zooms around our basement, rides around the yard... It was a great purchase. Well built. He fits fine on it. I was concerned he would be too tall for it, but it is not a problem. I expect this toy will get a lot of use before we pass it on.

title: His Favorite Toy!
text: We love this little tractor. It was for my grandson’s 3 rd birthday. It didn’t take him long to figure out how to go! The radio came damaged. I called the 800 number. They were super nice and sent a replacement immediately. It’s also made in the USA! Awesome!

title: Cute but pricey for it’s size
text: Bought for my 3 year old grandson.  It’s a good thing he’s small.

title: Five Stars
text: A well made toy our grandson loves it

title: Great toy. My son loves it
text: Great toy. My son loves it. Only problem is the battery won't charge and we've only had it 5 months. Now need to figure out whether we need a new charger or battery. My son in very disappointed.

title: Fun tractor for your kid!
text: This is a great tractor, made in America, and looks awesome.  Pretty easy to upgrade power and traction for better performance.

title: Great tractor, not so great battery
text: Our son loves this tractor! Our only complaint is he battery it comes with doesn’t last very long at all. We ended up needing to purchase a larger one and they aren’t cheap!  But the tractor itself is fun and he loves carrying stuff around in the trailer.

title: Grandson absolutely loves this tractor
text: My grandson absolutely loves this tractor. Powerful and runs great!

title: Great powerwheel
text: Gave to my son for Christmas. He absolutely loves it.

title: Best ride on
text: We bought this for our 2-year-old son, who loves tractors. He is able to steer and ride on his own (we keep the faster speed locked). This tractor is his favorite part of life right now. The battery seems to hold up very well—we always charge the battery when he is finished riding, as recommended in the instructions. There was one small plastic piece missing when we received this in the mail, but it is purely cosmetic and doesn’t impact functioning.

title: battery/charger issue
text:
Tractor itself is great, son absolutely loves it!
Something is either wrong with battery or the charger....the light on the charger never turns green to say it’s ready and fully charged.

title: Five Stars
text: Grandson loves it!!

title: Lots of fun, but not very durable.
text: This tractor/wagon combo is great fun and can make it thru most terrain.  It has a tendancy to get hung up on uneven terrain pretty easily tho.  You have to be right there to push them out of any situations where they get stuck.  If they do get stuck and try to pull on the tractor (vs. putting it in reverse) the entire front end of the tractor comes apart.  It is not held together very well, so I had to superglue/duct tape it together.  Mostly fun, but needs to be more durable/held together better.

title: Tough little tractor!
text: Bought this little tractor for my four year old grandson. It was fairly easy to assemble, only a screwdriver and hammer were required to use. However it requires some time to put it together. You have to follow the written instructions and keep referring back to the pictures in the instruction sheets to actually understand what to do at each step. It's made with mostly all plastic parts, the fit and function are good. This toy will last a long time. It has a two speed foward gear which can be set to low, about  2.5 mph ,or  5 mph second gear. It also has a reverse gear. This toy tractor comes with a working, no joke, FM radio! Now that's cool! The tractor comes with a pull trailer that you assemble, it holds about 20 lbs of stuff. I would highly recommend this toy. Peg Perego toy customer service is outstanding and very responsive.

title: Great item
text: My Grandson loves this tractor.

title: Five Stars
text: great product and delivery

title: Favorite toy - has taken a lot of abuse and keeps keeping on :)
text: Hours and hours of abuse in all types of weather.  Animals in the back end, dog chasing it around - this is a great tractor!  The battery needs plugged in nightly, but I think that this is the same for most electric vehicles.  Has had several hard impacts with trees, etc., but has only had minor damage.

title: Cost of product
text: So far so good, no issues

title: Defective battery holder and defective charger!!!
text: The first tractor I purchased from Toys-R-Us came with a defective battery holder; a plastic part that holds the battery in place under the hood was broken!  So, I returned and got a new one.  The same issue!!  The third replacement had the same issue with a part broken at a different place!!!  Unbelievable!  It is probably still operational without the holder with screws, but it will be rattling under the hood.  At the end, I agreed to take the floor model - the only one with a working, intact battery holder.  The battery holder is poorly designed with weak plastic parts.  I'm afraid that it will break in the near future when the tractor hits a few bumps.  The next issue is the charger for the battery.  It has a green/orange color light indicator that tells you whether the battery is fully charged or not.  This light indicator is always green whether the battery is charged or not.  I called Peg Perego to replace the charger, but they refused.  They insisted that as long as it is charging, it's working although you don't know when it's fully charged... They refused to replace the charger.  A terrible customer service!!  Other issues:  rough stop-and-go, loose hubcaps for the trailer that needed gluing.  As for the fun factor, my boy loves riding this.

title: Best ride on by far!!
text:
This was purchased for my 4 year old that is very tall for his age. this is by far one of the best purchased I have made. he absolutely loves it. the battery last about 1 hour on the high speed non stop driving and we live on top of a mountain with very rough terrain and steep hills. this tractor goes through everything. My 5 year old takes it from his little brother every chance he gets. my 5 year old is also very tall for his age (47"). he fits on this perfect with room to grow and loves it, looks like he will be getting one for Christmas.
I DO RECOMMEND GETTING AT LEAST 1 EXTRA BATTERY AND QUICK CHARGER. completely worth the extra money, the standard charger it comes with takes 18 hours to recharge the battery, not very convenient. I believe quick charger takes about 2 hours for full charge.

text: Great toy for our 3 year old. He loves it. We keep the second gear out of his reach and first gear goes fast enough for him. He doesn't like the trailer because it's hard to back up with it attached.

title: Lots better than Power Wheels
text: I got a similar Peg Perego John Deere Tractor 11 years ago for my grandson.  10 grandkids later it is still going strong.  My daughter bought two Power Wheels vehicles for their daughters 2 yrs ago. They have replaced motors and a pedal switch.  The Peg Perego has been abused for 11 years and replaced the battery once.  Further abuse was modifying it, on and off, to run on an 18v drill battery.  Makes it much faster, but not for youngest kids.  The old John Deere with the 18v battery is the one the kids fight for when they are together. It runs circles around the Power Wheels.  Although is not the same model, Peg Perego is superior.

title: Not worth the price! Only lasted 5 months before quit running
text: Bought for my grandson for christmas. And am very disappointed in this product. it does not have power when  going up small inclines in the yard and it stalls out alot on flat surfaces. He has to get off and push it more then he rides it. Not alot of power for a powerwheeler.  Way over priced. Don't know if it is defective or  they are all this way. Didn't even last 5 months.

title: Great product going strong months later with heavy daily use
text:
First off we love the tractor. But it is most definitely 4 wheel drive like it says. It is however amazing. My son has been driving this since his second birthday every day. EVERY DAY. Rain or shine. He has fallen asleep at the wheel on this thing. It flies through mud puddles, over the prairie, in ditches, over small rocks, he's got it close lines on big rocks, running over other toys. This tractor goes and goes and goes! We've had it over 6 months now and there's been no issue with the battery or motor and a single charge can last days. But we try to plug it in every night because we know how long he rides. We also try to bring it in for wet weather but it has lasted through rain and snow without issue. It's not too heavy so if your little one does get stuck it's easy to get unstuck.

The trailer initially was a little difficult to lock in place because it's so tight, but after my husband did it several times then it was loose enough so I could do it too. 90% of the time we leave the tractor trailer off because things get complicated with backing up. The radio is an awesome addition too.

title: Great!!

The only issue we have is the front black grill part sometimes falls off so maybe for future reference there should he a screw or two attaching it. But otherwise we love it!

It's a great toy although the manufacturer of the tractor placed the battery compartment for the radio behind the steering wheel so every time you have to change the batteries you have to remove the steering wheel...not very convenient and the hitch on the trailer is made so that it cannot be locked in place, therefore, the trailer keeps popping off when riding....a little frustrating.  Other than that, it is a fun toy for kids.

title: Awful assembly manual
text:
Putting this together with an assembly manual that only has drawings but no written instructions can be challenging. I guess this was Peg Perego's technique for not having to provide instructions in three different languages. It would have been REALLY helpful if the drawings included arrows to indicate the direction in which the part is supposed to connect or where it is supposed to connect to. Lots of trial and error.

Other than that, my grandson loves it. Rubber tires would have been preferrable than plastic because grip is poor going uphill in the grass and slips a lot.

title: BUY THIS!!!!!
text: This is the BEST toy EVER!!! Our 2 year old little boy loves this tractor. He rides it all day long. He cries when I tell him we have to go inside. Buy this toy, you will not regret it. We live in a very hilly and rocky place and it does great. Such a great tractor.

title: My son LOVES it! But keep trailer attached...
text: This was the best birthday gift I could have ever purchased for my 4 year old son. He absolutely loves it! The battery holds a decent charge, but we do bring it in every night to charge. The instructions for assembly were a little unclear, but once you figure it out, the actual procedure to put it together is not too difficult. The tractor is fairly durable, although we ended up taking out the engine side panels. They do not stay in at all. And the front bumper fell off within the first week or so. My son has been hauling vegetables from the garden and cruises up and down the yard. One thing to note, keep the trailer attached. If the child starts it in fast gear on any sort of incline without the trailer, they will for sure flip the tractor. It wants to pop a wheely if started in the faster gear. The trailer will keep it from flipping up. We have had in running nearly every day for 2 months and it is still by far the most exciting thing to do during the day according to my toddler.

title: Pros and Cons
text:
My son is obsessed with tractors, so this was a ideal gift.

After looking at it in the garage for 3 months, one day he decided to try it. He never looked back. It's been an extension of his body ever since.

Pros:
Decent Battery Life

Lock out on speed. This thing is plenty fast in low. I haven't tried what high gear will do. I will say low in this unit is faster than high in his friends Peg Gator.

FM Radio! On a kids ride on.. Are you kidding me.. Everyone that sees it says Wow!. It only has scan forward/back but still... I will note the radio uses independent batteries. AA or AAA. I can't recall which. But they've lasted months of him forgetting to turn it off.

Decent Customer Service. See con below. While there is a design flaw, their customer service was great. It just seems to be a chronic issue that I gave up trying to resolve.

Good traction: After watching his friends peg gator get stuck in relatively flat/short grass I reflected on the places I'd seen our son take this little tractor and marveled. We had 2 tons of sand for a project and it made it half way up a fairly steep pile that was 3 feet tall. Likewise, he drives over a curb in our driveway with relatively ease.

Cons:
The black front grill. It broke off in less than a day. I suspected a bad tab, contacted Peg, who sent out a replacement for free. They even sent new decals to go with it. However, with a young child all it took was a slight bump and it broke again. He now has a grill less tractor. But he just stores toys in the front part under the hood.

The trailer could be a little better designed. It does not have a back gate so things get strewn all over the yard. I will say that it is light which helps when he backs up and jack knives. II assumed it would break the hitch in days. However, the trailer is light enough and the hitch strong enough that I've seen him back it across the yard. The trailer just hops and skids as he goes. He bugs me to put it on and take it off. Which isn't hard, but isn't kid friendly either because it's a tight fit.

Assembly. I was a little surprised at how much time it took to assemble. There were alot of the smaller parts that I would have assumed pre-assembled that weren't.

ALL IN ALL EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!

title: Awesome Little Tractor for Kids.
text:
This kids tractor is awesome. I bought this for my son right before he turned two and he was pretty shaky with it at first. He could press the pedal to make it go forward, but he couldn't steer and going in reverse was not happening. So a lot of time was spent awkwardly bending over and moving forward at the same time steering for him while he pressed the pedal. Well now that he is 2 years and 4 months (6 months of practice) he is an absolute pro. He can steer with a lot of precision and he definitely knows how to use reverse; just this weekend he was riding it and was about to hit a tree, he simply pushed the gear shaft forward in the reverse mode and stepped on the gas to go backwards. We actually removed the governor this weekend so he could go "fast" in second gear and wow. My wife and I were amazed and also shocked at how fast second gear was. It is borderline not safe how fast this thing hauls; I honestly can't stress enough how fast this thing moves. We will probably put the governor back on so he can't put it in second gear for a few more months until he has mastered the steering and actually listens to us when we tell him don't drive down the steep hills or by the end of the driveway. The battery really seems to last a long time which I love. I also modified the tires slightly. I bought small bike tires, cut the curved sides off of them so I was left with a fairly flat rubber circle. Then I boiled a big pot of water, poured the water into a five gallon bucket and through the tires in there for about a minute. This made the tires soften up so I could easily bend them around the rear tires. Now the tires don't spin out every time he presses the pedal and provide much better traction. For the price you really can't beat this thing and my son is obsessed with it; would definitely buy again.

As far as cons: I agree with other reviewers. The battery for the radio should be much easier to change out; i.e. you shouldn't have to take off the steering wheel to get to it. The assembly definitely was a pain in the butt as there are a ton of steps. The hood is a little tricky to lift up, but if you get the little screw in the general vicinity it needs to be you can just pull up with a little force and usually get it.

title: Great toy, but my child is to young to understand how it works.
text:
This is really a neat little tractor. While it is made out of plastic I think it's sturdy enough and well made though not perfect. I wish it had a horn, and a key with working key switch. I would rather had it make realistic tractor sounds and done away with the radio. this is why I gave it 4 stars.

We bought this for our 22 month old son in the hopes of using it as a deterrent to keep our son from climbing all over the real tractor and not get hurt. This idea kinda works...he does still climb on the real lawn tractor but he gets off and goes to his toy tractor that he says is "mine". It also allows him to play inside the house whenever he wants instead of crying at the back door to go to the shed at 6 am on Saturday morning for a ride on the real one. This is worth it to me.

Lastly, I think our child is just too young for this type of toy both physically and mentally. Since he's just 22 months old and the manufacturers recommended age of 36 months and up. (We found several other websites saying 24 months and up)...regardless we thought since we were trying make a safety decision we chose to purchase it anyway. I read a ton of reviews on this before buying it and a lot of people said their child was having a blast on it at only 1 and a half years old. I have found and observed that my son is just not ready for a toy of this type. He's too short for the pedal. We velcro-ed some scrap wood blocks to it but not helpful since he clearly does not have the concept of "push-pedal-make-truck-go" and he's not strong enough to actually steer. Forget trying to use reverse at this age. so I would say maybe in another 6-12 months and he will understand how this toy works and maybe he will start to enjoy is much more.

title: was probaly a quality assembly at one time..
text:
It's clear that many of the snap features are no longer working like they should and the plastic tooling that makes them needs to be repaired. I had to use a screw driver to snap a number of components in that should have just pooed into place. I even needed to belt sand the plastic of the steering wheel to allow it to go together properly. I also was not provided the reflective sicker for the tail lights that the instructions reference. Don't know if this has been intentionally eliminated or just was missing from our box. Not that is a big deal weather the tail light reflect a bit more light it just wasted 15 minuets of my time as I dug through ever piece of the box twice.

The battery life is really so so. On flat land it could probably keep going for a good 30 to 40 min but if you have any hills the battery life gets chewed up significantly fasted. The frustrating part of that shorter than average battery life is the charger is very slow so you wont really get to use it again for a few hours or till the next day.

The radio will never work. Don't even bother installing it unless you like having your kid complain constantly that its not working.

Last, never don't attach the hood fully with the twist catch. I left it unlatched because in 40 minuets i know I would need to [plug it back in but a big gust of wind cam and cough the hood and ended up ripping it right off. Will likely need to DIY some hinge contraption to get it back on.

title: Not tough enough
text:
We bought this for our three year old 4 months ago. It rides well, but the plastic body is not tough enough to last a fairly active bunch of kids and rougher terrain. We have a yard that is not flat, our front area is gravel, driveway is bumpy, our grassy area filled with trees, that is to say it is not driven on a suburban lawn.

1) The first week we had it the plastic hook that attaches the trailer to the tractor broke.
2) The second week the front grill fell off.
3) The body that covers the battery has a small plastic button that was difficult even for an adult to twist and would not always 'catch' to close. As you have to hook the tractor up to the power source every night after use, the kids ended up not bothering to close the top cover. And the plastic cover is so flimsy that it wobbles and is now cracked.
4) Our yard guy tried to move the tractor by holding the smoke stack, which I know is user error, but as he lifted it the smoke stack broke off.
5) The steering shaft has become unscrewed a few times. It goes back on easily, but it would be better if we could rely on it staying in place.
6) Most of the stickers have peeled off.

Even though the tractor doesn't look great now, my kids still ride it all over our property. So the motor does it's job.

Yes we have been tough on our tractor. But for almost $300 I would have expected it to be more sturdy. I am sure it is a better toy for a regular flat yard with concrete drive.

title: Disappointing quality
text: I was really excited to get this for my grandson.  It arrived yesterday and the first thing I noticed is that it appeared to be already partially assembled.  Two glaring issues was the piece where the hood rests on.  It was hanging off only being held by one screw. I took it all off and am attempting to put it back on. As you can see in the picture, the fastners that the screws go into were spinning on the screw and off the base. I'm hoping I can use some glue and put it back on.  The other thing we noticed is that one of the side panels appears to have been bent(see picture). We were able to put it in place without issues.  It also had screws missing.  Thankfully, I have all kinds of screws so I was able to improvise.  I don't know if this was a return and the company did not bother to quality check it before sending back out as new, or just bad quality control.  Either way,  the tractor feels cheap and plasticy(it's a word).  If after a few days, of use, the tractor(drivetrain) itself works ok, I'll come back and add a star to this review.

text:
I orded two and they were great for a few months. Went forward and reverse. Attached end piece fit fine, made it ride a bit slower..so ended up not always using the back trailer. Road faster without it.

However...these both ended up breaking down. They were used daily all spring summer and fall and by winter one broke down. By end of year both stopped working. Pieces and parts broke off. Cheap plastic.

Throughout use the battery life window grew shorter and shorter.

They were fun while they lasted ..but at $1,000 for two...not worth it. If they were priced $300 or even $400 for both...the 5 months of play would have been worth it.

title: Horrible Experience - Still not working
text:
Summary:

- Was forced to run a bunch of tests on my own to figure out problem (thank goodness my father-in-law was an electrical engineer)
- Sent detailed email explaining issue AND talked to someone about it...still sent the wrong replacement part, with intense instructions on breaking down the entire vehicle to install (thats their warranty policy?)
- In second attempt to get correct replacement cost, required to send photos (why not the first time?)

Sent my photos and am crossing my fingers.
Would not recommend and I will personally not be buying from them again.

title: Highly recommend this tractor!
text:
We love this tractor! I bought this Peg Perego tractor for my grandson in 2018. He was a bit young for it but with mom and dad next to him he soon mastered it. My kids live on a ranch and this tractor got a lot of use. My grandson rode this over all sorts of terrain hauling hay, rocks, and cats. We had to replace the battery and tires, but I think that was due to use and not manufacturing.

I think it has two speeds, but the grandson only knew "fast". Even on fast though he was not out of control and we could easily catch him in an emergency.

This year we bought two more for the other two grandkids. The style is somewhat the same by my son-in-law pointed out that the front of the tractor is better fitted and won't disconnect from the frame as easily as the last one. Not that it was ever an issue, but it is better fitted now.

As stated, I had to replace the battery. I could not order online, I had to call customer service. But the experience was great and the product arrived with no issues.

Cons:
1. Assembly is not easy, as others have said read the instructions and have You Tube available.
2. Lastly, we got the Peg Perego two-seater a few years ago and we did not have as great an experience. My daughter said it did not hold a charge as well as the tractor. Something about the placement of the battery and where it is under the kids seats.

title: Hopefully you have better luck
text: I have seen many great reviews on this product so seeing my son wanted one for his 4th birthday we purchased one. However, I was assembling this morning in anticipation for him turning 4 tomorrow and the axel was not properly made. The tires and pieces to connect do not fit on. When trying to get them on some of the washers snapped. I contacted the customer service line who plan to send us out a new bar and washers but that does not help that tomorrow there will be a disappointed little 4 year old.  They did not seem to care much (customer service) and just offered a replacement part. Nice to know our hard earned money doesn't mean much when purchasing from a company that is supposed to be top notch.

title: 3 months later and it stops working randomly.
text: At first this tractor was great, now not even 3 months later the thing stops working randomly and you have to shift it to reverse and back to second before it works again. My son has rode it for 20 min tonight and it has quit 5 times! The battery is charged and hooked up correctly still does it.

title: GREAT PURCHASE

title: 4 year old loves it!
text: Fairly simple to assemble. The hood was a little difficult to get into place, but no problems with it since. I wish the battery was easier to unplug to charge. The charge lasts a long time and it drives great on turf, road base/gravel or pavement. Definitely recommend!

title: great for kids

title: Assembly/ battery charger/customer service not so good
text: The instructions on assembly are very confusing and contradict some of the steps. My biggest problem was the screw holes do not match up when putting together and it took about 5 hours to get it together. The battery charger really didn't do what the instructions said so I called the Peg Perego customer service. The lady was very polite but the response was basically no help. She told me that there were 2 types of chargers and I got the old one and that the chargers really never tell you when the battery is fully charged.  Here again the instructions are very confusing and contradictory. They tell you to charge the first time for 18 hours and that the light will be solid when you start but flash when complete. However she told me that won't happen and that when the tractors begins to slow down re-charge the battery. Anyone would know that !! In other words the charger tells you nothing! They never offered to send a new charger or the second version she mentioned. For a $300.00 toy tractor you should at least get a charger that tells you when the battery is fully charged! DISAPPOINTED.

title: Battery arrived dead and will not charge
text: Just purchased and my son really enjoyed riding it, but it died only after 2 hours of use  after a full charge. SAFETY CONCERN!! The first thing my son asked was “where’s the on off button?” Nope there isn’t one.  It’s really difficult for my son and daughter to learn to exit the tractor without stepping on the gas. This has caused major accidents while trying to exit.  Next, the  battery died after about two hours and will not recharge. Sad!!  Finally, the 1-800 number for customer service is not valid!!! Omg don’t buy from this company!!!

title: Great Tractor  - rides on Tough Terrain
text:
This tractor was a Christmas gift for my then 2 year old son. We bought this after him having a Lightning McQueen battery operated - because he liked to drive in tough terrain and that car sat too low. We live on a lot of property, with a huge pasture. My son is able to drive this tractor EVERYWHERE! It has good power with the 2 speeds (he only drives in 2nd speed) - and has reverse as well. It has been a work horse! He hauls rocks, sticks, and yard trash in the trailer, and it has worked out well. It is hard to back up with the trailer on (just like it would be for a car!).... so we try not to back it up with it on as we saw the wheels might get bent.
We bought an extended life battery for it, and he is able to drive it for much longer now. When he has managed to get it stuck in a hole, he can push it right out. This is a Fantastic gift for a child that wants to test the terrain and explore bumpy, lumpy areas. My only complaint has been the front grate kept falling off because you have to open the front to get to the battery. I am sure my son probably crashed it into something to start the issue... but after it fell off while he was driving it - and he ran over it - it doesn't stay on anymore. 5 months into this toy - he uses it every single day.

title: A little flimsy but otherwise GREAT!

Overall it will work for what he wanted & for the the price we paid (and we LOVE the detail of it - so cute & realistic!)

title: Incredibly rugged - 5 times better than Power Wheels Dune Racer (which are very good ...
text: Incredibly rugged - 5 times better than Power Wheels Dune Racer (which are very good too) - original battery still going strong after 3 years, vs 3rd replacement for Power Wheels. Battery also still lasts for about 3 days of 2-4 hours/day - lasts 3 times as long as the Power Wheels. My 6 yr old (50 lbs) has beat the crap out of this for 3 years in every way imaginable - he likes to build trailers & tow things that are so heavy the motor barely can pull them, yet it keeps going - he runs full speed over tree roots, hole, crashes into trees, etc. It is indestructible & has 3 times the battery life of Power Wheels.

title: Worked great... at first.
text: Okay, so my son is VERY tall for his age. He's 4 but looks 7. I did a lot of research and landed on this tractor because of the size and voltage. At first, it was great and I was impressed with the strength and speed this thing had. My son was straight up off roading, popping wheelies and whipping donuts. That only lasted about 2 weeks however and then one day, the back tires didn't turn anymore and the motor was running at half speed (if that). It was constantly getting stuck and slugging along. For the price I paid, definitely expected it to last longer than 2 weeks. On top of that, it arrived with a broken trailer and a missing tire. Customer service was good about getting me replacement parts, but definitely check everything in advance if this is a Christmas or birthday present because that whole process took about a month. Another important note, this thing was a massive pain in the butt to put together. I was extremely frustrated by the instructions and eventually just used the picture on the front of the box and managed to get by with that, but hated that whole experience. As I mentioned above, THERE IS A HUGE PICTURE ON THE BOX!!! The Amazon delivery guy delivered it straight to my son who saw the picture and immediately knew what he was getting for his birthday. All around, wish I didn't waste my money. But my kid did have fun for 2 weeks, so do with that what you will.

title: Waste of Money...VERY disappointed
text: We are avid amazon purchasers and figured if amazon sold it, it must be good, right?  Well, not right this time!  We purchased this for our son for his third birthday.  He has been driving his brothers jeep since he was 18 months and we figured it was time to get his own ride-on.  We purchased this after reading the reviews and figured, like most people, the ones with the bad reviews are just too picky.  Well, this toy is a complete waste of money!  My son LOVES it, so much he drives it around without the hood on, battery exposed, and doesn't mind when he steps down that the plastic bends.  Yup...the hood broke day ONE. It is a very cheap piece of plastic.  it actually has broken into three pieces (or have come apart I should say)and we have ducted taped them back together multiple times because our son loves it so much and would be DEVASTATED if he couldn't ride it.  BUT, now it won't even go on because the inside piece fell off.  We have given this ride-on 2 months and two rolls of duct tape! I am SOO appalled by this product I can't even give it one star (zero was not an option).  We have purchased new tired for the jeep through amazon, and are now replacing the parts on an old jeep for him.  Please do not buy this product, you WILL be upset at the quality, and for the price you pay, you expect SOME quality! I gave it one star for fun because it's great till my son comes in crying he lost his hood again.

title: Must have!
text: Bought this 5/19/15 for my two year old grandson's birthday.  Said it would take 3-5 business days to ship.  It shipped next day and delivered on 5/21!  Very impressed!!  He got right on and we couldn't get him off!  Now just have to teach him to steer. This tractor is extremely cool, well built......and it has an FM radio that works great and gets 10+ stations!!!  Once his older brother (5) had a chance to ride we set the speed to 4 1/2 MPH which he loved.  Wouldn't recommend starting 2 yr old out on high speed.  4 1/2 MPH doesn't sound like much but on pavement it travels pretty fast.  This was well worth our money!  Grant it we've only had one day but I will keep posting as it gets used more.

title: Just like grandpa's lawn mower
text: Love it! We gave it to my 3 year old for Christmas and luckily it was warm enough for him to drive it around for a while. He likes to help my parent's do yard work and this looks just like my dad's lawn mower. Come Spring time he will love using it to pick up sticks and throw them in the burning pile. We have been out a few times to use it so far and have let him drive it on the first speed, which is enough for now as he gets used to it. The first time he was a bit frustrated that he couldn't just figure out how to drive it but has picked it up quickly and can steer it himself. My husband got a kick out of the radio, my 3 year old could care less about that feature though. My father-in-law put it together and said it was really easy. I will probably buy a back-up battery once he really starts using it more, can't wait for Spring!

It has 2 speed settings and there’s definitely some power behind the motor. My son books it across our field now that he’s got the hang of it. It goes on all terrain.
