title: Cool little tractor
text: My kid loves this because it looks like Daddy’s.  The fit and finish is really good. The battery charger could use some improvement considering the price.  The radio totally sucks.  It doesn’t get decent reception, no presets and the sound is awful.  A used alarm clock radio from 1981 would be a huge improvement.  The tires get no traction at all and is quite frustrating.  I’m going to need to do the bike tire fix for them.  A variable speed control or at minimum a soft start function would be a great upgrade as well instead of full on or full of like a $10 remote control car.  The first time my kid used it the full on scared him he wouldn’t touch it the rest of the day. I would think one or the other should be included for the cost.  I guess in the end I want to give this more stars but the short comings prevents that from happening.

title: Five Stars

title: Great buy!!!
text: I bought this rider for my son on his 3rd birthday. I couldn't be more pleased. I looks like a tea John Deere and he absolutely loves it!! He was so excited to use it. The wheels are great and go over all kinds of terrain. The only problems my son had was going over wet roots one day after it rained and having to hold it in reverse as it doesn't stay, you have to hold it until done reversing. The radio is an added bonus. It's easy for my son to use and steer. I highly recommend to anyone interested in a rider.

title: "I'm a farmer'
text: My child has found his profession.  It is priceless to see him riding his tractor in the pasture while following his grandfather on his tractor.  There is enough battery life for him to have a great time but not enough for him to ride off into the sunset without our catching him first.  The construction has tolerated my son's attempts to lift hay bales with ease.  Part of me wishes the wheels had more traction (they are hard plastic) so he wouldn't get stuck in ruts so often but another part of me is glad to see him being slowed down and having to problem solve by moving the tractor back and forth.  Worth every penny for the sheer joy it has brought my son!

title: We love this!
text: My son loves, loves, loves this tractoe.  He is 3 and can drive it great!  The battery seems to last for a day.  Then we just charge overnight so it's ready for the next day.  He giggles and laughs everytime he rides this.  He goes over our curbing in the lawn and this machine seems to handle it quite well.  Best purchase ever!

title: Do Not waste your money !
text:
Ordered this for child’s birthday ...very important part “The seat” was missing .
The instructions on how to assemble the piece of turd are at times confusing and have to jump ahead at times to understand what piece goes where .
Actually ...the instructions manual is probably one of the worst I have ever used.
None of that matters anyway though because my sons gift has no seat .
It’s big and yellow ....maybe amazon sent me a returned item ?...Either way I personally will never buy a peg Perego item again and hopefully influence others not to also ....Seeing as this may of also been a “returned item “ from amazon I also hold them responsible and want to ask you to stop being greedy and have some quality control .
Maybe amazon has gotten lazy these days seeing as they have crushed most brick and mortar stores into non existence and have no real threat .
The biggest threat to amazon and peg Perego is word of mouth and reviews.
Please please please look elsewhere for this type of ride on as amazon and peg Perego cannot promise you a functional item .....Makes me miss real stores that you can inspect it usually before buying it .
Shame on me for wasting my money with both companies .

title: My kids have spent many hours riding this tractor. ...

title: Update!Less than a month old and broken
text:
Update: we contacted customer service through the phone and they sent replacement motors for the wheels. Customer service was great and it was simple.

have had this less than a month and the right side tire motor busted somehow. My 3 year old absolutely loves this tractor and rides it daily. We bought an extra battery and fast charger so he can have more time. We're quite disappointed that it's currently out of commission due to this broken part. We've contacted customer service and are hopeful they'll remedy this. Will update once we get it all squared away.

title: Needs rubber tires

title: Great for tractor-loving kids!!
text:
My son absolutely loves his new John Deere Ground Force Tractor. He's not quite 3 yet, so it's a little big even with the seat moved as far forward as it will go. However, even when it's not moving, he loves to just sit on it and pretend. He is also pretty much obsessed with the trailer.

The only negative I have was during assembly, I had one heck of a time trying to get the pin lined up for the steering wheel. I had to take the radio off to get it on, the put the radio on after attaching the wheel. It took quite a bit of shimmying to get it to work out this way since that's not the intended assembly process, it's the only way it'd go through the pre-drilled hole.

All-in-all, a great purchase that looks like he won't grow out of for a long time.

title: Excellent!
text:
This little tractor is AMAZING! My daughter loves it. She is almost 2 and is petite, so I was worried about her not being able to reach the pedal, but she can. It has a lot of power and has traveled over our gravel drive and wet, grassy hills with no problem. It seems well built and I hope it will last many years.

When we received the tractor the radio did not work. We contacted Peg Perego and they sent us a new one right away, no questions asked. Wonderful customer service! The only problem we have now is that the lever that locks the trailer into place won't go over the ridges that keep it in place, we could shave some of the plastic off the lever, but i just wired it together with twist ties instead and it works fine. My daughter hauled 2 big, old pumpkins to the burn pile for me and the tractor never wavered, even going uphill pulling 35-40 pounds of cargo.

title: Adorable. Easy to assemble

He packs his toys in the railer, and takes off. I'm actually amazed at how well he's learned to drive it. (So good that his parents have resorted to hiding their car keys.) It's well crafted and the battery life per charge has so far been very good. Based on my experience, your little one(s) will likely love it.

title: This thing is amazing. I bought it for my 2 year old ...
text:
This thing is amazing. I bought it for my 2 year old nephew. He absolutely loves it. It goes everywhere including grass, dirt, hills, etc. Nothing stops this toy. It will pull a wagon full of rocks up a grass hill no problem. My brother in law is try to rig a snow plow for it haha.
Buy this toy and you will not be disappointed.

title: I'm sure he will love it. First Impression after assembly
text:
Christmas present for grandson. I'm sure he will love it. First Impression after assembly: Instructions are mainly pictures (no text) so you sometimes have to guess a bit. Looks great but as compared to an earlier Perego we owned for my children, which lasted thru 3 different young users, this appears to be of lesser quality. Thinner plastic and very little metal used in construction. I'm concerned that it will not hold up . Perego offers a 2 year warranty and my previous experience with them has been very good. For this price however, it should come fully assembled.
UPDATE Oct 2016 Still going strong. Grandson has played rough with it but still runs great. A few plastic parts have been knocked off but same battery still in use and now he pulls the younger granddaughter around. with him. Based on longevity experience , I'll upgrade to 5 stars

title: Solid item!
text: This is a really really good toy. It's fast, and my 6 foot, 200 pound fat self drove it around the yard to crack the kids up. It wasn't pretty, but it handled me like a champ. It doesn't take long to charge, and the charger has an indicator on it to let you know what's up with the battery. The the second gear lockout is great too, because my little one can't handle that kind of speed his older brother and fat father enjoy. I already know this thing will last for years.

title: Super fun tractor!
text: We practically have to pull our little guy off this tractor every night.  He loves that the trailer is detachable and enjoys playing with his very own working radio.  The tractor also holds a charge for much longer than I expected.  Our only complaint is the front cover is a bit flimsy - it has to be put together exactly right or it will fall off.  Still, I would recommend buying for any little tractor fans!

title: Child won’t get off of it!
text: Excellent product. Took about 1-2 hours to assemble and put stickers on. 3 year old son loves it. Can’t keep him off of it and on it daily. After about 2-3 weeks, he got bored of low speed and advanced to high speed. Best purchase ever for him!

I think you can lock it into first gear if you want it to be slower.  It has a radio which was quite a surprise to her so sometimes she gets off and dances to the music. lol  I might have to buy a 2nd one in a year or two as the younger granddaughter will need her own farm tractor.  Teaches some play work ethics as they deliver hay and rocks in the attachable cart.  This purchase was a big hit!!

text: Overall it runs great, son loves it. Tractor itself seems to be good solid quality. The one I ordered however did have several broken pieces due to poor packing and shipping. I saw other reviews with the same issue and they were sent new pieces. I did not have time to try and get new pieces from the company because Santa waited too late to build it the night before Christmas. Super glues and plastic cements will NOT glue back together any of these pieces, so we are missing one full side of the "engine" cover. Son doesn't care and it's not effected to use of the tractor and it makes it easier to charge! It's pretty quick also. Only real downfall that is that the hitch for the trailer is really flimsy so nothing more that about 5 lbs can be hauled in the trailer without it starting to severely bend and just about snap. I expect to have to throw the trailer away soon.

title: Great Toy With a Couple Mods
text:
I've had this tractor for at least a year now. My grandkids love it, but I did make some modifications to get it where I wanted it. The extras I bought were:

Battery Tender 021-0123 Battery Tender Junior 12V Battery Charger
EnerSys Genesis NP12-12T - 12 Volt/12 Amp Hour Sealed Lead Acid Battery with 0.250 Fast-on Connector
Razor Wire Harness (bought only for the connectors, you could find a cheaper setup out there)

I modified the battery cables so you can easily connect/disconnect right to the battery. This involved cutting the blue connector off of the battery top, cutting the connectors off of the wire harness, and hooking them together with electrical tape. I also got rid of the half-size battery that came with it, and modified the gas pedal. It's a mean machine now! I have never run out of a charge with the full-size batteries.

The gas pedal stopped working for me after a little use. The replacement I ordered also stopped working after short use. It has two relays (switches) built in. Both of these switches have to be pressed in order for the tractor to go. With the pedal being long and flexible plastic, the pedal starts "flexing" and both switches don't always engage. One day, my grandson was driving and it just stopped working (he was pushing hard on the pedal, too). Since the tractor was under warranty, I ordered another gas pedal. It wasn't too hard to install and I only had to pay shipping to get it (service was good). However, it didn't take long before this pedal did the same thing. There's nothing worse than your kid driving it to the park and now you can't bring it home.

So, I made a modification to the pedal. This next mod won't be recommended by Peg-Perego, but it works if yours stops working as well. I reduced the gas pedal to just one switch (don't have to engage both to run now). I haven't had an issue since bypassing one. Take off the gas pedal and you'll see three colored wires connected to it and a red jumper. Remove all of the wires, including the jumper (I threw mine away). Just lay the blue wire (thermo protector) under the pedal, you don't need it. Your two switches should be free of any wires at this point. Take the red and white wires and connect them to the two adjacent terminals on the top switch (with the most space between them, not the two terminals right next to each other). Oh yea, I removed the metal screw in the gas pedal as well. That's it, now when they press on the gas, it only takes one switch to make it go. To recap, one switch is no longer used and the other has the red/white hooked up next to each other. Just experiment a little, you’re not going to hurt anything. Check out the schematic in the front of the manual if you’re unsure. You have to complete the circuit, of course, and the blue wire is normally open to run.

I have well over $300 in this setup, but it is a pretty cool toy. If the gas pedal worked a little better, I would probably give this five stars. You have to keep the big kids off of it as they tend to get a little rough, it is just a plastic toy. I got rid of the wagon, too, you can’t back it up with it on there. They can move right along in 2nd gear, faster than you can walk. And the working radio is a neat add-on. Theisen’s sells Peg-Perego as well.

It handles well over all the uneven terrain in our cow pasture including huge chunks of grass, cow holes, ditches, etc. After tacking it out in our pasture im convinced it could handle any terrain. I love the two speeds because there are times we need our 3 year old to go slower but this thing can boogie on the fast speed!

title: Outstanding customer service, but HORRIBLE reliability and quality
text:
The tractor suddenly stopped working 4 months after purchase, with a total of 45-60 minutes runtime by our 2.5yr old daughter (who is still figuring out how to properly steer the thing without dad's help - hence the light usage). A phonecall to Peg Perego quickly put us in touch with a helpful and polite customer service rep who, after a bit of diagnostics, sent us out a replacement set of motors.

I don't yet know if this will fix the tractor, or how much longer these motors will last than the originals. Either way, I find it worrisome that such a simple product (battery, a couple of switches, and a pair of electric motors) could fail with less than an hour of usage. This was unexpected of such a highly rated product, and I hope it isn't indicative of further quality issues with Peg Perego products. Friends with similar 12v ride-ons from other manufacturers haven't reported any similar issues.

UPDATE: The replacement motors arrived but failed to fix the problem. Customer service is only open M-F until 5pm, so I will have to wait until I can call and begin the tedious diagnostic process again. What a waste of time...

UPDATE #2: After an exchange of e-mails, Peg Perego decided to send me a replacement gear shifter. It arrived in the mail today, and after swapping it into the tractor.....nothing. Still doesn't work.

I put in ANOTHER phonecall with Peg Perego, and after a bit more diagnostics, they think I have a bad battery. They tried charging nearly $15 to ship it to me, but agreed to waive it after I insisted how ridiculous it is for a battery to fail after 1.5hrs of use.

UPDATE #3: At long last, the tractor is working again. It turn out the battery was the problem along, but the new one has got my daughter back up and running.

title: He's tall for his age so it fit just fine. Assemble was pretty easy
text: Got this for a 2-yr old grandson. He's tall for his age so it fit just fine. Assemble was pretty easy. Most difficult part was aligning one of the side decals, so not much trouble to put together at all. Took me about 45 minutes. He's used it for about a month now and things look to be doing great. Battery life is better than what I expected, given some of the reviews. He drives it on grass, hottop, hills and flats with no problem. Of course, noticeably more drain when going up hills.Because he is 2, he needed some help with the concept of steering. An adult walked beside him and showed him. He had it down in a couple of weeks! Still on 1st gear/speed setting and probably won't go to #2 until next season. The only reasons for 4 instead of five stars: No rubber tracking band on back wheels like some kids trucks have; and the wagon axle only clips on and I worry that it will wear quickly. However, I shopped around before buying this and this price is great for the quality. 6 volt vehicles just can't compare and this 12 volt tractor is only a small amount more. Worth the upgrade.

title: Awesome tractor

Love that it has reverse and that you can restrict them from putting it in the faster gear. The radio is a nice touch, but if you live in a rural area you won't pick up many stations-not too big a deal for us.  So happy we got this for him!

title: This tractor is great. My son loves it and both of my ...
text:
This tractor is great. My son loves it and both of my kids ride it. The trailer is a good option but we have taken it off and left it off because it is difficult to snap on and off. I'm afraid of breaking it. Also, another reviewer said that they had a child riding in the trailer but in my experience, it's hard enough for the tractor to go with an empty trailer much less a light load. It also looks like it will snap off every time the tractor gets put in reverse. The max weight for the trailer is 22lbs. Now that the trailer is off, my son can ride much easier.
In first gear the plastic tires have awful traction. There is a lot of difficulty getting it to go up a slight incline.
Regardless of all of the above, we are very pleased with the tractor because my kids love it so much. It has already gotten a lot of use and the included battery has yet to run out during use (we charge it per manual instructions). No extra battery necessary.

title: Great purchase
text: My 3 year old grandson loves it! It is pretty sturdy and well made with the exception of the hood part which comes on and off to charge the battery. The designer who thought it would be a good idea to screw the hood into some small box attached to the tractor wasn’t thinking clearly. The screws just go directing into holes and plastic. Nothing locking them into place. Pretty stupid I think and adds to the flimsiness of the hood part. That said, I’m not at all handy and while I put this together with the help of my daughter, it took probably an hour or more where somebody who knows what they’re doing could put it together in a fraction of the time. They could also fix the stupid hood part. Other than that it’s very cute and definitely worth it for the price.

title: Hours of fun, kids love it!
text: This tractor and trailer is awesome. We just gave this to our 4 y/o son for his birthday. The top speed is plenty fast and he loves to drive around the yard and collect sticks and debri in the trailer. The battery seems to last for a good 30-40 min when he is driving it continuously around the yard. There is a spot for a second battery if you wanted, but it only comes with one. The only different thing is the reverse function. You actually have to hold the shifter in the reverse position while you step on the pedal to reverse. The other electric vehicles our kids have owned the shifter just clicks in to reverse same as the forward speeds. Not a big deal but it may take your toddler a few tries to figure it out. Lastly, very easy to assemble as compared to others.

title: Good traction
text: My 2 1/2 year old son loves his tractor. It’s nice that we can adjust the speed so that it goes slow enough that we can walk beside him while he gets used to driving it. It has pretty good traction too. It goes through thick grass & on our gravel driveway. We only have to give him a little push up the hill on our gravel driveway. I would definitely recommend this for a 2 to 4 year old.

title: For what we spent I believe the radio should be in a better working order
text: My son loves his tractor!! We still have it in low gear but it doesn't have any problems accelerating with him on it at all. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is bc of the radio... I'll actually be calling the company for a replacement bc it's fairly disappointing. All it does is scan and then the station fades out as soon as he moves again. For what we spent I believe the radio should be in a better working order. My only other complaint is about the pull cart, as soon as the tractor is in reverse the cart reacts like a normal trailer would when it's attached to a vehicle. Well naturally my toddler Jack knifes it every time... So needless to say the cart has collected dust for the last few days.

title: Awesome looking tractor!
text: We recently purchased this for my nephew for Christmas, and it was not easy to put together. We ran into several issues including the steering wheel, trailer pin, hood harness, and missing a couple stickers. Once we got past all of that it was pretty straightforward and has more power than expected. I am giving this 4 stars instead of 2 or 3, because when i contacted Amazon to see about getting a partial refund for the items mentioned above, they ended up refunding the entire purchase even when i was outside of the return/refund policy. They also did not make us send it back. They made it right, which is was all i really wanted.

title: Don’t buy-

title: Needs a power switch, and radio is a joke!
text:
My 3yo son absolutely loves this tractor, and rides it almost every day - he takes it all over our lawn, through the woods and up and down our driveway. It is fantastic, however, I think there is one important safety feature that is missing - this vehicle has no power switch at all. Once the battery is plugged in, the vehicle is always on.

Because of this, both my son and my daughter have almost been injured when they go to climb on the tractor and inadvertently step on the accelerator, and the tractor takes off. You can almost fake a power off if you move the gear shift in-between gears, but it is too easy to slip back into gear, and the same danger exists.

We have had to sometimes unplug the battery just so my daughter can crawl on the tractor without it taking off on her.

Also, the radio is ridiculous - every time you turn it on, it goes back to the 87 frequency, and you have to manually scan up to get to where you want to be. After less that 2 months, the radio no longer functions, and we haven't been able to find the directions to replace the battery.

Battery life is good, utility is good, just a couple of extremely frustrating and possibly dangerous flaws that could be easily remedied.

title: A Masters In Engineering Would Help
text:
My husband and I are not dumb. We've both earned masters degrees in our respective field though not unfortunately in engineering. It took us both working diligently many nights after work to put this thing together. I had to call the company for assistance. The woman on the phone was most lovely and apologetic and said that I might want to use an ice pick. I didn't think adding an ice pick to an already tense situation between my husband and I trying hard to put the tractor together was going to help and might really really hurt one of us, you know what I mean?
42 sets of instructions and 17 decals applied (including a booklet and two other separate sheets of instructions), we put the tractor together! It's beautiful and we are so so excited to give it to our granddaughter for Christmas. Thank God we didn't wait and let her open the box on Christmas morning. Don't wait!!!!!

title: So disappointed to be so disappointed ☹️
text: So very disappointed. This is not our first battery operated ride so I have some 12 volt Power Wheels to compare it to as well as 6 volt vechiles. I am so disappointed to have to write a bad review for this b/c I was so excited that this John Deere tractor was exactly what my son wanted and it was made in USA (2 star rating),and didn't mind paying the extra to get it, BUT I just don't want others who have kiddos fascinated with John Deere tractors to waste their money. Keep researching and hopefully there is another one out there. This is all the down sides I have found so far. The plastic used to make this is extremely flimsy not like the dune racers that we have two of. I don't expect it to last long before cracking and breaking. The exhaust pipe will not stay on and the trailer bed/railings are constantly popping off. The pedal to make it go is in the exact spot where you have to put your foot in order to get on it to ride so it is automatic that the pedal will be pressed and tractor will take off before child is properly seated. The battery life is pitiful compared to our power wheels batteries. It takes 8 hours to charge and then lasts for 1 hour at most. If it is used for less time than that and then left until next day, battery is dead. It horrible, terrible, the absolute worst I have dealt with and with the frequency of having to charge battery it is the poorest design to assess it. You must remove 2 screws and a large plastic piece that holds battery in place then once battery is charged replace it, the large plastic piece which has to be positioned just so over battery and both sides of fenders, then replace both screws. This is an endless process that is much more simplified in all the other models we have had. Like I said, so disappointed to be so badly disappointed in this. I wanted to love it, but it's just not happening. And last but not least, the directions to put together are horrible, luckily I have experience putting together at least 5 other battery powered vehicles so I had experience to rely on.

title: Horrible battery life .

title: Pretty nice little tractor
text: This is a nice little tractor.  With two speeds and reverse, it made for a nice birthday gift for my three year old grandson.  However, I don't think he's quite ready for the higher speed gear as it goes pretty fast, but fortunately, the lockout mechanism effectively keeps him from shifting into that gear when it is engaged.  The battery life is surprisingly good, even with two motors.  It can climb small hills and navigates around our yard handily.  I was surprised how much he liked the little radio that is included.  I think he feels cool tuning into a station and turning it up while cruising around.  Anyway, pretty pleased with this one - it's pretty close to five stars, but it takes a lot for me to click that last star....LOL.

title: Love this product!
text: We bought this tractor/trailer for our 3 year old son and he loves it!  He is very much into tractors and trailers and it is the perfect thing for him.  It has 2 gears plus reverse.  The second gear is pretty speedy, which is great for our son because he can keep up with his 6 year old brother when he is on his motorized Jeep. Our 6 year old also fits on it and enjoys driving it. This tractor does great on the grass...my son drives all over our yard and our neighbor's and speeds right along.  It definitely takes some time to assemble the tractor, but the directions are pretty easy to follow.  Your tractor lover will love this toy!

text: My son loves the tractor and trailer. The only problem is the front grill will not stay in the hood. It came pe-installed and no matter how many times we put it back in it falls out again. We are thinking about glueing it in place for good. Also you have to unscrew the battery and take it out every time you charge unless you have an outlet outside or in an garage, which we don't.

title: Absolutely Perfect!!!
text: Santa brought this to my 2.5 year old son and we could not be happier!! He's 37lbs, and although the pieces may seem thin, we have not had ANY trouble out of any of them breaking or bending when he climbs on them. He loves to ride this thing around the yard, hitting the tree roots and making him bounce and giggle. The reverse function is a little tricky because they have to continuously press the gear shift up while you're backing up, but he got the hang of it fairly quickly. I honestly have no complaints about this tractor! The battery lasts a good while, it slows down if my 8 year old niece gets on it, but it still rides as expected. My son has no need to ride this toy all day, so we just charge it every night after he finishes riding it and it is good to go the next morning! I would definitely recommend this product to anyone!!

title: One of the Better Purchases for My Son
text:
My son is 3 and just can't get enough of this tractor. He pasticularly loves riding it nearby while I cut the grass with our ride on mower. He pretends to be "helping" daddy and it seems to make him very happy. He also "helps" me transport firewood from our bard to our home. In fact, he can't seem to stop helping daddy in one way or another with this little tractor. It has been worth every penny unlike other toys we have purchased. Battery life seems to run about an hour before my son needs to "gas up" and daddy carries it to the garage to plug it in. If my son stays on the paved area of the driveway he seems to get about 1 1/2 hours of ride time. Riding on the grass uses the battery much more quickly. Watching our German Shepherd follow along as my son drives around a pasture adjacent to our house is just priceless for memories. It is too cute.

The only downside I would warn people about is the tires. They are wearing down noticeably after only 3 months of use. I don't think they will hold up very long and am going to have to figure out some way to rig up some rubber or maybe canvas to the wheels to prevent them from wearing down to the point where they are no longer usable. When my son hits the "gas" on the paved area the wheels spin for a moment causing more wear though. Tire issues are to be determined for me, but anybody considering a purchase should at least be aware so you can make your own decision. As for me, I am considering purchasing another immediately for my newborn to use when he gets older. I'll find a way to keep the tractor running as long as it brings my boy smiles.

title: Great Product For The Price! My Son Loved It.
text:
The pros of this product include the fact that its wonderful for a 3-7 yr old and seems (so far) to be built well. It looks just like the big boy tractors and instantly recognizable.

The con is that the assembly directions are HORRIBLE. Yes, I've assembled many pieces of Ikea Furniture (so familiar with putting together something like this), but these directions are very hard to understand. There are no details on what specific parts go where, yes there are small black and white pictures, but woefully inadequate when trying to figure out which one of 5 different type of screws to use. I figured it out, but took probably an hour longer than it should have because of unclear instructions.

Overall product seems to be good, will report back after a couple months of use.

title: Amazing little ride on toy with a defective battery
text: My son loves this new tractor ride on toy. Everything is obviously made put of plastic but seems sturdy enough and it wasnt hard to put together, probably takes about 45 mins all together. I love the 2nd speed option to go faster specially for a 3-4 year old, there is no remote control so I dont dont why the page mentions that (unless mine is missing one). Either way I wouldnt need it. The only thing I am currently posted and concerned about is the battery life. The first time after charging it, they battery later way lo get than any other ride on toy my son ever had and that got him super excited,. Unfortunately after the second charge the battery only gave us 1/2 the riding time and I am hoping that I miscalculated the time, i am charging it a 3rd time and will time it compared to the second, hoping this battery didnt come out defective. Also, I noticed their batteries come with a special enclosure and charging connector so you cant just go out and buy an ordinary chaper battery at your local auto or battery store and to me that's all great since it makes the toy a lot more original, however I would expect a lot more able better for such product. Will update review after the next couple of chargers. Overall my son is having a blast with this new tow (other than the battery not holding up charge evenly) .

title: Peg Pérego disappointed.. And does NO RETURNS, so beware.
text: Liked that this was easy to assemble but perhaps the simplicity is what made it poor quality. Our 3 year old used on flat concrete and semi flat dirt and as you can see in our pictures, the plastic  shows signs of stress on tires' front suspension, 3 days in. Back tires already show wear as well, Pictures taken 8/28/20 and usage began 8/15/20. Considering the usage has been light (daily for about an hour or less in the evenings,) the quality does not reflect cost. Peg Pérego left us disappointed to say the least, and we will never buy this manufacturer's products again.

title: Tractor was not wired correctly so it wouldn’t run!!
text: My son got the. Tractor all put together and got the battery charged and the tractor wouldn’t work.  He had to practically take the whole tractor apart to find the problem.  The power wire to the accelerator pedal module was not connected  properly!  The red wire was never even seated into the wire harness! And therefore the tractor would not go. He rewired it correctly and then the tractor worked.  Just a total screw up at the factory!  Also the trailer pin will not work and it won’t stay on. It looks like it was just not formed correctly and so the trailer just bounced off.  We had to find a bolt and washer and nut to replace the defective plastic pin.  My granddaughter  loves it now that it’s running. BUT we are certainly not happy with the quality of this tractor. And at $279 it isn’t cheap!  I certainly think Peg Pergo or Amazon owe us some money back!!!  I might just return this one before something else happens!

title: Best gift ever!
text: We got this for our son's 3rd birthday and it has been the best purchase! He loves it! Built really tough which is good because our child is extremely rough and tough. He rides it daily and the battery stays charged a really long time. He has run it into trees, the fence etc. and nothin slows this Deere down! I have even rode it around the yard and it holds me lol! So much fun!!!

title: Five Stars
text: great product!

title: Grandson loves this thing
text: Great toy

title: Great little tractor!!
text: We are so happy with this little tractor!!  This is a very well made tractor and is very easy for our 3 yr old grandson to operate.  The instructions were very easy to follow to put it together.  So glad we bought this!

title: It's ok
text: I feel for the parent that doesn't have much experience with putting these kinds of toys together. The directions are horrible, and the manufacturing of the parts makes that even worse. Parts do not line up properly, I had to shave the bottom of the steering wheel collar just to get it to line up with the steering shaft. Other parts snap in place and feel cheap. But, the battery lasts a long time, and the kids love it! Pretty quick in second gear. All in all, if you can get past the fact that's it's made poorly (most likely in China) then it's not too bad of a deal. Wish I would have got the model with a remote as well...

title: No regrets!
text: Excellent product.  Easy assembly.  High quality at a great price.  Lightning fast delivery!  Just buy it already!

title: Awesome Product
text: I bought this for my 4 year old son and he absolutely loves it! Battery life is great too!

title: Great for my 2 kids
text: Great for my 2 kids.  They love it!  Be careful with back, it comes off very easily and my sons have fallen out when trying to climb in it.

title: He loves it
text: Great product

title: Quit pulling after 1/2 day.
text: Received this April 15th.  He would not ride it because it was a little quick & jerky accelerating.  Sat in garage, then this week he wanted to ride it.  Got it out, he rode around the yard that morning but by afternoon it quit working.  Thought needed charge, charged it, still will not pull itself.

title: Son loves it!
text: My son loves his tractor. It went to together pretty quick and easy.  It is a bit smaller than I thought it would be, but still big enough for my son (2), my six year old even hops on it no problem.  The front piece, where the lights are, comes off easily.  Love that you can lock the speed control. All in all a great toy.

title: Five Stars
text: works great

title: The tires are great on it and they really dig in and allow ...
text: Going on 6 months with this tractor and he still loves it.  Grandson was 28 months old when he first started riding it, big for his age though.  He could not put it in reverse but now at almost 3 yrs he can!  The tires are great on it and they really dig in and allow him to go all over the yard.  The wagon has hauled dirt, his little sister and the dog! Great buy!

title: Four Stars
text: My grandson loved it

title: LOVE! My toddler loves this toy. He ask to ride every day!
text: My toddler loves his very own tractor.  Wish we had bought  a second battery so one could charge while using the other.

title: Five Stars
text: My kids love this toy!

title: Just like Daddy
text: I have a JD lawn tractor and my son wanted one too. Saw this and knew he had to have it. He now follows me around while I do yard work, load up the detachable trailer and takes yard scarps for me. Heck of a way to get kids to help with yard work.

title: John deer tractor and trailer
text: Very easy to assemble and is a quality product.

title: Amazing Buy!!!
text: My 3 year son loves it!  We had a Power Wheels car that broke and we replaced it with this.  I can't say enough good things about this!  It's super fast and it goes anywhere.  We live in the desert and the power wheels car wouldn't go up our hill due to the sand.  Due to my son sitting over the wheels this tractor goes right up the hill with speed and can go anywhere in our yard!  The radio is loud and sounds great!  This is a must buy!!!

title: Great battery and good in grass
text: This tractor is amazing. We got it for our 2 1/2yo son and he loves it!! You can lock in a lower speed which is nice. The battery is the best I’ve seen for a toddler riding toy as it goes forever and we don’t even have to plug it in after each use. It also works well on grass as well as pavement. The trailer can be attached or detached and our son loves putting stuff in the back and hauling it around the yard or out to the trash. Highly recommend this tractor!

title: Five Stars
text: awesome

title: Nice little tractor
text: Tractor has been great so far.  Trailer is little bit flimsy and doesn't back up well attached for a child.  However, everything works ...looks nice and grandson loves it.

title: Love it - Lots of fun - A little cheaply made though
text: My 2 yr old LOVES this toy!!!!  He pitches a fit when we have to come in from riding the toy!  I will say, there have been pieces that have fallen off and they were not made to be very durable for an outside toy.  The pieces should be a little more duurable for an outside toy especially for a young child.  I'm just not sure it's worth nearly $300.00 if it's going to fall apart.

title: Great toy
text: Perfect, I am, sure the grandson will love it

title: Nice toy
text: Came with some broken pieces that I glued back together but in all a nice toy.

title: Well built
text: Lives up to hype. Really nice machine.

title: Highly recommend
text: We bought this for my 2 year old on his birthday, 6 months ago. He LOVES it! Best money ever spent. He will be able to use it for a few years so that’s a huge plus. He also loves the little radio on it.

title: Nice and well priced kids car, horrible instructions
text: The toy itself is great, and it is extremely easy to put together…. After you decipher the instructions.  It comes about 70% complete and all of the assembly is mostly cosmetic pieces.  That being said it still took me 2 hours and the help of a YouTube video to make sure I was doing everything properly.  Instructions are vague, miss/omit steps and sometimes mention parts that are already pre assembled.  There is zero guidance as to which screws are used for install and you are left with scrutinizing each on to figure out if it’s the right one.  If it weren’t for the horrible instructions it could have easily been done in one hour.  That all being said it’s a great little electric car and I’m happy I bought it.

title: Cute and fun!
text:
My husband and I bought this for our granddaughter and we couldn't be more pleased. She loves being outdoors and riding on her own tractor. It is sturdy, looks cute and comes with the little trailer.

The speed is controllable with a small attachment that fits on the throttle, so we can keep it at a slower pace until she is older and has more practice. I would not be comfortable letting her use it without adult supervision as it is motorized, but with adults watching it is a safe and fun toy.

I does require some assembly and the stickers that decorate it need to be put on, but it is not difficult to put together. If you plan to give it as a gift, charge the battery beforehand so your little one will be able to get on it and GO!

title: Kids love
text: Hard assembly

title: Radio doesn’t work, even with a replacement.
text: My son loves this tractor. Works great only problem is the radio is JUNK!!! We bought this tractor because we thought the radio would be a fun feature. When we received the package the first radio wouldn’t work at all. We contacted the company and they sent us a replacement which was great. The radio spontaneously skips around and plays more static than actual music. There’s no way to set a station. Could’ve been a 5 Star toy.

title: It has a second gear which makes it a lot faster
text: Great value for the money

title: Poor planning good outcome
text: the Radio came broke. The instructions are bare minimum that you need to watch YouTube videos to assemble. Other than that it is a nice toy for the kids.

title: This tractor is awesome!!!!!
text: This is so awesome. The trailer is great but hard to get off and on. Assembly took a little bit. In the end so worth the time to put it together. The tractor is fast and stearing is easy. I do wish you could just put the geer control in reverse and it stay, instead you have to hold it.

title: Fun, fun, fun
text: My little boy got this about a year and a half ago and he still loves it.  It has provided hours and hours of entertainment.  It works well on grass or gravel and the battery goes a long time between charges.  The front grill falls off every once in a while but I think that's because he hit a tree once and loosened it somehow.  Overall, it's held up despite being used by a rowdy little boy.  Well worth the money.

title: Great!
text: Great battery time and our 2 yr old loves it!

text: I bought this for my grandson, although he is a little small for it, we love it. I like that it has reverse and a working radio is awesome.. The only complaint is the tires but they're all made that way. Overall  I am very pleased with it. Love it, its like his papa's

title: The best present ever!
text:
We bought this for our grandson's second birthday. It is the out of this world. He loves it. We cannot find anything wrong with it. It was definitely worth every penny. He will be talking about his tractor years down the road and it being his best birthday present ever.
I wish I could send a picture of him on it.

title: My son loves this! He's always asking me if ...
text: My son loves this!  He's always asking me if he can go outside and cut grass.  He's 3 and will probably have it for years to come.  Battery lasts long.

title: Cool tractor for grandkids!
text: This item arrived on the day expected. The box looked okay but the front plastic sides were broken. One side was glue able but the other side was missing the piece. Hopefully these parts don't affect the durability of the battery cover. Otherwise it was relatively easy to assemble.

title: and he loved that he had a tractor like his papa
text: We bought this for my grandson's second birthday, and he loved that he had a tractor like his papa. He was a bit to young to understand how to steer it, but now six months later he rides all around on it.

title: Hours of fun
text: Got this for my grandson.  He loves it.  It was easy to assembly.  Was surprised how fast it really goes in 2nd gear.  He loves driving it all over.

title: Not worth the money!
text: Haven't even had it for 2 months and already the battery will not hold  a charge.  Received and "radio" didn't work, called for replacement was told no.

title: Bought for my two going on twenty great grand son
text: Bought for my two going on twenty great grand son. He rides it every day and went very quickly from slow to fast speed setting. A little difficult to assemble, but well worth the extra effort to see the joy on his face. It is well constructed, and is holding up nicely under the conditions that our little expert puts it through! We did put the trailer up until he can understand how to back up with it attached. The wheel assembly for the trailer seems to be lacking in the way it is attached to the frame. Though it was bought used, you could never tell it. Great buy!

title: ITS AWESOME

title: Grandson loved it. Assembly was not an easy thing but ...
text: Grandson loved it . Assembly was not an easy thing but do able . It would have been even better if the lights worked

title: She loves it!!
text: I bought this for my 4 year old granddaughter's birthday. When I pull my John Deere out to mow she always wants to ride Nana's, so when I finish mowing I take her all over the place on it, she loves the ride. Now when I pull mine out she gets her John Deere and "mows" the other side of the yard. It's just a wonderful little tractor and she loves her "Deere", the radio is just the best, she now tells me her tractor is better than mine because it has a radio!!

title: Great toy
text: We bought this for our son and it was a great gift. He loves it. It was made very well. I was expecting a cheaply made, plastic toy and this IS plastic but made very well. The battery life is awesome.

title: Our just turned 3 grandson LOVES his "John Deere Tractor" ...
text: Our just turned 3 grandson LOVES his "John Deere Tractor".  Assembly does take some patience as it is all pictures and no written instructions.  The only problem we have is hooking the trailer to the hitch - you do have to be forceful to get it on.

title: Five Stars
text: This is a great tractor. Our 2 year old son absolutely loves it.

title: Little Tank
text:
Got this tractor for our two kids a couple of years ago for Christmas. We have some land and a pasture behind the house that they love to drive through with fairly dense grass and some mud holes. This poor tractor has been loved hard and abused and it just keeps on rolling. Some parts are attached a bit flimsy, but functionally it handles a lot. If you can get it on sale it's definitely worth it. Two driven wheel with decent traction for hard plastic means the kids have more options than being relegated to sidewalks (nonexistent in our neighborhood) or driveways.

A higher ampacity battery and faster charger would be wise additions, and I'm glad the radio batteries are short-lived due to my daughter's inexplicable penchant for blasting talk-radio. Max volume on the radio is surprisingly loud, however.

title: Kids love it, there's really no point installing the exhaust ...
text: Kids love it, there's really no point installing the exhaust stack on the side.  It was ripped off in no time.

title: Five Stars
text: Great for the little boy I purchased for

title: Great little tractor
text:
My 5 year old son flipped when he saw this waiting for him on Christmas morning, he was so excited!! It’s a great ride on toy, very realistic and it even has a real working radio! He has only got to ride on it a couple times since it’s been so cold and snowy but he is so in love with his little tractor!!
Assembly was a little tedious and a couple plastic panels didn’t want to line up correctly, it took some patience but eventually it all came together!

title: Kids love it
text: Took longer to put together than expected and construction not as smooth as you might expect for the price. However, it runs great , manages our hills just fine and both my 5 and 2 year old love it.

title: Not any better than Chinese knockoffs and it has less features and costs a lot more
text: I wonder if the branding of John Deere raised the cost of this tractor about $100? It offers less features than comparative ride-on vehicles (no Bluetooth/USB or lights).

title: Great tractor, huge hit with kids!
text: Nice product, my 4 year old lives it! It was fairly easy to put together, my only complaint is that the front panel where the headlights are keeps popping off. Otherwise, we love it!

title: HUGE revealing picture
text:
FYI-there is an enormous photo of the tractor with a child riding on it on the front of the enormous box. I specifically called to ensure the packaging was discreet. Several times, I was assured the gift would be a "Santa surprise". I think one of my kids saw it already!! Be forewarned- if this is a gift, it will not be a surprise!
(I have not opened the box, I won't reduce the product rating due to the packaging. )

title: Grandson LOVES it!!!!
text:
We had Amazon put it together for us. He did it in 45 min. My 3yr old grandson got it for Christmas so he has not used it many times. But, he LOVES it. He drove it out of the garage at Christmas. He stopped right away and loaded up a couple rocks. He never stopped smiling. He ran over and gave me a big hug. He had a great time driving all over the yard and picked up leaves. The trailer was a big hit. Glad we got this one with the trailer.
Can’t really comment about battery life, just been too cold to ride for long periods.

title: Four Stars
text: My grandson loves it but we still can't get the front paet on right.

title: Little guy loves it and after one year of heavy use it’s holding up
text: My son adores this gift, currently it’s winter and he can’t wait to get back on his John Deere tractor and drive! He was two when he first received the gift and drove it fairly well but we restricted his speed to one until he got the hang of things. Speed two is pretty fast but he handles the turns well. The little tailgate sold it for him! It does come off with a fairly good bump but my son is riding this tractor all around the yard up and down hill. The battery lasts awhile especially since my son only drives on the lawn which is indicated as a shorter battery life than driving on a sidewalk or driveway.

title: Grandson Loves it
text: Christmas gift for our grandson he loves it! Very fast, stays charged easy to assemble

title: Wonderful riding toy
text: I purchased this toy for my 3 year old grandson. He is so enjoying this tractor. We were so surprized it has a working radio. I had no idea until my son had put it together. My grandson loves the trailer,(he calls his wagon.) Even though it can be easily removed, he loves to gather up things and drive them around. At 3, he is able to drive with no issue. (Backing up, a little more difficult.) I was very impressed with the quality. I plan on purchasing another one for my other grandson. I would not hesitate to recommed this product.

title: I had to buy my grandson his own John Deere to be able to use my own.
text:
I now have a little helper to drive around my lawn picking up leaves and sticks. He loves his John Deere and I had to install a cup holder so he could carry his cup like Pappy did on his tractor.
Good quality and well worth the money to hear him driving around singing with his FM radio on.

title: Peg Perego John Deere Ground Force Tractor with Trailer
text: My grandson really enjoys his tractor. Couldn't have imagined the hours of enjoyment he gets and how we love seeing him have so much fun. This is truly a "Home Run!"

title: It gets better traction than any other battery operated ride on I've purchased
text: My 2 year old grandson will not get off this.  It gets better traction than any other battery operated ride on I've purchased for my six children.

title: Great product
text:
Great.
My son play everyday.

title: Five Stars
text: Very big hit 👍🏼 My grandson loves it and rides it every day

title: Easy to operate for 3 year old but is good for older !
text: My 3 year old grandson had an easy time operating this tractor. It also has a lock for 2nd gear so you can control the speed when they are younger, this is a nice feature!

title: Cheaply made --
text: Think twice before ordering this from Amazon, pd 241. and now 219. no price adjustment.  On anything you buy from Amazon now, they do not do price adjustments so you have to return the item and go where the better deal is.  Will think twice before ordering from Amazon in the future.  This product not that easy to put together, got it for our grandson for Christmas, the batteries for the radio are behind the steering wheel - so every time you have to replace the 2AA batteries for the radio, you have to take the top off in 2 places  and is not that easy to do.  All plastic and for the price not worth it.  It is together now-so cannot return it.

title: Assembly and Trouble Shooting Instructions Are Very Bad
text: I purchased it for a 3-1/2 old.  He has no problem driving and controlling it.  It has two strong electric motors on the back wheels.  It can easily traverse grass and uneven ground and will go up minor slopes without any problem.  I would certainly recommend the product with the caveat that it's not all that easy to put together.  The instructions that come with it are extremely poorly written and poorly illustrated.  If you're not mechanically inclined or know someone who is, don't buy it.  Another short coming is the battery takes 18 hours to charge with the charger that comes with it.  However the company also sells a fast charger that only takes around 2 hours to fully charge the battery.  This is the charger that should have come with the product.

title: Pretty strong too
text: My kid loves this.  Will ride in circles all day long ha ha.  Loves the radio.  Loves to put items in the back and driven them around the yard.  Pretty strong too.  I even got on it, weighing 175 and it was strong enough to ride me around ha ha

title: Fun
text: Christmas gift for our 4 yr old Granddaughter and she loves it.  Only down side is the radio doesnt work.

title: great
text: great product easy to put together

title: Just OK
text: I shopped around and got it for just over $200, and frankly it isn't worth much more.  As other reviewers have pointed out, it is really cheaply made, the plastic on the hood is flimsy.  The wheels have terrible traction on hard surfaces, not surprising given you have hard plastic spinning against concrete/pavement.  It works a bit better on grass.  The radio is a bit of a waste, at least for my son, not sure how many 3 year olds need to listen to FM radio while playing in the yard.  Not to mention the radio doesn't remember what station is was on once it is turned off.  They should have put the money into a thicker plastic.  The plastic is so thin it is very difficult to put the hood back in place after recharging the battery (which is recommended after every use).  All that being said, my son enjoys riding it, it is pretty easy to use, etc.  I just don't think it is going to last long.

title: High Quality and Lots of Fun!!!
text:
My son loves this tractor! We have had it over a month now and he still rides it every day, which is saying something! He usually bores and tires of toys easily.

My son is 3. We unlocked the fast gear for him on the first day. If your child does not have any experience driving these types of vehicles, I would leave the fast gear locked until he/she is used to it. My son had a truck prior to this so he was already experienced. The fast gear does go surprisingly fast, though.

The radio works great. Remember it is made of plastic though. It has had some minor things come apart, but that is totally to be expected when your child is tough on it.

For hours of farming fun, I would definitely recommend this tractor!

title: Great quality
text: This thing hauls! I can’t believe how much power is in a battery-operated toy! My son loves it! We recently let him put it in 2nd gear (there is a stopper you can screw in to prevent it from going into second gear) and he drives it around for hours until the battery dies.

title: No complaints
text: So far so good

title: Can't Wait for my Son to see this!
text:
[[VIDEOID:89583f1e105e860faaa826d4eb21783d]] Just got it put together. Everything seems solid. The fenders on the front are held on by a larger screw and even though they seem a tad flimsy, They are very flexible. If you can look at pictures and follow 2 pieces of paper you'll be able to put this together. Took about 2 hours just casually building it. The radio reception came in fine and that sucker is pretty loud for the little speaker. In The video it barely turned up. Can't wait for my kiddo to get to using it.

I'm going to take the advice of previous reviewer(s) and find some bike tires and zip them onto the tires to save the plastic. Also the rear "flashers" and "headlights" have a little hole behind the plastic piece you place in so I'd love to try to rig up a toggle switch and find some small LEDs to put in those holes. I'll review further down the line on usage and battery life but this thing is solid so far as I can tell.

title: stickers first, trailer stoppers go inside of the wheels after Metal clip outside, Headlight tricky.
text:
Came yesterday July 1st, few days early (live 1 state away from indiana), had it together in a little over an hour. Came with battery and charger just like it says I'm the description. Battery was almost full by the time I had assembled the rest it was fully charged. My son absolutely loves it and worth every penny just for that. FR fender was a bit deformed but I'm sure it can be adjusted no big deal. Biggest thing I wish I had put the stickers on first. Much harder once assembled.

Will update asap

title: Fantastic
text: This is excellent quality and the battery life is surprisingly good. My son LOVES all things tractors and this takes the cake. We have had it for over a year now and the battery life is just as good as when we first got it. I only have two minor complaints. One is how easily the smokestack breaks off… with a few extra screws it is as good as new though so it isn’t a big deal at all. The second is that the radio does not work. The plus side is that it never worked from the start so my son doesn’t realize there’s anything wrong with it. Overall, this is a great vehicle and I would 100% recommend it!

title: Wouldn't buy again...
text: We have owned the tractor for a little over 6mo and the battery appears to have already died (still trying different troubleshooting). We got it for my son during the winter, so he didn't ride it until spring. It probably only has 6 full charges. For paying $250, I expected much longer life. Based on my experience, I would take my chances on a cheaper knock off version for half the price rather than paying more for a name brand.

title: It still works great. The seat did come off but just needed ...
text: This tractor has been with us for two years now. It still works great. The seat did come off but just needed to be screwed back on. This tractor has played hard and has been my son's best friend for two long summers. He follows his Daddy while he is mowing the lawn, picks up sticks to put in his trailer and leaves.

title: Just possibly the best gift ever for our grandson
text: Just possibly the best gift ever for our grandson.  He got it on his 3rd birthday as a gift from us and his parents.  He plays with it constantly.  As with any moving toy you have to see that the child doesn't go down too steep a hill, but common sense says you will be careful to help your child learn how to be careful with it.

title: Pretty good
text: Kids love it. Exhaust stack, bad design, kids pulled it off pretty quick. Trailer hitch and hood hitch are a pain. Trailer broke due to heavy kid getting in it. I would remove trailer except for photo op with little sister in it. Runs strong and is fast if #2. Grandsons reaction when he first saw it was priceless.

title: Well worth the money
text: This is worth every penny.  It has low and high speeds and reverse.  Great value

title: JD MININTRAXTOR
text: Great tractor way outlasted my expectations

title: John Deere Tractor 12v kids
text: Very happy with the product.  Two hours for assembly but worth it.

title: My son is in love with this! Are few downsides but still an amazing toy your child will love!
text: Let me just start off by saying my son is in love with this tractor. I got this for my 3 year old sons birthday this year and he does so well with it. I think he would have done well with it even on his second birthday. It has a lock to where I could prohibit him from going into the second gear which is the fastest. It has 2 gears. Level 1 and level 2. It also has reverse which he does well with also. Let me tell you Level 2 is fast! I'm talking I don't know if I've ever seen a kids toy go that fast before. But It is perfect for my 3 year old because he loves fast and yet it seems very safe for him to do. Also the steering is great. Also the battery power is amazing for a kids toy! About an hour and a half on the fastest level. He is rarely on level 1 but I'm sure it would last for hours. Now there are a few down sides. It can be difficult to open the hood to charge. But it will open if you know what your doing. It also does not take too long to charge in my opinion. Another downside though is that it is made of mostly plastic. Even the wheels are made of plastic. I could imagine it would be hard to get around in tall grass. We keep ours fairly kept though so we never have a problem with that. Even though it is made of plastic I think It is still a nice buy and seeing how much my son loves it is priceless to me. I really suggest this product if your are looking at different ride along toys. Because this one is a great one!

title: Good product. Needs a bigger battery
text: My son loves this thing. He is 2 and drives it every day. Good product. Needs a bigger battery.

title: Best toy ever!
text: I bought this for my 4 year old at Christmas.  I had heard from a friend that the assembly process could be lengthy, so we allotted a few hours to put the beast of a toy together.  Thankfully, it didn't take that long and after a full charge, it was ready and waiting.  Since Christmas morning, my son has been on this tractor every day.  The trailer usually gets left behind, because he wants to go faster.  He is large for his age (wears size 5-6) and it looks as if the toy was made for him.  A word of warning, though, because he likes to shift from reverse to second gear fast, which will pop the front tires off the ground briefly.  It only surprised him the first time, since then he enjoys showing off.  The only drawback I have noticed is that the battery seems to be discharging faster now, with a recharge needed around naptime in addition to the nightly charge.  He does use it a lot though!

title: Tractor was a hit.
text: This tractor comes a lot more assembled than I thought it would.  How they fit all of that into that size box that it came in, is beyond me.  The only downside to all of this was having to put all those decals on myself.  I thought that would be something that could be done in the manufacturing process or by the packers before shipping.

title: Fun ride
text: So much fun! The radio is a nice touch and the speed lock is great for my 3yo. It is a pain to put together though.

title: 2017 and it is still his favorite toy. It's now a year old and has ...
text: We bought this for our son's third birthday in May, 2017 and it is still his favorite toy.  It's now a year old and has held up incredibly well to lots of rough and tumble play.  We get a kick out of how fast this thing goes for a kids toy, and it takes almost no time for them to get the hang of it.  Our son will be four at the end of this month and has graduated to doing donuts in our driveway.  If you have a little one who's at all interested in lawnmowers or tractors, this one is well worth the money.

title: Great toy
text: Best toy we purchased for our grandson.  After 3 years, still running great and he drives it almost every day.  Couldn’t be happier about the purchase.

title: Definitely recommend! It’s big and fast! Super fast!
text: I love how big and fast it runs! My 2.5 year old loves it. And the trailer that comes with it so easy to put together. Now the directions were all pictures and no words so that was confusing but it’s worth it!

title: Indestructible
text: We have left these things out in every snow storm. They still work. We left them out in ever rain storm. They still work. Did all the parts stay attached? No. But they still work. My kids use these for bumper cars. They still work. No rust no issue no slowness I swear if my kids can’t destroy these things no one can.

title: We LOVE it and are so happy with our purchase
text: We bought this tractor for our son's 2nd birthday a year ago. We LOVE it and are so happy with our purchase. This picture is from today, at 3yo. When he first got it he couldn't steer well, but got the hang of it fairly quickly and now zooms around the yard with ease. We unfortunately currently live in an HOA neighborhood so our grass is poisoned perfect and always long and slick without a single weed so I believe that's the cause behind him occasionally getting stuck coming up the fairly steep hill. There is definitely enough power though and the battery lasts forever! We have not yet removed the lock on the second "gear" speed. He loves it and we can't wait to move somewhere with a bigger/better yard to enjoy it even more!

title: Tractors are still going strong after 3 years.
text: We bought two of these, one for each grandson.  They are great!  After 3 years, they still run like new.  We quickly bought the bigger available battery for both.  Charge them immediately after use. The biggest negative is that they have an internal circuit breaker that cuts out the power when going up steep hills.  Then you have to wait about a minute for cool-off to get going again.  Also, the mufflers can get knocked off - they pop right back on again.  The grandsons like them a lot.  It was a good purchase.

title: Perego John Deere Tractor & Trailer
text: I bought this tractor for our grandkids to play with when they visit.  So far just our 2 yr. old grandson has played on it and he LOVES it.  He thinks the radio is the neatest thing, has to have it on and playing loud when he rides the tractor.  It has 2 forward speeds and it didn't take the grandson long to relize that and want it in high speed.  My husband has a John Deere tractor so our grandson was excited that it looked just like his papa's.  He rides all over our place, driveway (which is partly gravel & pavement), dirt,grass and up & down the hill we have in the back yard.  Our granddaughter is 1 - she can't reach the petal to make it go yet but loves to sit on it.

text: This is the 3rd one that I have bought for my grand children and have had no problems. They love them.

title: Product made from plastic and is not durable.  Product arrived damaged. (Replaced by Amazon)
text:
My wife and I had ordered this tractor for our 4 year old boy, with the expectation that it would be somewhat durable. This is simply not the case. The plastic undercarriage near the front wheels has separated (broken), and the right front wheel is no longer parallel to the tractor frame. This gives the wheel the appearance that it is well out of camber and caster. Our son weighs less than 40 Lbs., and he has been monitored since he began using this tractor 3 days ago. My wife constructed this tractor (new-in-box), and she claims that the front right wheel has been askew since the tractor arrived. This leads us to believe that it came damaged from the factory, or in transit from the factory. My wife claims that the box that this tractor arrived in was not damaged. As I've seen the materials used in the contruction of this tractor, I can say that it isn't meant to last. Save your money and purchase something a bit more rugged.

*UPDATE*. 23 NOV. 2016

Amazon has allowed us to return this faulty tractor and another tractor was mailed to us at no charge. The replacement tractor is in working order, with no issues. Thanks Amazon!

I highly recommend.

title: made a little cheaply, but my son loves it
text: I got this for my 2 year old and he loves it so far.  It was pretty simple to assemble and we've had no trouble with it functioning going on 3 months now.  My only complaint is the system that holds the hood/battery cover in place.  The black piece with the headlights constantly falls off.  In fact, we just run it without that piece now.  Also, the latch the holds the hood in place is very temperamental and falls off all the time.  We usually just let the hood rest unfastened on the latch.  It could be fixed if you spent 30-45 mins with some epoxy and reinforced certain areas, but my son doesn't seem to care.  Aside from that, the tires are a little slippery when going uphill, but I think any electric riding toy like this would have that problem.

title: Good quality except wheels
text: It is good product , easy to assemble and it has two shifts. It goes fast enough but I really wonder why they make the wheels with plastic instead of rubber .  It looks the wheels will not last long. Otherwise , it can be the top product in that price range .

When she's not in the trailer, my boy is putting sticks, rocks, whatever he can find into the trailer. So far, I have not removed the limiter on the shifter so the tractor is only in 1st gear but I have a feeling I'll take the gear lock off one of these days.

It took my kid a while to figure out that he has to HOLD the shifter in place in order to drive in reverse.

title: Very powerful!
text: I bought 2 of these to leave one at each set of grandparents for our daughter and our nephews and nieces.  Having dealt with battery powered cars before I was not expecting much; but the quality of the build was exceptional and the battery power blew me away.  My daughter is afraid to use high speed because of how fast it is - even on the grass!  It drives around great on cut grass and on sidewalks.  The only negative comment I would say is I wish the wheels had a little rubber on them because on any hard surface the wheels just want to spin because of the speed and torque the motor puts out.

title: Assembly Nightmare
text: Okay so in terms of the tractor, I love it! My almost 3 year old son flies around the backyard in this thing and I loved the 2 speed choices. Everything seems very sturdy and the battery holds a long charge. Why 4 stars and not 5? The assembly…….woof. The instructions seem like they were written by a John Deere intern who forgot his assignment and wrote them on his way to work. Vague, no words, zero helpful pictures, just awful. Luckily some fellas in England made a series of assembly videos that I found on YouTube, otherwise Santa Clause was not going to get this thing together in time!!

The only problem we had, and it doesn't really qualify as a problem, was that the instructions are only pictures. Most times a picture is worth a thousand words, but sometime you need a word or two.

title: Great for the farm!
text: This little tractor will go, go, go. We purchased this for our 3 year old grandson and he has used it daily. In fact, it is his favorite ride on. All the others have gone to the toy graveyard. He has driven this tractor all over the farm every day since July 3, 2013. It has gone through the pastures, up and down our 1/4 mile dirt driveway, and into the woods on our mountain bike trails. He has used the trailer to hauls loads of masonry bricks and loads of sand and it is still going strong. The only reason I am giving this a 4 star is the front grill came off day one and the hood doesn't sit quite right. It is definitely made of cheap plastic. Mechanically speaking, it is rock solid. I would highly recommend getting the second battery. We purchased the larger battery which has more life and actually gives it a bit more power.

title: Damaged upon unboxing.
text: I had damage to the trailer when I inboxed it. I noticed the supports for the wheels on the trailer were not straight. I then noticed that the plastic is cracked at the seam by both wheel supports. This is going to break quickly.  Also, we did not receive the latch for the hood.

title: Best toy ever
text: I was hesitant to spend so much money on this item, but I am glad I did.  My son has used it daily for the past two years.  He hauls toys in the trailer.  It has been extremely durable and drives on both grass and pavement with ease.  It easily climbs the rolling hills of our Tennessee home.  The battery life is excellent as long as you charge it after each usage.  At two years, I have had to replace the rear tires and one of the drive motors, but this was only due to the abnormally heavy use by my son.  He actually wore holes in the tires.  The repair was really easy, and parts are readily available online.

title: Difficult assembly but worth it
text: Gave this to our 3 year old grandson for Christmas. He loves it!  The assembly was not easy. One set of stickers was missing and when my husband called support he was told those stickers had been eliminated but the instructions weren’t updated. He had to call support again when trying to assemble the steering column. Simply, someone that was not mechanically inclined and/or didn’t have access to good tools wouldn’t have been able to complete the assembly. He had to re-drill some of the holes. It seems to run well, and like I said, our grandson loves it. We are still trying to figure out how to install the batteries for the radio, it looks like the steering column will have to be removed. 😳 I can’t comment on battery life as it has been taken to our grandsons home.

title: Expensive but worth it!
text: This has been a great ride for my 3 year old. He absolutely loves it! Battery last a good long time and it goes almost anywhere. He has enjoyed it now for several months. Battery/charger still going strong. Only one tiny complaint, the built in radio should have an auto shutoff.

title: Obsession!
text: My 5 year-old is obsessed with his new tractor. It takes some time to put together. There are words that accompany the picture instructions at the back of the tractor pamphlet; be sure to follow the written instructions!

title: John Deere stickers don’t mean John Deere-like quality.
text: Instructions not clearest for every step. Struggled with some parts due to inexact dimensions/tolerances, especially steering wheel-to-shaft assembly (rod slightly short) and wagon hitch pin (won’t lock because too tight). Screw in parts bag bent upon arrival. Design a bit wonky when you have to take off steering wheel to access radio unit which will require battery change at some point. Seems durable. Easy to recharge.
My son loves his tractor- and it is surprisingly very fast. The little am/fm radio has a nice loud speaker. Not too much static either! Worth every penny

title: Five Stars
text: My grand kid loves his lawnmower just like grandpas

title: UPDATE: Did not ship with a battery charger. Fun discovery on xmas eve!
text:
UPDATE: Moving from 1 to 4 stars. The company did mail me a charger at no cost to me after providing my receipt. This process was a pain (not having a charger for over a week), but they did make it right. The ride on is pretty powerful and my daughter loves it. I do wish it had rubber on the wheels, however, as it slides a lot in the grass when wet.

OLD:
I ordered this for my daughter for Christmas. When I opened up the box on Christmas Eve to assemble, I discovered that they did not include a charge in the box, as promised.

Instead, I got a duplicate bag of accessories, as seen in the photo.

Quite the fun experience to realize this hours before Christmas morning. Thanks a ton Peg Perego.

Will update review if they solve the issue.

After spending a couple hours assembling, following all instructions, and letting it charge for the full 18 hours, I learned that only one of 3 gears works and only one of the 2 rear tires turns. The one back tire will spin in second gear, but nothing happens in first gear or reverse. This item is also not returnable, so be wary when ordering.

title: Good for work...needs PTO
text: Great tractor.  My twin 5 year old girls use them to work in the new yard.  One pulls a Brinly spike aerator and the other a tine dethatcher.  Both have plenty of torque in gear 1 to pull the implements with ease.  Gear 2 will stand these tractors up on their back wheels if you step down on them.  I am installing a belly hitch on them thid s weekend so we should have that problem solved.  Remember that your kids will need flashers and an orange triangle to drive these on public roads.  We really like these but are a bit disappointed that there is not a live PTO option.

title: Best present!
text: This was a Christmas present from 2014 for my 2 year old.  He's now over 3 and it is still a daily favorite!  Second gear was reserved until he got the steering mastered (took a month or so bc he was just 2) but now he has the freedom to choose his speed.  He loves cruising in second gear, which is quite quick- faster than my speed walk!  The trailer is detachable and easy enough to do.  The steering and breaking(removing foot from gas) is responsive.  It's tough as it has been crashed into things on purpose and shows no damage.  And it's fun!  Even I can drive it if I have to park it in the garage or something... Or race my son around with him driving his smaller, crappier quad!  FYI I'm approx 120 lbs.  Long story short my son loves it and I'm happy with its quality and safety as well!  If you have a child that likes tractors, or wants to be like daddy get this!
