title: My son loves this tractor, but....
text:
My 2 and 1/2 year old loves this thing! It's sturdy made, and has two speeds. Easy to drive. I give it 3 stars bc the battery quit working after only 5 uses. It got to the point were we would charge it over night just waiting for the green light to come on, meaning it was done, and it never did. We put it in the tractor and nothing. It's awful to spend this much on the tractor and then have to buy a replacement battery too.
Despite the battery issue, this is an awesome ride on toy!

title: Love the tractor but not the battery
text: I bought this about 2 years ago & am so glad I did. However, the first year, the battery never lost its charge. The next year was awful. I have purchased 3 batteries online & one locally, thinking that I was getting bad merchandise. I even purchased a new charger thing that was the problem. My grandson went from using 1st gear the first year & graduated up the 2nd gear the second year. We take the tractor out after a 48 hour charge & it last maybe 10 minutes and that is pushing it. Second gear drains the battery. If you are going to make such items with more than one gear you should also sell the correct parts to make this purchase work correctly. No longer as happy as I was.

title: It has great traction in the dirt and on pavement
text: I bought this tractor for my 3 year old and he loves it! It has great traction in the dirt and on pavement. The materials that it's made of are tough and durable. I live in the Desert and the sun has not effected the plastic at all. I haven't had any problems with the hood staying on or breaking. The trailer is just as great as the tractor and actually holds quite a bit of weight. The battery life has been excellent. The only issue we have had is the "gas" pedal. It is a little tough for smaller kids to push down. Overall this is an excellent product.

title: I like this. My son is 2
text:
In general, I like this. My son is 2.5 but very short. He wants to ride so badly, but gets scared when it jumps. He also has some coordination issues which I think is due to his size. I would say this would be best for a 3 year old or older.

What dropped my rating from a 4 to a 3 are two things. The first is the wheels. I know that need to be light to increase battery life, but the minute he accidentally steers off the driveway pavement he gets stuck in the grass. The plastic wheels have no traction. This is fine if he stays on the driveway, but I wanted him to be able to drive around the property. We have lots of grassy hills and I worry about the safety.

The second factor that made me give a 3 is the trailer. It is not attached and I really wanted to use it. I couldn't even put the trailer together because the axle was wonky. It is just sitting in the garage in a pile.

title: Best Gift We've Ever Bought
text: We purchased this tractor with trailer for our grandson's 3rd birthday.  He hopped on it and took off with very little instruction from us on how to make it work.  He drives it for hours on end; loads the trailer with toys, or when he's "helping" his granddad, he carries granddad's tools in the trailer and takes them where granddad needs them.  The battery holds a charge well, and is good for many hours of use.  Our grandson is almost 4 now, and we have bought a backup battery which we keep charged.  Now that he is a little older, we have shown him "2nd gear" -- which allows the tractor to go faster.  That seems to use up more of the battery charge, and after a few hours of 2nd gear, we have to swap out the battery.  (That may be simply because the original battery is almost a year old and has certainly given us excellent service up to this point.)  This vehicle is less expensive than most I've seen, and as best I can tell, it is just as good, if not better, than any other battery operated vehicle available.

title: Our son loves it
text:
Pros:
It goes pretty fast, seems durable for what it is, and has some nice features. It went together pretty quickly (maybe an hour or so from start to finish). It has a working radio that our son loves to crank up.
Has spot for an extra battery if you have multiple kids who want to take turns, or if they want to ride it for more than an hour.
It drives through dirt and mud pretty good for a toy.

Cons:
It is made out of plastic, but what isn't these days? As long as it is not abused (jumping on the hood/bumper or ramming into things) it should hold up for a long time.
Wagon is cheaply made, but our son loves to pick up grass or rocks and put it in the back; it obviously isn't made to tow firewood or anything, but works fine for what it is.

title: Battery life leaves a lot to be desired
text:
My three year old loves his tractor, but the battery will only hold a charge for about an hour and then takes all night to recharge. We have ordered another battery, so hopefully that will help.

Update: we have had this tractor now for 6 months and the tires are splitting.

title: She thinks my tractors.......... well built!
text:
My son is absolutely enthralled with his tractor. He is three years old and is able to use the product as intended without issues. The tractor is solidly built and well constructed. Although my son has only used the product for a few hours, he has adequately run it through the paces. There is enough power even in low to get him out of tight spots and the turning radius is fairly tight. The steering is easy to use.

Pros: Solid construction, lockout mechanism to keep the tractor in low speed while the child learns how to use it, stable wheel base, reactive gas pedal (stops almost instantly, FM radio is fun for the kiddos (not so much the parent),.

Cons: Battery doesn't last as long as the manufacturer states, however I think this would depend on the terrain, the tractor hitch on ours is impossible to get off and was nearly impossible to attach the trailer too. I had to shave some of the plastic stopper off to attach the trailer correctly.

title: Awesome
text:
Bought this for my 18mo old for Christmas (2016). Easy to put together. Holds a charge for a long period of use and charges quickly. Radio is quite loud (both a pro and a con now that my son can turn it on himself). Easy to drive. 2 speeds is nice (so I don't always have to run after him).

Now that he is 2yrs old he is having a blast riding this around the yard, driveway and neighborhood.

Hope this toy will continue to deliver years of fun!

title: Easy setup- item came with broken gears
text:
The unit was easy to put together. My advice before putting the unit together is to check to ensure that the unit works in 1,2, and Reverse. My unit out of the box could only go in second gear and would only allow the rear left tire to spin. I have contacted customer support via there website. If they follow up with the replacement I will change review. It seems that this might be an issues with several units manufactured in the past few months as there are very similar reviews with the same issues.

Update
Customer support was very responsive and guided me through troubleshooting. One of the motor wires came loose so I needed to put it in place.

All of the screws were in one bag and not labeled.  So I had to guess which screws I needed to use each time. I would have given this item a five star review if the instructions had been better. It took about an hour and a half for me to put the tractor together. It seems to run well and my son loves it.

title: Delivery time from Amazon is unreal......!!!!
text: First off, I ordered this tractor from Amazon on Sunday, early evening.  It was sitting in my house Tuesday morning and it was free shipping.  I am stunned at the speed of the delivery.  I must say, I think a lot of this could have already been put together, but hey, I've got the time and if you follow instructions CAREFULLY, it's not that hard to put together.  The little AM radio is very cool and works really well.  Parts were all there and tomorrow, the decals go on.  It's on it's first 18 hours charge, so can't talk yet about the actually running of this tractor, but I'm confident it will be fine because of all the great previous reviews.  I will buy a second battery, a larger one, and use this one for the spare.  That way when the grand kids run the battery low, I can quickly put in the other battery and they are on their way.

title: Grandson LOVED it!!!
text: I was on Amazon looking for something and for whatever reason, a picture of this John Deere tractor popped up. My grandson saw it and it was all over. He was OBSESSED!!! He would not stop talking about it for DAYS. This was in September, so Christmas was a ways away. We decided to get it for him as an early Christmas present. He did not want to stop riding it. It is very well made. Assembly was straight forward.  Although there was a lot of stickers to apply, which should have already been put in place before it left the factory. The only other issue was the hitch for the attachment of the wagon took a great deal of fooling with before we finally got it to stay in place. But overall, it is a very high quality toy and with the 2 speeds, he will continue to enjoy for at least a couple of years to come,  if not more.

title: Great little tractor
text: I purchased this for my two year old grandson for Christmas.  After searching for the best motorized car for two year olds, this is what I settled on.  It was fairly easy to assemble, but was missing a few very specific screws, so my husband had to improvise using what he had.  All worked ok and Christmas wasn’t ruined.  Our little guy can reach the pedals and can make it go, but it will probably be a few months before he can comfortably drive it.  I think by summer this will be his favorite toy.  It doesn’t have a remote control feature, but does have a safety feature where he can only ride it in the lowest gear for now.  I can’t speak to battery life, as it is still very new.  So far, I am very happy with this purchase.

title: Poor manufacturing
text:
We received the Ground Force John Deere tractor with tailor as a Christmas gift for our son. Upon putting the product together, we encountered a number of road blocks.

1. The directions are poorly outlined: there is no parts listing to indicate how many of each part is included, the listing is located in a separate manual. When screws are used, there is not indication as to which screws to use as 5 came in the parts bag; 2 medium and 3 smaller ones. We had to guess and hope for the best.

2. A step (10) was listed that we had no idea what to do.

3. There was NO hole drilled for the gas cap so we had to drill one.

4. One of the buttons on the radio was stuck in.

5. When snapping in a few of the decal items, holes where not drilled completely through.

6. The trailer was very difficult to attach to the tractor.

If we had purchased this our self we would be sending it back. Disappointing for being made in the USA.

title: My 3y old loves this tractor. So far we ...
text: My 3y old loves this tractor. So far we have it locked into the low speed since he's still learning the logistics of steering and reverse. My main problem (and the reason it's only getting 3 stars) is that the wires under the seat keep getting knocked loose. He hasn't ridden over any sticks, bumps, curbs etc, only flat grassy areas, and after about 20 mins of riding the wire comes loose. We actually discovered this after thinking the charge ran out, charging, and trying g again for it not to work. Amazon' return policy for this stinks so we decided to take it apart and see what we could find. You have to unscrew the seat and there are 4 wires. One of ours continues to come dislodged every time he rides. It's a pain in the neck but not a deal breaker. We just keep a Philips head screwdriver outside with the charger.

title: Great Toy......Horrible Product
text:
This tractor is a great toy!! This tractor is a horrible product!!
I have purchased approximately 500 items from Amazon; this is the first I have ever written. The reviews for the Peg-Pergo John Deere Farm Power were very helpful when I was deciding what to purchase for my 3 year old son’s b-day. I hope to return the favor. The tractor is a great toy in that my son loves it. It is, without a doubt, the best gift he has ever received. It is a horrible product due to the fact that pieces started falling off and/or breaking in less than a week of using it. For the price, I expected it to be fairly durable. I was wrong!!

Pros:
* Son loves it, he has to play with it everyday
* Safe
* All four tires are very rugged, not the “slick” tires that was mentioned in a previous post
* Trailer is a great accessory and easy to take off/put on

Cons:
* The front headlight housing and the clip that holds the hood down fall off multiple times/day. This is unacceptable.
If I pay $300 for something, I expect it to stay intact for longer than a week.
* The assembly instructions are the worst I have ever tried to follow. The step-by-step visual instructions (all pics) starts on
page 2 of the owner’s manual. The step-by-step text instructions start on page 10. Why separate the two? When
assembling, I had the text instructions on my iPad the visual instructions from the provided manual.
* Installing the steering wheel was horrible. I spent as much time on the steering wheel assembly as I did the rest of the
tractor.
* Put the stickers on FIRST!! You will save yourself a lot of headaches if you do.

if I had it to do over again, would I still buy it? Yes, even though it falls apart everyday, my son absolutely loves it.

title: Takes a licking and delivers on the fun
text: We bought this John Deere ride on tractor and trailer for our first grandson when he turned two - a few months too soon.  It was easy to assemble, except for the steering wheel which is a little tricky. His little brother was born about that same time, and two years later we bought him a matching tractor and trailer.  Both tractors are still running great.  These are by far the best toys we’ve ever bought.  They’re ridden for hours at a time over a rough backyard, with the trailers piled high with stones, sticks, toys and dirt.  They can be recharged in 3 to 4 hours but we usually do that overnight.  The tractor exhaust breaks off quickly pretty quickly when the kids yank on it.  No big loss.  The only design issue is the trailer chassis. It takes a pretty good beating if the boys carry heavy hard objects,  but it still lasts a year or more.  In time, the chassis pegs wear out and the trailer comes loose from the chassis.  Where the wheel axel snaps into the chassis also wears out. However, both problems are resolved by getting a replacement chassis ($10) which snaps right on. Note: 2nd gear is too fast for younger inexperienced drivers, so keep it locked out until they’ve had time to get comfortable.  The tractors are very stable, but a  two-year-old could easily fall off if they took a turn too fast.

title: Updated: major parts are missing from the box
text:
Update 12/29/21: I am changing my review to 4 stars due to the great customer service at Peg Perego. Also, I contacted Amazon regarding all the missing parts and they were great as well. I'm disappointed that the product arrived basically pilfered by a previous customer (?) and it affected my purchase and experience, and Peg Perego seems like a solid company with a good product. If you order this, just be sure to check all the contents in the box. There is a diagram in the middle of the instruction booklet that shows you all parts.

title: Great offloading tractor wish it had rubber tires
text:
[[VIDEOID:805cb2d0cdadace36f077379920edf7f]] Okay so this is a pretty impressive power wheel. I wish had rubber tires instead of plastic for better traction but only real complaint

Battery- when full charges lasts about 2 hours in 1st gear. If 2nd gear used last about an hour

Offroading-does amazing at our farm. Check of the video has great power goes up and down hills no problem. Goes through some snow and standing water but obviously not anything too deep.

Charging- we have both regular and bought fast charger. Fast charger charges Iin 2 hours bur I've heard if you alternate the chargers it kills the battery. Unsure if this is true.

Radio- runs off 2 AA batteries however yo replace you have to take whole steering column off which is annoying. Radio gets okay reception. Wish just had up and down scan button versus up and reset. Reset starts at beginning and my 2 year old will push it constantly. When it resets it gets static

Overall great product. My son loves it

I was a little disappointed that the manual did not identify which of the various size screws went where but I figured them out and very close to completion I found a separate sheet of paper with pictures showing what fasteners went where. Several sheets of paper accompany the manual. Look at them all. The battery is going through its initial charge right now so my 5 year old(today) hasn’t driven it yet. I’m a 73 year old retired engineer and have assembled many items for my children and now grandson. This is one of the better ones.  If it operates like it went together, I’ll be very happy.

title: Broken parts upon arrival
text:
Broken parts upon arrival. A pre installed part came snapped off. While putting the item together there was an extra piece not in the directions to install. In order for us to fix this part, which secures the hood in place, we would have to take pre installed parts apart possible creating more damage. The part also has damage to its snap in clips, so even if we could fix it is a broken part. Hopefully I can get some help from customer service to see what can be done. This toy is too expensive to receive broken.
Item # SPST9121N BROKEN
Item # SPST9117JDVB BENT

Also their link on Amazon for their website has not been updated... use the one on the instructions.

title: Poor quality and defective - buy at your own risk
text:
This toy is very cheaply made and putting it together is a pain. First thing I noticed when taking it out of the box was that the seat was missing the left armrest. That should have been my warning to put it back in the box and return it. If a company's quality assurance is so bad that they cannot see an armrest literally missing from the seat when they put it in the box, that shows a lot about the quality. Since it was my son's birthday the next day I decided to continue putting it together and just call support to try to get a replacement armrest. Being an engineer I typically have no problems putting things together as I'm careful to follow the instructions. I have to say though that these instructions were horrible and very difficult to follow. Once I did get it together (don't even get me started on trying to get the steering wheel bolted on) and tried it out I discovered that the "R" gear made the tractor go forward and the 1 and 2 gears made it go in reverse. The manufacturer had wired it incorrectly. I was ultimately able to trace the wires to the two motors and switch the wires on each. That fixed the problem. I wonder though how many people that purchase this will have an electrical engineering degree and be able to make such repairs. Other than that, I found the radio buttons do not work and it won't pick up any stations so it is worthless. We have a battery operated pickup from another manufacturing that has a radio on it and it gets quite a few stations so I know that it is a problem with the tractor's radio.

Back to the armrest - I called the support number provided but they told me I needed the order number that was on the pick ticket (and not the Amazon order number). They said it should have been in the box (it wasn't). They couldn't therefore help me. I ended up having to pay $17.00 plus $10.50 shipping to get a new seat for it.

I will say my son does love it (as he loves anything John Deere). The tires do not have very good traction as he spins out every time he starts off. The wagon is cute but very flimsy so you wouldn't want to put much in it for fear of breaking it. We haven't had it long enough to determine the battery life. I'm assuming as flimsy as it is that it might be broken by the time the battery starts to wear down.

If you plan on buying this, I hope you know someone with an electronics degree to help you fix the wiring and are prepared to pay extra for the parts they forget to include and you will eventually have to replace when they break because of their poor quality!

I also tried to register for warranty online but their warranty site does not work. Not sure I would buy another Per Perego product. I hate to think what issues I will have if I have a warranty issue in a few months. In my opinion a warranty is only as good as the service you recieve when you call in.  They had never heard of Plum Struck as a retailer for their product, and that did not make me fell comfortable with my purchase. However my 3 year old likes the tractor and it is easy to operate.

title: Peg Perego NEVER AGAIN!
text: We purchased this for our son a year ago because he LOVES tractors and we wish we NEVER did!!  First, he LOVES it but we do not. This is our 6th battery operated vehicle we've bought for our kids (mostly Power Wheels (Escalade, Super Shock Dirt Bikes, and Quads all of them have lasted years and have no damage)  and the most expensive. It is JUNK!!  The first week; the grill fell off and we could never get it to stay on. The hood is impossible to open to get the battery out and eventually we broke it. The trailer doesn't unhitch properly unless by luck. The radio stopped working after a couple of months. Don't bump anything with it or something will break!  Now the battery doesn't work and it's not even a year old.  I didn't return it sooner because my son loves it but today I called Peg Perego and they have a 6 month warranty on the tires, battery, and something else but nothing to assist us. I'm going to sell this on a public website and buy our son a better quality tractor. Never AGAIN Peg Perego and I would never recommend this to a friend!!

title: So happy with purchase!
text:
This tractor is AMAZING! It has surprised us every time our 3 year old rides. it. The first day he rode it was after a heavy rain. I was amazed at the traction it possessed and the areas it was able to get through. I was for sure I would have to drag it out of areas but he just pushed the gas and went. The tires on this one are great for getting around uneven ground and up and down hills. My son picked the forward/reverse up fast. The speed adjustments make me feel better so he doesn't go to fast now and we can bump it up as he becomes a better driver.
Assembly took about an hour, and this was with my son begging to ride it right then =) Adding all the stickers took almost as long as putting it all together.
It takes 18 hours for original charge but battery has seemed to keep a good charge. He has rode it about 8 hours now and it doesn't seem to be slowing down any.
I love having the radio as much as he does. Nice to have it when working in the yard. It picks up as many stations as a car radio.
I would highly recommend this tractor to anyone who is looking for one for their child. It is more than some of the others but I can tell it is built to last and have loved watching how excited my son is every time he gets to ride it. His smile is well worth every penny!
Also recommend the John Deere Tool box set...he loves "working" on his tractor...great gift combo!

title: Unsafe braking feature on any hill, enough to scare my child from ever using this again!
text:
We've had this toy for nearly 6 months, and at first we used it mostly on perfectly flat land with good results. Once we began to use this on small hills, we noticed two major, unsafe problems.

First, in the slow mode only one tire drives, allowing the drive wheel to lose traction, which results in the tractor losing traction and dangerously rolling backwards or sideways with no braking in other tires.

Even worse is the "automatic braking" feature. In the direction of travel, the braking stops the tractor on level ground but doesn't stop with enough force to stop the tractor when on a downgrade. When traveling uphill, if the child lets off the accelerator, the tractor has no reverse braking function and lets the tractor enter an uncontrolled backward roll that the tires are unable to stop once moving if/when the accelerator is re-applied due to the tire's poor traction. My child took a spill and was nearly injured, and now will no longer use this toy.

It is a nice design with good intention, but I am forced to give this a 1 star review because it is inherently unsafe anywhere other than perfectly flat ground. With an age rating of 2-7 years, this should be considered a safety hazard and needs to be recalled. I am considering reporting this to the consumer products safety commission. I would appreciate a response from the manufacturer.

text: Was loved for two weeks and then out of no where the charger stopped working.  No power at all.  It was stored in the garage and charged every night as per instructions.  Not happy to have to buy another charger.  What poor quality.

title: Love this tractor!
text: We love this tractor! Bought it for our sons 3rd Birthday and it was an absolute hit. He wants to ride it everyday. Took him a while to get comfortable with 2nd gear since it’s pretty fast, but that’s about the only gear he drives in now! He loves to haul things in the wagon too. It took my husband a little over an hour to put together. The battery charges very quickly and easily. We usually plug it in after each use and it’s good to go for next time. The little radio is hit or miss where we live. Sometimes you can get a station to work and sometimes not, but our son still thinks it’s fun to play with. Overall, we are extremely happy with our purchase! It arrived a lot quicker than expected. We have definitely gotten our money’s worth!

title: Goes pretty faster.
text: My 4 year old grandson  absolutely loves  this tractor he runs in like Dad runs  his. All I can day say I'd recommend it to any 3_ 4 years old

title: Has a good amount of power on hills
text: Bought for my grandson. Has a lot of power for he hills

title: Poweful
text:
Bought this for my Grandson for his 3rd birthday. It was perfect !
Great power w/the 12 volt battery, has 2 different speeds and reverse which he learned to use easily. The working radio is a cool extra.
Battery last but you have to charged after every use in order to guarantee enough time in it.
It did come in quite a few pieces but only took my husband about 45 mins to put together.
My grandson weighs 38 lbs and had no issues.

title: Plastic
text: I knew it was made of plastic, but it broke apart within 2 minutes. The front panel came off after my son hit something by accident.  That piece will not go back on.  It runs fine, but should be assembled better!

title: Fun and fast!
text: My child loves this! Super easy to assamble, fast and powerful. My only complaint is the hinge on the trailer is hard to attach and unattach.

title: Awesome tractor
text: This thing never ceases to amaze me!!! Awesome for being battery powered.

title: Five Stars
text: My grandson loves it!!

title: 2 year old drives this tractor with no problems.
text: Tractor was a gift for our 2 year old grandson's birthday.  He loves it, drives it all around outside, drives it in rocks, grass and paved driveway.  He figured out quickly the reverse option and loves the radio on.  Everything so far is working beautifully for him. A great gift.

title: Wheels crack!!
text: Very disappointing as you can see the wheel cracked and my son cant ride it anymore. I expect customer service to get back to me ASAP!!

title: Not worth your time or money and cheaply built.
text: Assembly instructions was NOT user friendly and had multiple parts to assemble. All the parts were not in the box so I had to call to request the parts, still did not get them all AND had to deal with a rude customer service person.Cheaply built for the price and some parts keep popping off. Looks cute but is not durable nor worth your time and money.

title: No Durability
text:
Got this tractor for my son 1 week ago. Within an hour, the smoke stack was off and kept falling off every time we put it back on. The front grill pops off because the plastic clips holding it in are pretty flimsy. The hood is difficult to unlock to get the battery out. Again, because it's so flimsy, the little plastic piece holding it in sometimes does not work.

The radio did not work right out of the box. I had to call PP and have a new radio sent. The metal bar that holds the battery in cracked immediately, so they sent a new one of those too. With the battery life being so short, it's a pain in the a** to undo the hood and screw off the battery every two hours...gets pretty tedious.

My son loves the tractor even though it seems to be losing pieces regularly. He loves zipping around the property in it. I just think that for the price, it should hold up better. I love PP strollers; they are incredibly safe, reliable, and well-made. I expected the same from this product and did not get it.

title: Lots of prep, but worth the effort
text: My grandson loves this riding lawnmower!  My only caution is to allow for plenty of time to put it together.....many, many pieces!

title: Five Stars
text: Great tractor, my two year old Loves it.

title: Great gift idea!
text: My son loves his tractor!!!  Putting it together was easy.  Better to assemble it with two people.

title: Okay
text:
It was very difficult to assemble.
The trailer to it also never attached properly. It would always fall out when my son would put it on the “fastest mode”. The yellow “rim” would fall off and cause the other parts to fall apart. Overall, the rest of the product is great.

title: Works great
text: Runs great!  There was a bit of it that was difficult to put together...directions are a bit vague at times.

title: Five Stars
text: Great. Purchased for my 3 year old and is perfect

title: Works on different terrains, has some pep.
text: Grandson rode it around our farm and yard.  Loves it.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
My almost 4 year old loves it and has been asking to drive it every day since we unveiled it to him 3 days ago. He is taller than average so the tractor looks small. Luckily he can use the seat on the low (closer to the steering wheel) setting so he can easily get 2 more years on it. The plastic tires have good traction on grass and performs decently on patio stones as well. After just 3 days, I can already see wear on the plastic tires, curious to see how long they will last.

Pros:
- great looking tractor, colors are amazing and true to John Deere brand
- radio is awesome and surprisingly loud
- long lasting lead acid battery, on a single charge my son drove it for 3 days totalling ~1 hour use
- seat is comfortable for toddler and two settings accommodate growing legs
- good pulling power, easily carry small tree stumps in the wagon

Cons:
- product pictures are deceiving, it's not a big vehicle at all
- assembly instructions were confusing and I had to refer to both diagrams and text which are on different pages
- reversing with the wagon attached causes jacknifing and lots of strain on the wagon's plastic connector
- pretty much everything is made of plastic, with the exception of steering wheel column and wheel axles
- radio does not remember last station after power cycling

title: Five Stars
text: Fabulous riding toy!

title: Great tractor!
text: We bought the tractor for my grandson. He’s 2 yrs old and he really loves it. We keep it at the 1st speed for him. It’s worth the money.

title: Love it
text: My 2 1/2 year old loves this tractor. Much nicer than previously purchase ride on toys. It drives through just about anything. It does not hesitate and drives through the yard with ease. Would highly recommend it if you have a child that loves tractors.

title: Great power
text: My grandson loves this tractor. It was easy to assemble, and has great traction. Our yard is hilly, so the battery only lasts a little over an hour. I would seriously recommend buying an extra.

title: My kids love it! Unfortunately
text:
Purchased this about a year ago. My kids love it! Unfortunately, the battery goes pretty quickly when driven in 2nd gear. This is pretty powerful. I have even driven it when putting it away and I am a 125lb adult.
The trailer is okay but not very well built. The hinge part is so week that my kids broke it only a couple weeks after owning the tractor. It's just very weak and flimsy. We don't even use the trailer anymore.

title: Well built
text: Son loves this ride on. Battery life is pretty good for an 8ah battery. Overall very pleased with this purchase.

title: Too Cute!
text: It looks so realistic. My child is going to love it when he gets it on Christmas Day.  I think my favorite part is it has a radio.

title: Horrendous assembly
text:
While this now is bringing my child tons of enjoyment, this couldn’t have been more of a pain to our together. Pieces didn’t snap in where they were supposed To snap in. Pictures were horrible to
Follow. Steering cooling took way longer than it should have to put on. Don’t wait until
The hour before to put this together, you’ll regret it.
